Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 2 day conference. Roms are very nice, comfortable, good desk and work area. If your conference does not provide free wi fi, then $12.95/day. Good access to the waterfront/seaport village area. Close to airport. Walking distance to gaslamp district The layout of the hotel is not conducive to large conferences (>500). You end up hiking back and forth between the towers to get between large and smaller breakout rooms. As otehrs have mentioned the Starbucks and lounge facilities are quite small and easily overwhlemed with even small numbers of people

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Cyclone13
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 5 nights during a conference that was being held at this hotel. It has a good location along the bay within walking distance to the shops and restaurants of Seaport Village and the Gaslamp district. I cannot say enough good things about the hotel staff -- everyone I encountered was very friendly and happy to help/answer questions. I was always met with a smile. I had called prior to checking in to request an early check-in and a bay-view room. The hotel accommodated those requests without hesitation. I also asked if a colleague could be placed in a room close to mine and this was also granted. Check-in and check-out went very smoothly. The food at the hotel itself -- DW restaurant and the pool bar -- was mediocre. I ordered tacos twice from the bar. The first time they were fairly good, the second time, I was not impressed. I had asked to order from the "happy hour section" on the menu, which is advertised to be available from 5-7 pm. I would have paid more to eat from this section for dinner, but was told that those items are only available in that two hour window. I found the lunch menu at DW to be rather limited. The salad I ordered was average and the service was somewhat slow. The meal I ate at Roy's, behind the hotel, was excellent. I wish I had found that restaurant earlier. I also had good luck with a seafood restaurant further along the bay. The close proximity to the walking/jogging path behind the hotel was great. The pool area could get somewhat noisy at night even though the pool is supposed to close at 11. It never prevented me from sleeping, but I did notice it. My room overlooked the pool from the 12th floor. I would imagine a room on a lower floor would have had more noise issues. One complaint I have, that is not directly related to the hotel, was a very poor taxi driver that was hailed for me by the hotel bellman. I was trying to get to a local park and the driver had no idea where it was. I showed him two maps on my phone and he still did not know where to go. He charged me for the time he took trying to read the maps. Eventually, I requested that he pull over and ask someone how to get there. I was very frustrated. Again, this is not directly related to the hotel, but I think they should be more choosey regarding which taxi companies service the hotel. I would not use West Coast Taxi again. Overall, it was an enjoyable stay. If I were returning to San Diego, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: jbhouli
Reviews.Content: We had gone to San Diego for a concert at the House of Blues and had a wonderful stay at the Marriott Marquis. Our room was in the South Tower with a beautiful view of the harbor and the sunset over Point Loma. The room was well appointed with a very comfortable bed. However I do have to mention that the bath towels have seen better days and need to be upgraded as they were rough and scratchy and not at all the fluffy, soft towels we usually find in Marriotts. The pool area was wonderful....the perfect place to hang out with a book on the warm October weekend we visited. We weren't there for very long before someone came by to take our drink order -- great service. The location was great within walking distance of the restaurants and nightlife of the gaslamp district and Seaport Village. This hotel will be at the top of our list next time we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep, great staff, but $$$ for Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: EdDebTucson
Reviews.Content: This is not my usual hotel, due to the expense. Was on business. Review: most importantly, I slept very well. I have problems getting to sleep and staying asleep, so to me the primary mission of a hotel is to facilitate excellent sleep, and my room delivered. I think the light rail trains and the Amtrak did not bother because I was on the 12th floor. Don't know how quiet it is lower than that. The room was the usual size for this type of hotel. I had a beautiful view from my room of the city plus a bit of the water and the Coronado bridge. It was a hassle to go to the lobby to use Wi-Fi. The alternative was to spend $12.95 per day. Location: being right at the Marina, there is great walking, and bikes for rent. Fitness center: they have a trainer in their gym who leads a fabulous Zumba workout, which is not offered often enough. Other: the staff are great: pleasant, helpful, considerate. Can't say enough about them. Food: the breakfast wasn't great, but there is a place within 3 blocks with a more reasonably-priced, great breakfast (I do not eat enough to be impressed by $22 breakfast buffets). Remember, though, most all restaurants in the Gaslamp district are unbelievably expensive, and that is where this hotel is located. Didn't even consider the Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Convention Location: Don't Slam the Door”
Reviews.Author: WilliamTheSilent
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel. It was close to the airport, convention center, gas light district, shopping, etc., etc., etc.... The pool area was very beautiful as well. For the most part, the service was outstanding. The only issue I had was with the service in the north lobby bar area. Granted the place is swarming with conventioneers, but I was not able to get service and went completely ignored all night. I finally bellied up to the bar. Cocktail servers need to go to charm school, or they need more of them as the workload is too much. The room itself was nice, typical of what a business traveler would expect. Depending on your neighbor(s), noise could be a factor. I swear I could hear people peeing five floors up from me. Also, the doors are heavy and they slam if guests are not considerate. I was woken up more than once by slamming doors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Architectandmusician
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adjacent to the Convention Center and the docks, and within easy walking distance of downtown. Room decor was relatively new and pleasant if undifferentiated. Nice touches included a "snooze" setting on the fridge (I often unplug fridges in hotel rooms because they are so noisy) and an occupancy sensor on thennight-light in the bathroom. Front desk staff were helpful and well-informed. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was the Best Part of my Trip!”
Reviews.Author: mkb03
Reviews.Content: There were many places to choose from in San Diego but I am so glad I decided on the Marriott. The staff, from the bar waiters to the conceier were fantastic. The Hotel is so emmaculate. The shower could fit 4 people in it and it was beautiful (not you typical shower with the curtain!)The Comforter and pillows were the best, I looked for a tag with the manufacturer so i could try to by them at home! The pool area was my favorite. Outside there are grouping of chairs (Big Wicker comfy chairs with cushions) that surround a gas fire pit(not exactly a pit, more of a beautiful stone fireplace). You can relax , have a cocktail in the evening. It was great. The outside bar always had the game on and the staff were excellent. They serve Sangria which I love and their nachos are unique and very good. It was great to walk steps outside of the hotel property and be on the boardwalk looking at the bay and Marina and all the beautiful boats and yahts. Just a short walk away is Seaport Village with the quaint boutique shops, resturants and bars. So many beautiful places to walk around the hotel looking at the water. Only a few blocks from Gaslamp district that has more bars and every type of cusine you can imagine. Trolley is right in from of the hotel and took us to Little italy. Very cheap and convienant. Short walk to the Midway and the Ferry that took us to Coronado(beautiful beach, so perfect!) Fridge in the room so you can bring some wine and store it. Every detail was taken care of. Anytime I needed something and asked for it it was addressed immediatley. Marco at the concier desk even charged my IPOD for me! I have already told so many of my friends to take a trip to Sandiego and they HAVE to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for conference, not great for children”
Reviews.Author: LILY45AZ23
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room for duration of our daughter's conference as we wanted to see her & to babysit 8-yr old grandson. Asked for a room in vicinity of theirs (which was bayview & paid by her company) we opted for the less expensive city view; but upon arrival were upgraded & it was adjoining; a real plus- 18th floor; great views. Lovely grounds, 2 pools, nice bar area; food was so-so there. Nothing much for younger children to do. There is a playground nearby also the Children Museum which unfortunately was closed for renovations, so can't comment on that. No comfort foods on location restaurant, need to walk a few blocks to get to family-friendly eateries. Suggest reservations for any place at night to get a nice table & bay view if available.

Reviews.Title: “North Tower is FAR better!”
Reviews.Author: perryspires
Reviews.Content: The last time I was in town I stayed at this Marriott and had a terrible experience with the elevators in the south tower. My previous review states that very clearly. This trip I was in the north tower with a bay view king room. Excellent. Elevators were quick if you didn't go during rush hour. But even if you did, if you take the stairs down one floor toward the fitness center. there is no line and elevators come right away. Food was great as usual. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, great convention and downtown access”
Reviews.Author: mbsef2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention I was attending and found this hotel to be very convienant to the convention center. The property is very large and nicely located in downtown San Diego. Everything is very close and the gaslamp district is just blocks away. The hotel public areas were very nice, well kept and open. The water front was beautiful. The rooms were standard marriot fare, however, the views were stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch all the way. Great service and views!”
Reviews.Author: valor155
Reviews.Content: While it certainly doesn't hurt to have Gold Status with Marriott, this hotel lived up to and exceeded my expectations for business travel. Prompt, courtesy front desk staff. Great selection of food and beverage in concierge lounge. Wonderful views of the bay. They let me check in at 11am (early), no problems. Great workout facility. Fun and relaxing pool and pool bar scene. I enjoyed my stay here. I would take my family here and stay for pleasure as well. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorkTraveler27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights during a conference at the convention center. Location is optimal. Staff is friendly though some verge on obsequious which seems fake. Get a room above the 10th floor because it can get loud around the multiple lagoon like pools and hot tub. Busy when arrived and my room wasn't cleaned as well as it probably could have been. Fine for a business trip not sure about a vacation. Beds were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Randy1956
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to top this hotel. The location right on the bay adjacent to the convention center and the Gaslamp quarter and the baseball stadium a very short walk. The hotel has recently been renovated and rooms, lobby and pool area are all very nice. We live near San Diego and we made a couple of weekend "staycation" stays at this hotel. Check-in was easy and pleasant and we were given a few perks as Marriot Rewards members. We felt very welcomed here. The recent renovation turned out great. The rooms were modern and luxurious, the public areas are upscale and inviting and the pool area has a tropical, relaxing feel. If you get a harbor view room (we were upgraded on one of our visits), the view across the harbor to Coronado and the ocean below is fantastic. The city views are not bad either, looking out to the Gaslamp quarter. We ordered drinks and snacks at the pool and they were good as was the service. We did not try any of the restaurants at the hotel because there are so many very good restaurants just a few blocks away in the Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but if you are not facing marina, bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: Hope1215
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy walk to the Gaslamp district with tons of restaurants and activities; Banquet services: Varied considerably. Banquet mgr of all was fabulous, some events were perfectly orchestrated, others not so much. Rooms: averaged size, adequate outlets. Definitely needed more sound proofing between rooms, and see above comment about trains. Suites- gorgeous view; Foods- wide variety of restaurants near or on premises. Aside from the fact I literally could not sleep through the train noises (hotel was full, couldn't switch room), the location was perfect. Only if I could guarantee a marina side room would I return to this hotel. One more comment for mgmt: Train your staff better. We held 5 events at the hotel and frequently the staff at the main front desk got the room names confused and their locations wrong. I would highly suggest re-naming some of the rooms to avoid the confusion. The hotel is large and with some similar sounding room names, very confusing regarding their respective locations in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: duffeyd
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this hotel. We stayed here in July and it was the perfect hotel. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler at Marriott Marina, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Ronan L
Reviews.Content: Wow--LOVED this hotel. I'm a frequent traveler with Marriott, and this was my first time with the Marriott Marina. Room on the 24th Floor, amazing view, outstanding service, and a STARBUCKS in the lobby! Who could ask for more! :) Stayed for 3 days and really enjoyed it; located in the heart of downtown. Very enjoyable. Now THAT's why I stay with Marriott! :)

Reviews.Title: “Reliably a great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: JAM314
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you could want and more, and has thereby contributed to the enjoyment of our trips to San Diego. With its fantastic location, you are able to walk to anywhere (shopping, restaurants, clubs, baseball stadium, waterfront, convention center). The rooms are comfortable, quiet, and very clean. The views of the San Diego waterfront and Coronado Island are second to none. The lobby and other common areas of the hotel are spacious and inviting. Staff is friendly and personable. The food is even good which I scarcely say for a hotel! And then, there is the pool. Wonderful. The pool area is gorgeous and feels much like a beautiful resort in an exotic and tropical paradise. Huge palm trees, comfortable lawn chairs, two hot tubs, two pools, a bar, firepits, a lagoon, waterfalls... what more can you ask for, really? Our only complaint is the parking fees which are quite high. We will continue to frequent this spot for all of our San Diego escapes!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical escape in the city!”
Reviews.Author: Jerri47
Reviews.Content: Beautiful pool/lagoon area with a great location. Rooms are a little small but nice, worth paying extra for a room with a patio.

Reviews.Title: “Love this impeccable hotel, love San Diego...”
Reviews.Author: YI_IVY
Reviews.Content: Two nights stay at this hotel on business was a treat for myself! There are a lot of reasons why speak so high of this hotel: very comfortable and updated room decor, great bay view from balcony, short walk to convention center and downtown, direct access to the harbor, nice swimming pools for family vacationers and business travelers alike, etc... Among the long list of things I loved about this hotel, the impeccable service stands out. All staff I came to contact with from concierge to waitress at the hotel restaurant was friendly and welcoming which truly made a difference. San Diego is a lovely city that I will look forward to my next visit as well as next stay at Marriott Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Property”
Reviews.Author: kathyngregg
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention in San Diego from 9/1-9/5 and was very pleased with the property, the view of the bay, the location, (and even the price). The entire experience was pleasurable from the entrance of the hotel to the room etc. It's conveniently located near the convention center and a wide assortment of restaurants. The fitness center is well equipped, modern, and clean. The pool stays open until 11:00 PM. The staff is friendly and courteous. What more can you ask for? The internet in the room is NOT complimentary though. It's $12.95 a day. I didn't particularly like that, so I voiced my displeasure, and the fee seems to have been waived as it did not appear on my invoice upon check out. Overall very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TXNnPA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here to celebrate my friend's bday weekend. The hotel was phenomenal. The rooms were spacious and the balcony faced the water. The location was perfect for walking anywhere near Horton Plaza and the downtown area. The trolley also stops right outside the hotel. Concierge was very helpful in their suggestions and there are great eateries nearby. Check out the hotel pool area. It was a great place to sit by the fire pits, have a drink and listen to the live music. When in San Diego again, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too big for its own good.”
Reviews.Author: spacecase84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times for business mostly due to location and the view. Really a good place but its sooo big. Service is not as great due to this. Just lots of litttle things. Parking is trouble and came back several nights to see parking full and was forced to valet. Valet is pretty bad service. My coworkers car came back without a mirror and it took three days for them to admit it was their fault. Hotel management handled this the worst I have ever seen. It was after this that my team decided to move to another hotel. Pool is beautiful and the rooms are clean. I am platinum elite and travel all the time. I have seen much better management of hotels elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel on the Water”
Reviews.Author: JJS3
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are in San Diego. Close to the Gaslight District and (if you are on the west side) with amazing views of the Bay and Navy Base (there are usually at least 1-2 aircraft carriers in port). Rooms are standard fare Marriott - comfortable and what you would expect. Friendly staff. Lots of things to do in the hotel and surrounding area. If you stay here, try and get a room facing the Bay. The best rooms are higher up. Ask for one of the rooms at the end of the hallway in the South Tower - huge glass window facing the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Adventure”
Reviews.Author: ChaChaCha_MI
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property on the water with rooms that have balconies!!! There were times that I enjoyed the relaxation on the balony so much that I didn't want to leave my room. My AAA rate included parking, which was great, but when the desk clerk realized that I had a disability, she upgraded me to valet parking, which was very much appreciated. A wonderful Bellman, Roland, greeted me and assisted me with my luggage. He gave me suggestions for restaurants, bars, sights, etc., as well as pointing out landmarks that were visible from my balcony. I saw him frequently, since I was a guest at the hotel for a week, and he was always smiling and helpful. I was very pleased with this Marriot and loved the location. One great perk is the refrigerator in the room. Roland gave me directions to a grocery store, so I bought fruit, soft drinks and wine to enjoy in my room. I plan to visit San Diego and the Marriott Marquis again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with out paying for it.”
Reviews.Author: victoriaxx2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous! It was very welcoming, clean, exciting. It is in the perfect location, you can walk pretty much any where you want to go from here. The pool area was awesome, it did get crowded because it was 4th of July weekend so you needed to get there early. The restaurants at the hotel were very good, but alittle pricy. There was a cabana restaurant/bar by the pool with fire pits and live music every night. I have nothing bad to say about our expericene here. We had a marina view it was beautiful and great for seeing the fireworks!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel on the Marina”
Reviews.Author: jlfv
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Marina is a very nice hotel. Our room was spacious, attractive and clean. The bed was very comfortable. We had a room facing downtown, which was fine except for the constant clanging of the little railroad crossing. We asked, and were given, a room across the hall, which overlooked the pool. Though it also had exposure to the RR crossing, the pool and AC unit sounds whited out the clang clang - thank you Marriott desk clerk for finding us a new room! The staff was overall very friendly and helpful. When we objected to certain charges on the bill - including a few "we accidentally jostled the mini bar" charges, they were removed promptly. The marina area is great fun for walking, jogging & people watching. Also, check out the "Greatest Generation" walk - lots of moving and fun sculptures (loved the Bob Hope and the sailor's kiss, as well as the soldier hugging his family). The pool is GREAT but they are very strict about towels so pay attention to the "rules" on that. They have an excellent fitness center - one of the best I've seen that didn't require an additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marriott on the Water”
Reviews.Author: cmitch
Reviews.Content: We have been stayed at this hotel as business guests and on vacation. We have enjoyed all of our stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: jhastit
Reviews.Content: If visiting San Diego for any meetings at the Convention Center, you cannot stay any closer than tha Marriott Marina. It also just renovated the pool area, which is now very nice - includes a fun tiki bar with various seating areas that include firepits - great place for sunset/happy hour. Also within walking distance to the GasLamp district, shopping areas, tourist locations along the waterfront, and pick-up for the Old Town Trolley tour on site. Very nice to be able to walk outside the hotel and be right on the waterfront to find restaurants, go for a run, or just enjoy the nice San Diego weather. Hotel has two towers - one has balconies off the rooms and one does not. The only unfortunate thing was being a Platinum Marriott Rewards traveler, I have access to the Concierage Lounge, but the tower that has the lounge/concierage floor is in the tower without the balconies - doesn't make sense to me. Overall, very nice hotel in a great, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “A nice facility, but short on guest service”
Reviews.Author: thegeese
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times over the past 15 or 20 years and have noticed a steady decline in service and a steady increase in prices. The facility itself is nice and has been redone at least once since we first stayed here, but it is no nicer now than the first time we stayed. What is noticeable is the lack of attentiveness to guest needs. Fifteen years ago, guest service was absolutely wonderful; today it is absent. As an example, my wife left the charger cord for her phone in the room. We called them and they wanted $18 to return it to us!!!!! About fifteen years ago, my wife admired some plants in the entry hall and the lady who was tending them mailed them to my wife at no charge! Get the picture. It would be best to avoid this hotel, there are better places to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Travelerfrompnwest
Reviews.Content: Staying for my third night. First, the negatives 1. The a/c in the rooms seems to barely cool the rooms. 2. Misquitos in the room is troubling. 3. I had a package shipped to me at the hotel, I have not been able to collect the package for two days as it is being held at the business center, which has limited hours and I have been in meetings all day at another site, when I leave in the morning and return in the evening the business center is closed. 3. Everything in the hotel is absurdly overpriced, we at at the restaurant in the South Tower lobby for breakfast and it cost more than $50.00 for two, and was uninspiring. The positives: 1. The location has to be one of the best in SD - on the water, but easy access to gaslamp district. 2. While I did not use the pool, the pool area looks like fun.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: eas_11
Reviews.Content: Great staff, location, and beautiul grounds! We're planning a family vacation and will return there again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Staff couldn't be more helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Amy368
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time! The location was great, the staff were amazing, the maid service was superb... just everything was amazing! The location was great as it was right in the middle of everything. We walked to Petco Park to watch the Padres, to Horton Plaza to shop, and loads of other places. If you go out of the back exit, then youre right on the boardwalk, which goes right around the bay. one of the highlights was Seaport Village, which is about two minutes along the boardwalk. Its a lovely collection of old huts selling gifts and also great restaurants. Would most def go back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: AntArc
Reviews.Content: The hotel does not disappoint. Beautiful views, with a balcony. It's a large hotel, so there can be some waiting for elevators and a crowded lobby and pool area, but nice overall. Ideal location for conferences, since it's adjacent to the convention center (though a more direct walkway/connected corridor would be nice). Food options are great. Marriott restaurant, Roy's, Starbucks all on site. Joe's Crab Shack a few feet away, and a few blocks to all the Gaslamp district has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: kathye51
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Staff was very helpful and kind. The pools were so great we never made it to the beach. Walking distance to Sea Port Village, the Gaslamp District and the Padre Baseball Stadium (Petco Park). The only dissapointment was the size of the room. Usually a king room is a regular room with only 1 bed so you have a little more space. This was at the end of the hall and felt a little cramped. Next time I would get 2 queens just for the extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: DirkTid
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel in an excellent location with great facilities. The bars and restaurants are nice. The rooms are great and pools amazing. It is just the service was inconsistent to poor. There was always a line at the check in/out areas, the bars always closed too early (family friendly?) and some of the staff were grumpy. However, the waitresses, waiters and concierges were generally fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice coast view and yummy breakfast, large room”
Reviews.Author: CarolBai
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the location is very good, just near the coast and next to the convention center. My room was a very big one, with brilliant coast view, pool and garden view. Rows of ferries parked on the shore in the sunset glow made an amazing picture. Lights in the pool shined when it was dark. So charming scene. More over, the bedding was very comfortble. I have to say at last, that the breakfast was yummy and rich, with kind and helpful service, although it was a little bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DLBroyles
Reviews.Content: Really couldn't ask for any more! This hotel was within walking distance to Seaport Village, the Gaslamp District and Petco Park, which saved us a ton of time from having to park the car. Although the view of the Bay is beautiful, we had a city view and it was great as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good pool”
Reviews.Author: callycasey
Reviews.Content: This is more a business hotel as it is conveniently located next to the huge San Diego Convention Centre. This hotel had a lovely pool and jacuzzi area with plenty of sun loungers. My husband and I had a spacious, comfortable room with a balcony over looking the harbour. At night you had fantastic views of the city from the balcony. The rooms all have empty mini bars so you can put your own wine and other refreshments in. There are also tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The hotel was a fantastic location for exploring San Diego. The Gaslamp Quarter was a short walk from the Marriot as was the Horton Plaza shopping Centre. Car parking at the hotel was very expensive but this seemed to be the case for most hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Noise and No Self Parking”
Reviews.Author: Camll
Reviews.Content: We were on the 17th story of the South Tower and we heard the trolley and train all night long. It made it very difficult to get any sleep. Also, we self-parked and got EXTREMELY lucky to find a parking spot. They have so many rooms and nearly any self-parking spots requiring you to valet park. At $36/night, that is pretty pricey! The hotel pool area and lounge are very nice and the hotel is centrally located, but the train noise was unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Love it and will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: jmm0979
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel through our company travel discount website. The price can't be beat and we were able to get a room back in July 2011 for our late bday celebration. The hotel structure is modern as well as their newly renuvated rooms and furniture. The location is great as well as it is close to the SD Padres stadium and we walked to it when we watched our home town team, SF Giants against SD Padres. We didn't a great view (we're on 3rd floor) but enough to see the bay which is All in all, we will definitely go back here if given a chance to take another short vacation to SD.

Reviews.Title: “two in one hotel location - between downtown and bay”
Reviews.Author: dsjohuang
Reviews.Content: The best ting about this hotel is the pool. It's great for families. We stayed on the North Tower facing downtown/Gaslamp Quarter. A bit noisy due to the freight trains but then I'm a light sleeper. Great eateries and shops are all within walking distant. Walk on the bay front to enjoy the ocean air and view of aircraft carriers. Hotel is next door to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “A business trip that felt like a vaca!”
Reviews.Author: LittleLongBeach
Reviews.Content: We attend Comic con every year and this is the first time we stayed here. This hotel is attached to the convention center and could not possibly be any more convenient. The staff were amazing despite the huge crowds and the room (11th floor in the south tower) was well kept. We even managed to get an afternoon by the pool with drinks and a really pleasant lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to be for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: PBANDJLancaster
Reviews.Content: Had a meeting/convention here this July, 2011. It's been a while since I've stayed at one hotel for a week. The hotel looks newly renovated and they did a nice job. The lobby is very contemporary. The room itself was comfortable, spacious for me, and had a terrific view. When checking in, ask for a view of the marina, not necessarily the city. The bed was great. I had a choice of 4-6 different pillows. One thing I don't like....tempting me with a bottle of water in the room and charging 4 bucks for it. I passed....thanks anyway. I did use the facilities, including the fitness center and the pool. The pool is gorgeous..but, there are lots of kids there too. Thats ok as spouses join their spouses for the meeting but don't expect a quiet swim or any quiet at the pool. Drink service at the pool was speedy. Drinks were strong. The pool bar at night had live entertainment and they did a great job. It actually gets chilly at night and almost every table had a heater. The fitness center...nicest I've seen at a hotel...looks new and lots of good equipment. Not overly impressed with breakfast choices BUT...it's a big hotel so thats how it goes. One restaurant off the lobby serving a buffet or ala carte. Too expensive. Walk into town and get something if time allows. Ended up getting coffee and yogurt with fruit at the Starbucks in the lobby fort 8 bucks. One final note...the concierge services were A PLUS......they made reservations for us several times..one restaurant had customized our menus and a complimentary dessert compliments of the concierge. (I am sure he didn't pay for it but was a nice touch). Also...I had to mail some wine home...he called around and found me a place open to handle it on a Saturday night..thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the San Diego experience.”
Reviews.Author: Sue R
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything - beautiful view of the water, marina, Coronado Island the bridge and more. The service is friendly and efficient. The beds and pillows are dreamy. Good location. We'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: acarmelguy
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but some beautiful rooms with great views and a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for many attractions”
Reviews.Author: me96
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super convenient to many attractions: Coronado Island Gaslamp District Balboa Park There was also a "seaside village" with cute shops and a great evening walk about. Great service, and deluxe rooms. Only down side, was "Harbor" in the description, made me think the beach might be accessible. It was not. The Harbor was secured, so no walking the docks, either. All in all, a great spot to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, great location next to the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: JKB73
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel that overlooks the San Diego Marina. It was recently renovated and is a great choice if you want to be right next to the Convention Center and a few minutes away from the Gaslamp Quarter, which is full of cafes and shops. I had a corner room on the 23rd floor on the South Wing and the view was so amazing I wished I didn't have to leave the room, something the front desk agent had said when she assigned me the room. It was nicely appointed, clean and everything was in working order. What i also loved was the quietness. Hotels in the Gaslamp area can be close to the train, which interrupts your sleep in the middle of the night. The pool area was very nice as well and there is a grill so you can order food and drinks. Although I stayed here on business, I think it's a great choice for families as well. It's also a 5 minute walk away from the Seaport Village.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay”
Reviews.Author: MAamyp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel at the end of July and it was great. We had a 15th floor bayside room and the view was great ( views of Coronado, the Bay, Point Loma). The room seemed brand new and was comfortable and clean and had a refrigerator. The pool was really nice but crowded on the weekend. We enjoyed walking to the Midway, the Seaport stores and waterfront restaurants, walking to a Padres game at Petco and walking to the Gaslamp district. We rented bikes here and rode around the area (the bikes were gone by 8 am on the weekend as they only have a few). It was a $25 taxi to Old Town or I think you could take a trolley. We had a great San Diego vacation and the Mariott was a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the city AND felt like a luxury escape”
Reviews.Author: travelbug28970
Reviews.Content: Location location location. I've been to San Diego several times. On this most recent trip, I was showing a friend the city for the first time. I was torn between staying on Coronado and at some beachfront resort, or staying near the gaslamp district. It turns out I made the right call - because staying at Marriott Marina was like the best of both worlds. Dont get me wrong, true vacation luxury snobs will not feel like this Marriott has enough amenities. It still caters to the business travel, what with being connected to the Convention Center and all. But... their pool area is a cute little oasis. and the fun is just around the corner - walking paths along the water. the Gaslamp district for restaurants and nightlife. ferries to Coronado. It was pretty ideal. AND the hotel is a Marriott - quality, reliable. nice property and well-kept. I would return again - and AM. soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overwhelming!”
Reviews.Author: jruth
Reviews.Content: While this was a well appointed property, I have to say up front that I'm not into convention center hotels. Way too massive, and impersonal. I felt the need to escape the crowds constantly---in the elevators, hallways, common areas, restaurants and pool area--no getting away from the masses! The rooms themselves are very nice though. I had a view from the 15th floor (south tower) of Coronado Island that was spectacular, awesome to watch the fireworks display one evening. The location of the hotel is really great too, as you can walk to any point in the city easily. If that's key for you, this is a good choice. I was staying on points, and this Marriott was available for my dates, however, If it would have been available, I'd prefer the Marriott on Coronado -- way more relaxing, and the drive is 5 minutes over the bridge from the city, or you can take the water taxi for $6 back and forth. I must say though, the Marina Marriott's organization and engineering of this very large hotel is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views and Location”
Reviews.Author: TexasBeachbum22
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip to San Diego. I attended a conference that was happening at the San Diego convention center. I stayed at the Marriott Marquis San Diego Marina. It was a great hotel. I stayed in a room in the North Tower with a lovely view of the gaslamp district. The views on the other side of the pool and marina are a little nicer. My room had a king sized bed, a balcony and a couch/rest area along with the standard desk, dresser, etc. The bathrooms were a bit small, but for one person it was perfect! The convention center was just a short walk as well as all the restaurants and shopping that the gas lamp district had to offer. The pool area was beautiful and they had a huge quantity of pool chairs, so you could always find a spot to relax by the pool when you wanted. I will definitely go back to this hotel for personal vacation it was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel / excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rams19881993
Reviews.Content: I travel 40 weeks a year and stay in many 4 star hotels - brought my family here for vacation (wife / kids 16, 18, 21) - we enjoyed our stay. San Diego is an excellent city and the location of the hotel is great. Would recommend getting a room that has a view of the bay (view is beautiful). Found the staff to be friendly and very good. Pool area is nice. Rooms are nice and found the hotel to be clean. The one drawback of the hotel is how busy it is, but I believe you will get that in most cities. Overall - liked the hotel alot and will defaintly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: drgajjar
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great location. Rooms were a little on the small size! Also, they need more front desk as check-in times were horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: scokog
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Marina Hotel was a great place to stay in San Diego. We were checked in fast and efficiently. My bill had an incorrect charge on it and the front desk fixed it immediately upon check out. It is very close to the convention center and the gas lamp district. Concierge was very helpful in making our dinner reservations. It is a great place if you like walking because there is a walkway on the marina front in the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lj997
Reviews.Content: Although they were beginning a large renovation project, it is a beautiful hotel. Only problems were some noisy college kids partying in the room next door and the very loud train which goes by and blows its horn during the night....I know other guests have had an issue with the train, maybe that's why they offer ear plugs at the front desk. The grounds are very pretty. I think with the updates taking place, to the hotel and pools, it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: thetoothpicker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a convention in San Diego. Location couldn't be beter,located right next to the Convention Center. The hotel has 2 different towers. We stayed in the North tower. Our room had a balcony from where we had a great view of both the city and the bay. It looked like some of the rooms did NOT have a balcony. If staying there I would definitely recommend requesting a balcony (unless perhaps it is much cheaper to stay in a room with no balcony, but come on- you want a great view). Also has two different pools, so my kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to Our time in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: alibeth
Reviews.Content: I chose Marriott Marina to start our 2 month trip to San Deigo for a couple of reasons. We were coming from an 11 hour flight and I wanted quick and friendly service and a hotel we could wake up from jet lag and order room service at anytime. We stayed there for about 10 days and it was great for getting accustomed to San Diego. Concierge and Valet always found directions for us until we started to know the city. The rate was great because we got $60 per room to spend on food and really enjoyed the restaurants. We ate breakfast either downstairs or room service and usually ordered soup or pizza for dinner. The hotel is beautiful overlooking the marina. The bathrooms could be updated and were small, but we really didn't mind. We didn't like the open area by the sinks with no door because it was too small to change in the bathroom. Overall one of the best in San Diego. Extremely friendly people,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel especially for Comic-con.”
Reviews.Author: warmhappyfeet
Reviews.Content: I've been to San Diego quite a few times now but this was the first time staying at the Marriott Marina. I was there with my son for Comic-con and the Marriott is basically attached to the San Diego Convention Center. It's a very nice looking hotel on a great spot right on the water. It is also a very big hotel with two towers and convention rooms to augment the already large SDCC. Even though it was Comic-con the hotel staff were all very efficient and I never thought we waited too long for anything from check in to the restaurants on site. Rooms were very nice as well. We had a regular two double bed room. Internet was quite expensive so I didn't use it. We tried DW's for breakfast and lunch and both times the food and service were quite good. We also tried Roy's which is a Hawaiian themed restaurant. We have been to Roy's in Waikiki and loved it so we tried it for lunch one day and it was also very good at the Marriott. Overall a highly recommended hotel but it's not cheap as are most hotels in the Gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: glendagrow
Reviews.Content: Starting with our online booking, arrival at hotel and accomodations -- WONDERFUL! Everyone was very helpful and went out of their way to be sure we enjoyed ourselves. I often need an internet connection while traveling (I'm a Realtor) and dislike having to pay for internet service. During this trip I needed to connect to internet and discovered that I could go to the lobby bar or Starbucks (in Hotel) and have free wireless internet service. Loved being next to the Bay, walking on the "strand", Seaport Village, eating at Roy's Asian Fusion Restaurant in Hotel and lots more! Also, very convenient for walking to Petco Park for the baseball games, shopping at Horton Plaza, Little Italy, Gaslamp District & accessing other areas by trolley train.

Reviews.Title: “A great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike84097
Reviews.Content: I had a very comfortable stay at what is now called the Marriott Marquis and Marina in San Diego. I love the Marriott beds. They are incredibly comfortable. This hotel is located on the waterfront (at the Marina!) in downtown San Diego, immediately next to the convention center, and at the edge of the Gaslamp district, which has many restaurants and clubs. There are a number of restaurants in the hotel. I had the breakfast buffet at DW's which was fine. The large pool is inviting. The hotel is also next to one of the San Diego trolley stops. The trolley line parallels a freight train line. I got a nasty start at about 4am from a very loud train whistle. (I stayed 4 nights and this woke me only once.) This might be less of a problem on the harbor side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but otherwise overpriced”
Reviews.Author: redpen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Comic-Con 2011 and I have to say, I was impressed with the ease of check-in and that they did not screw up our reservations. The hotel (and Comic-Con itself) is directly across from the gaslamp district, which is loaded with restaurants, and the view of the water on the bay side is nice. So if you're in town for a convention and you don't want to deal with the hassle of shuttle buses or walking a few blocks back and forth to the convention center, I would recommend the Marriott. If not, I'm not sure this place is worth the price. There were small things, such as the lack of a bathroom vent, that I found mildly annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Jason1028
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right within walking distance of the Convention Center, Gaslamp district and the waterfront. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The pool area is great. Customer setrvice was excellent. Was a little bit on the expensive side. Stayed in a room with the bayview which was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: LakesideLayde
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Very clean and nice. The recent poolside renovation is perfect including the new Mexican style restaurant. The outside fire pits are enjoyable in the cool San Diego evening air. We stayed at this hotel a year ago and I must say, they have upgraded a lot and really kept everything nice. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend for families”
Reviews.Author: lhymowitz
Reviews.Content: Another lovely Marriott. The rooms were comfortable. The pools were a great place to relax at beginning/end of the day. Restaurants tasty and convenient. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: cammie99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to San Diego for our babymoon (last trip before we have our baby) and we are so happy we stayed at the Marriot Marina. The hotel is beautiful, room nice and clean, balcony views awesome and pool is festve and fun! We wanted to get in some R&R and had a few places in mind to visit while in the city and the hotel location was perfect for us. Quick walk to the restaurants/stores at the Gaslamp, village shops (definately recommend- lots of cool stuff), midway aircraft carrier, etc. The staff was polite and accommodating. Only thing I would have changed is the waiting area in the lobby. There is a line roped off but guests have a tendency to stand in line right behind the front desk instead. Irritiating when you have been waiting in the proper line! The staff didnt really do anything to direct people to the appropriate place. Not enough to complain about but still irritating. We had dinner at Tequila Bar and Grill out by the pool one night and really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Definately recommend the nachos!! We will be back to the Marriott Marina Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: niagara_chris
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel for proximity to the Gas Lamp area, as well as the main convention centre, and walks along the marina/harbor. I was first assigned a room partially facing the city, towards the front of the hotel. I was about 6 floors up, and was immediately aware of the sounds of the bells from the train which runs just outside and along the entire the front of the hotel. For some reason they ring the bells on this train not once or twice but more like, 20 or 30 times as it goes by. Knowing that I didn't want to hear that noise for days in a row, I quickly called and requested a room change. The person on the phone was pleasant and helpful. Within 10 minutes there was a knock at my door and keys to my new room arrived. Unfortunately, the room number was written down incorrectly and I ended up at a room where maintenance was taking place. This was quickly resolved as we discovered that the room number on my new keys had two digits backwards. A minor setback and a mistake anyone could have easily have made. Onward to my room, which was, it turns out, very good. I recommend getting a room overlooking the pool and the harbor if you can. My guess is they cost more than city-facing rooms, but I don't know for sure as I was not charged any more. The views from the balcony are excellent and interesting. I was much happier in this room, although there was a new intrusive sound to deal with, which was the Navy helicopters that fly back and forth along the harbor regularly throughout the day and early evening. While the noise was loud, it usually passed quickly, and it was just so unusual and interesting, it wasn't really a bother at all. The helicopters stopped flying shortly after dark, and with the balcony door closed, were not really loud at all. A couple things about this hotel I really, really liked. One is the bowls of apples that were always available in the lobby. Another is the ice cold strawberry infused and lemon infused water, wich was free for guests and was located in the lobby area. I've never had natural strawberry water before, and it was excellent and refreshing. I loved the Starbucks on site, and ate once at their Hawaiian Fusion restaurant, which was decent. Proximity to the convention centre, the gas lamp district, the walking paths along the marina/harbor and the airport are all fantastic. Staff were always friendly and professional. I would be happy to return here for another conference, or with my family for pleasure. Oh, one more thing. I used the fitness centre every day, and it's quite nice. One thing I loved was - and this happened twice - just as I was getting really winded and tired near the end of my workouts - a staff member came around with cold bottles of water for free. How perfect is that? And, yes, there were fresh apples in the fitness area, too!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best Location”
Reviews.Author: crystalba11
Reviews.Content: Truly amazed at how wonderful the staff is here. I compare them all to working at "Disney" because they seem to happy and very willing to assist. The property has undergone an extensive renovation and has a luxurious feel as the result. Beds/Bath/Linnens - Awesome! The F&B department has also stepped up their game and there a ZERO complaints. Parking fee is very high but it's hit or miss for the area...what's a decent rate anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel. Walking distance to many fun places.”
Reviews.Author: gary7777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a couple nights. Originally, the stay was supposed to be one night. As soon as we checked in and got the view from our room, we immediately checked into staying another night. The pool was nice. Pretty crowded. We didn't eat in the restaurant other than breakfast, which was great. The hotel is walking distance to the Gas Lamp District, The Seaport and Petco Stadium (Padres). Tons of restaurants and shops. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation and perfect location for the tourist in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuglove83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge. It reminded me of one of those large convention hotels. It has two towers, around 4-5 restaurants, a Starbucks, Roy's Hawaiian fusion restaurant, and a very large pool and bar scene. It reminded me of something out of Vegas (but suitable for families). I was very impressed with the decor. Everything seemed spacious, very clean and filled with bright colors. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms had real wood in them in full length mirrors on the backs of the bathroom doors. Itâ€™s a great hotel for business. As a matter of fact, the convention center is literally next door to the hotel. I think the main highlight of this place was the pool/bar. I apologize for not having pics of it; I honestly was too busy drinking pina coladas to remember to take those pics :). The staff is very nice and attentive and its definitely one of those hotels that can cater to the family with young children, the energetic 20-somethings and the more mature ones that just want to sit back and talk over a beerâ€¦or two... or three. I admit the largest area of the pool was closed that day so I didnâ€™t go in but it looked amazing. The Marriott is right on Seaport village, next to the embarcadero and 3 blocks down and across the street from the Gaslamp. Some tidbits to those going to SD for the first time... the Gaslamp is filled with restaurants and bars so make sure to check that out. Seaport village is a tourist trap but very nice and fun to walk around. The zoo and balboa park are MUSTs. If you have the time (and love Mexican food) check out the carnitas at the Old Town Mexican Cafe. If you love desserts, I recommend you go to Extraordinary Desserts. If you ove burgers, go to Hodad's. Parking in downtown is horrible and expensive but its worth it. if you love crab, check out Joe's Crab Shack. For steaks, Mortons or Loui and Mickies. For breakfast you must go to Hash House a-Gogo. A fun date night with live music at Anthropology. If you love biking and walking, you can get from downtown ( aslamp/Seaport Village) to Balboa and Hilcrest/NorthPark/Banker Hill without a taxi. Also, this hotel is pretty close to the airport and I beleive they have an airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Frenarena
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at almost all of the Marriott's in downtown SD and this is by far my favorite! I attended a convention at the Convention Center so the location was perfect. I checked in around 8pm and had to wait, which normally annoys me but they had plenty of people working and it was quite busy. The concierge floor was full but I was offered a room in the North Tower one level down. I asked for a balcony and all they had was the South Tower (no concierge in that tower) and I accepted because I really wanted to sit on the balcony with a glass of wine. The room was great- definitely renovated and had a nice flat screen. I used the gym a few times it is definitely top of the line for hotels. There were more free weights and machines than some regular gyms. The concierge lounge was top notch as always with great warm apps at night and a fantastic hot breakfast. I allowed myself extra time to walk over and up there to visit the lounge. I didn't go to the pool but I have in the past and love it. They have bar service and you feel like you on a tropical island when you are down there. The cons; parking. I dread doing the self park but also hate waiting for valet for my car so I do it. It's hard to find a spot and annoying (esp being a female traveling alone) to walk back to the hotel at night. I don't see how they can fix this but here's hoping! Great hotel, look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barryvo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a quick three-night stay at the Marriot Marquis and found the place to be nearly perfect. The customer service was simply amazing. Every employee I encountered was very professional and accommodation. The location was very convenient to plenty of shopping and dining. I had some extra time and took the boat ride over to Coronado and it was a lot of fun. The facilities at the hotel were very good. The fitness center was open 24 hours and had attendants most of the day. All of the equipment was in working order and there was normally someone handing out water. The hotel also had fresh fruit out along with cold water at several locations. Iâ€™m normally not a Marriott person but had no choice with this hotel as my work booked. I can honestly say it is better than most of the places Iâ€™ve picked in the past. The bottom line is a nice hotel close to many things and the service and amenities are great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Renovated Property”
Reviews.Author: Ilovelamp27
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for an event at the Zoo and a weekend in San Diego. Great location steps away from Shopping Resturants and all the Gaslamp has to offer. We love the Marriott Gaslamp as well, but this offered a great pool area to take advantage of the great SoCal weather. Standard Marriott room- nothing special. Tiny balcony (we were in the North Tower) and we enjoyed the balcony. Mini Fridge in room was nice for Water and sodas. Employees were genuinely helpful and nice. The only complain was average housekeeping (think the same spot on the floor or night table for 3 days and it came at FOUR PM (!!!) both days. As a Marriott Platinum I was a little more hopeful than that. Concierge Lounge is nice with a great view, but dont expect any "extras" bar wise- prices are the exact same as in the lobby bar, perhaps a little higher given the lobby lounge specials. Starbucks in lobby....but be prepared to wait in an epic line. Pool area large and nice, but chairs are packed in like sardines....bring the headphones! Fitness center large, new and impressive for a hotel gym. Overall, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews indicated”
Reviews.Author: chillinfool
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights while attending a conferance at the convention center, which the hotel is very convenient too. I was on the 15th floor with a view over the convention center. The room was adequate, nice furnishings except for a cheap plastic toilet seat. The bed was very comfortable. I am a light sleeper, but was never awakened by the train or anything else. I was also right next to the vending room and elevators, and the noise from them were also not a bother. The front desk staff were good, and all the public areas were clean. The pool area was open and nice, but it was in the 60's the days I was there, so only kids were in the pool. Again, from the previous reviews I was a little concerned, but the hotel met all my needs and was better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of strengths with a couple of weaknesses”
Reviews.Author: conshy04
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past week. Amazing outside area with two pools, fire pits, outside bar and hot tubes. This is the one of the strengths of the propery. The coincerge lounge in the south tower is nice (amazing views) but can get very crowded during breakfest. As others have indicated, the hotel gym is excellent.... The food in the restraunts was very good and not overpriced. The hotel room in the south tower was not anything special and the housekeeping was dissapointing and inconsistent. The front entrance is tough to get in and out of if you are trying to drop someone off and not leaving your car for valet parking. Bottom line: Very close to the convention center, gas lamp, petco field and right along the bay. Above average Marriott property. Tip - If you need a car renting at the Hertz at the airport is a lot cheaper than renting at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for the construction to be done”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in January while the main entrance of the property was undergoing renovations. The temporary entrance was at the North Tower. This made unloading and reloading luggage a challenge, especially since I was in a walking cast during the trip. For those attending meetings at the Convention Center, the South Tower is your best bet since it's the closest to the Convention Center. However, the concierge lounge is in the North Tower (why they don't have two surprises me at this level of a hotel). After a day of walking, it can be the last thing you want. The pool area was under construction as well, but my room was high enough in the tower that I wasn't bothered by the daily construction noise. If your room is facing the city, beware of the train horns and bells during the day and night. It can be bothersome for light sleepers. Overall the staff was good although the bellmen were a bit abrupt when I was trying to simply "run in" to check in. They charged me $5 to do that, which was absurd and I told the bellman that much. He shrugged and said it was hotel policy (later, I found out that it could have been "waived" but I feel bad for the people who are too exhausted from their trip to really argue or complain about it). Valet parking and self-parking. Well. Because of the construction, I opted for self-parking (the aforementioned walking cast meant that I wasn't up to doing much walking due to pain), since the self-parking was on the South Tower side. Spaces are hard to come by, especially at night. My room faced the bay, which was nice and kept things quiet. Room service was its traditionally expensive self but okay. The menu was the standard Marriott menu. I've stayed at this hotel several times and this isn't the best time I've had. It was mainly due to the construction but the housekeeping staff wasn't consistent with the level of cleanliness. The service in the restaurants was poor as well. The location of the property is great. Next to the convention center, Gaslamp District and Petco Park. There are a plenty of restaurants in the Gaslamp District, so if you're up for a little walking, I recommend eating out there instead of at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: nexgraphics
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Its great for business people and families. They are right on the Marina, with plenty of restautrants, shopping, a merry go round, and lots of things to do within walking distance. Clean rooms, great restaurant, fabulous pool!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: mysamdog
Reviews.Content: We attended a business conference and this hotel was awesome. The staff was friendly and very knowledgeable of the area. The views are beautiful and everything is convient to the hotel. Would love to stay here again should we ever return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Revelation35
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel. Unfortunately, the pool was under construction. However, they made arrangements with a nearby hotel for us to use their facilities. Also, the beach was close so there were plenty alternatives. Also, the hotel was a short walk to the Gaslamp District which was full of entertainment. Staff was friendly and I'd like to return for an opportunity to enjoy the surrounding area while not on business.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here for your family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Marriottnonvaca
Reviews.Content: Horrible customer service and even worse resolution. When we reserved our stay we advised we were traveling with two small children and an infant, and requested adjoining rooms. On the day of arrival we made a point to contact the front desk to ensure the reservation had been noted and they were aware. Upon arrival they gave us two rooms on the same floor, however in separate wings! The first night no one slept as the five of us were in a king room. When we followed up in the morning, they ensured us it would be corrected and a refund issued for the unused room that first night. After checking with the front desk twice for our new room key, I gave them my cell number to call once the room was ready. They never called. It took interrupting our sightseeing to finally track down our new room keys. Upon check out, we made sure they refunded one room for the first night. What a disappointment Marriott! No customer service at all! We will not choose marriott for our future vacation or business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel, convenient to the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: DrKatieRN
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Marriott Marquis around the nation. This one offers nice rooms with great views. However, it is more than twice the price of other comparable hotels in the area. Being attached to the convention center is it's draw. When I checked in, the staff were actively trying to get people to go to other hotels and were very negative. The entire pool area was closed for renovation. The price ($289 per night + tax) was outrageous. The staff were the least customer friendly compared to all other Marriotts where I've stayed. It appears they feel "entitled" being attached to the convention center and do not feel they have to offer good service for their overpriced rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, great location, nice details”
Reviews.Author: Nyxster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the San Diego Rock 'N Roll Marathon, and the place was PACKED with runners. We travel often for marathons, so this was a plus to us. The hotel was in a perfect location with beautiful view of the marina and city (we only live an hour away, but we still enjoyed it). it's a 5 minute walk from the Amtrak station if you plan to travel that way. The beds were comfy and the rooms were quiet and well-insulated from the hallway noise. They were clean and well equipped, your standard Marriott style room. There's a Starbucks downstairs, along with a handful of restaraunts and lounges. The pool is in a great area and well-insulated from the winds (this is a BIG BONUS - San Diego is a mild climate and the wind can make pool time a bit to chilly). The staff was friendly, and they served this incredible fresh-fruit water in the lobby. Strawberries, lemons, cucumbers, etc...I think this is a full time thing, but it was the PERFECT detail for us runners. We would definitely stay here again; it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: Karepaolinelli
Reviews.Content: Rooms r big! Pool area huge staff friendly! Love this place !

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: CrystalBeachMom
Reviews.Content: We went here because my husband was attending a conference next door. What an amazing hotel. Many people here commented on the poor customer service, we found quite the opposite. Everyone we came into contact with was friendly and helpful. As for being expensive as one poster said, of course it is, it's a Marriott. If you want inexpensive, try Motel 6. Everything here is first class, so you are going to pay for it. We use the lounge for drinks- great. Used the pool and hot tubs- great. Tiki bar by the pool for food and drinks- great. DW's for breakfast -great (I HIGHLY recommend the almond granola yogurt parfait.) Check in staff, maids everyone was great. The only problems we found were, coffee. Not everyone likes Starbucks, but it's all that there is. And every room should come with a little card and ear plugs letting you know about the trains. All night long.

Reviews.Title: “WORST ATTITUDE Front Desk Clerks ! WILL NEVER BE BACK !!”
Reviews.Author: whatever838
Reviews.Content: I simply requested to have the room for one more hour (1PM) because I was not feeling well, and wanted to rest a little more. Front dest clerk ( a Philippine girl) told me that they were sold out that day (Sunday)so she needed the room back at EXACTLY 12. Check in time is at 3pm I said. But, she insisted that I get out the room AT 12. I told her AGAIN that I did not feel well. She told me AGAIN very FIRMLY that I NEED TO CHECK OUT AT 12 !!! I asked to speak to the supervisor (Gisele). She repeated the same thing Philippine girl just said. They are NOT flexible, NOT friendly, NO sympathy and have BAD ATTITUDE !!! Don't try to ask them anything extra because they won't do it for you. I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN ! and all of you have to think twice about staying here, too. By the way, there were hair in the restroom floor and on the desk in my room when I checked in. General manager of this hotel should have the front desk clerks trained again. As far as Gisele, I don't know what qualifies her to be a "supervisor" !

Reviews.Title: “This used to be my favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyesee
Reviews.Content: We used to stay here at least 4-6 times a year for the last 20 + years. Even way back in the days when it was the Inter-Continental. The rooms have terrific views, the staff had been responsive in the past, the food delicious, the hotel sponsored activities wonderful, and the pools delightful. Unfortunately, although we love animals, my family is very allergic to dogs and cats. At our last stay, I did not realize that the hotel decided to allow pets in every room. We had checked in early, gotten our room without a thought, and left for a day of sightseeing. When we returned late in the evening, there were dogs everywhere. The lobby, the bar, the elevators, the wallkways, the hallways, the rooms. I called and asked the front desk if our room or any others were set aside that did not allow pets, as we had allergies, and I was told with rudeness, "NO." As it was late, we went to sleep. In the morning, we noticed animal hair all over the room, as it is hard for the maids to vacuum the bedcovers, chairs, carpeting, etc to rid the room of animal hair. We did have allergic reactions and we will not come back. If you have pets, this is a great place to go. If you have any kind of medical condition to animal dander, you need to avoid this hotel. It was my fault for not asking this hotel about their pet policy. Most pet friendly hotels that we have stayed at either have some rooms set aside that they don't put pets into, or they make a thorough cleaning of the rooms so that those with allergy issues won't be affected. WE DO LOVE ANIMALS,we just have allergies. Unfortunately, when we advised the front desk staff of our problem, they were not helpful in trying to resolve our room issue, not even to offer a thorough vacuuming and cleaning of the room. I guess this hotel is in such demand with pet owners, that they don't care about those without. Pet owners rejoice and enjoy this hotel. It is a good place. Allergy suffers, avoid this hotel at all costs. And let me say again, we do love animals. This is only to warn those with allergies that there are problems here.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here for your family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Marriottnonvaca
Reviews.Content: Horrible customer service and even worse resolution. When we reserved our stay we advised we were traveling with two small children and an infant, and requested adjoining rooms. On the day of arrival we made a point to contact the front desk to ensure the reservation had been noted and they were aware. Upon arrival they gave us two rooms on the same floor, however in separate wings! The first night no one slept as the five of us were in a king room. When we followed up in the morning, they ensured us it would be corrected and a refund issued for the unused room that first night. After checking with the front desk twice for our new room key, I gave them my cell number to call once the room was ready. They never called. It took interrupting our sightseeing to finally track down our new room keys. Upon check out, sure they refunded one room for the first night, but then increased the rate for our other room. What a disappointment Marriott! No customer service at all! We will not choose marriott for our future vacation or business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel with poor service... overcharge you at every turn.”
Reviews.Author: TravelDad71
Reviews.Content: 4 Rooms on the first day... no I'm not picky, but this is for real. The first room was directly over the guys jack hammering for the remodel. The second room was literally right in front of the elevator so that every time someone used it, it went "ding". Third room filled with a foul odor when the AC was turned on. Last room was Ok but I spent 6 hours just trying to check in. To top it off... if anyone mails you anything, they charge you $10 to "handle" it. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerVA51
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the convention center with plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance in the Gas Lamp district and a trolley stop just across the street. Staff shows its experience with the convention/conference crowd. Specific room comments: The curve of the building allows more living area in the room, I had a large size room in the north building with a balcony with views of the bay, airport and downtown; large glass shower with no bath tub; mini-refrigerator in room as a standard feature (Grocery store only 2 blocks away if you want to get supplies); not a big fan of CFL bulbs but room had 4 lamp fixtures so plenty of light available. Minor specific observations: Night light as part of the switch in toilet/shower space - No need to turn on lights during the night to find the bathroom; Shampoo/conditioner bottles that were flat on one side so they lay down easy and not roll off the soap dish.

Reviews.Title: “is sBest hÃ´tel ever !”
Reviews.Author: quebectraveller_8
Reviews.Content: Wow! 1st of all, San-Diego is a beautiful city. And this hotel has it all. It is located in a perfect place on the marina near everything.The view is fantastic ! The beds are so comfortable and the staff was so nice and really helpful. Everybody in San-Diego is great. From the ferry captain to Coronado, the trolley driver and nightclubbers on 5th street. Don't miss: Coronado beach and the Del Coronado hotel, The marina, The clubs on 5th street, Little Italy, Old town, Petco park, Seaport Village, SeaWorld, Balboa park (The Prado restaurant). It cost only 5$ for a daily pass for the train. You can walk a lot around the hotel and the pool is great! I will surely be back with the family someday ! Don't hesitate, book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: rgoz3Dayton_Ohio
Reviews.Content: On the 22nd floor, the view was amazing! I was fortunate enough to get a room with a balcony which added to the beauty. Room was good size and as in previous reviews, came with flat screen TV, small refrigerator, plenty of electrical outlets and bathroom/shower separate from sink area. Housekeeping was on top of everything! Pool didn't open until the last day of my stay and the pool bar still wasn't ready. Renovations seemed really nice though. Lobby bar was, "the place to be" after hours. For entertainment though, Gaslamp district is just a short walk away. Best place EVER to party is the 207 at Hard Rock. $20.00 cover charge was the best money I spent while on my trip.Downsides: very little water pressure in the shower, sink and toilet, and food was very expensive. I spend $24.00 on breakfast for one! Drinks in the bar was also expensive as was the internet charge. Overall though, it was a nice stay with more than helpful staff. Alexandria (I think was her name) was the best though. She worked in valet, but was helpful with everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice harbor-side location walkable to Gaslamp district, some train noise”
Reviews.Author: beerdrinker2005
Reviews.Content: Even on the 20th floor, rooms overlooking the Convention Center still had obnoxious horn noise from the freight and AMTRAK passenger trains. Hotel staff claim city will someday install modern crossings that will preclude the horn blasts. Nearby Trolley crossings are frequent but not very noisy. Rooms have a mini-fridge and small desk wired Internet. Modern and clean bath. Accessories include an iron, board, alarm clock, hairdryer and safe. Flatscreen TV with A/V inputs, cable channels and movies. Reading desk with small arm chair. King bed with comfortable pillows. Expensive breakfast options. Good draught beers at the lobby bar. Location is walkable to the Gaslamp district and a short taxi ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but construction”
Reviews.Author: WorkTraveler18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very large and the rooms were very nice. The workout facility is awesome, but since there was construction going on, there was no access to the pool, and the front entrance was blocked off. We were dropped off at the alternative entrance which is a million miles from the front desk and with luggage it was not picnic. The staff is very curtious and helpful. The only thing I would recommend, is to put with a water view, not only is it pretty but it will help drown out the sound of the frieght train that runs through the city each night.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling for work conference”
Reviews.Author: Jardila814
Reviews.Content: Got sent for a work conference. Seeing the location, I was excited about the hotel. They were however doing renovations the entire time we were there, even through the weekend. Could hear heavy loud vibrations coming up the walls all day long. You might check if they are still doing remodeling before you stay. The standard room was very small and the bathroom was also. The door swung very close to the toilet and you had to close the door in order to get into the bathtub (at least in my room). However, it was clean. They came in and changed out towels and toiletries each day which not all places bother with. Pros: The conference staff were very attentive. The food for the conference was quite good and they had a nice variety over the two full days we were there. Also, the views were amazing. I overlooked the harbor one way and also the city the other way. Great views! I did pay a small price of hearing a harbor out sound his horn 5 times all three mornings I was there at 4am. That wasn't as fun as I am on eastern time and it felt like 7am to me. :) Also, Seaport Village is a short walk away with lots of dining options and a few cute shops. They had lots of musicians and artists along the sidewalks. Even wondering alone, I did enjoy the atmosphere. Overall - the location is great but it is really just an average hotel.
