Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was located in a great place if you have time to see some of the sights. The view is excellent from ONE side of the south tower. I was on the side that provided noise from the train, public transportation crossing signals, and seagulls on the roof. We were also put in a room next to the elevators. Swooshing every few minutes... Hotel was sold out, we were told. Room was over furnished, but large bath. Drink machine was empty, but ice was plentiful. The pool area was BEAUTIFUL including a few couches and fire pits. Easy access to walk the marina to Seaport Village. I would stay here again, but only on the harbor side. Check your bill for wifi charges....

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Noise!”
Reviews.Author: hbsprite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with my wife and 1 year old child. We specifically asked for a quiet room and were placed in the north tower on the 17th floor in a room with a balcony. We were happy! We got settled, unpacked and were about to settle down for a good night's sleep. That is, until a freight train went by, constantly blowing its horn. It was so loud in the room, even with the door and drapes closed completely that you almost had to cover your ears. I'm not at all a light sleeper, but I had trouble sleeping due to being awoken every few hours. Our 1 year old didn't sleep very well either, as every time a train would come he would wake up crying. Internet access was $13 per day, which is definitely on the high side (should be free). In the morning, i took a closer look at the sliding door.....it has single pane glass! What were they thinking? Single pane glass in a hotel that overlooks heavily used train tracks? The simple addition of a dual paned sliding door would have made our stay so much better. Another oddity...the rooms (at least in the north tower) are very oddly shaped. Think triangle shaped instead of rectangle. The odd shape, gives the illusion of less "living space." We stayed here years ago and remember the water slide, which we thought would be fun to go down with our 1 year old. Turns out, they got rid of the water slide too :( On the plus side, the staff was friendly, the location was great and the room was very clean. Due to the noise issue, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Countrylawyer
Reviews.Content: I recommend staying here. The location is perfect. I walked to my meetings downtown but still could enjoy the bay. I stayed on the concierge floor and after meeting the staff once-I was greeted by name for the rest of the week-no matter what part of the hotel I happened to see them in. I had my wife an three year old along with me--I couldn't believe how well everyone from the bellmen to the wait staff to the concierge staff treated my daughter. The fitness center was recently remodeled and is outstanding-with no fee for it's use.

Reviews.Title: “Many hotels in the area to chose from”
Reviews.Author: BIGtraveller66
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at this hotel for a conference. Most of the service was good with the exception of the pub/restaurant and front check-in. We too (as other reviews indicated) were mislead about the upgrades and they failed to provide us with the rate we reserved with. We are contacting head office about this issue since we paid 35$/night extra???? We did not sleep one full night all week due to the train blowing it's horn in the middle of the night despite requesting a quiet room. We understand this is beyond the hotel's management however, they could have provided us with the quieter area (south tower) instead of directly in the train's path! LC's servers, bell staff all kind, courteous. San Diego generally has very pleasant, helpful and kind people. Please try Tabule restaruant.. a must ! Upon our return to San Diego, we will surely chose another hotel..there are plenty within safe walking distance and for a better price/location!Please ask for renovated room...at least the rooms are esthetically upgraded. PS: no free wireless internet in hotel...??

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at 4 hotels that week and this was by far the WORST”
Reviews.Author: vmoberg
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the hotel after last min deciding to leave the bellagio in vegas and come to san diego after our wedding. I worked at the westin down the street in the passed and always wondered what the hotel looked like inside. very excited since i just got married i reserved a room for 2 nights at 269 a night. we got to the front desk and nicely asked if we could get an up grade since we just got married and i was paying 269 a night anyways why not. she said they dont do that. we said ok. then as a part of our reservation we have a 30 dollar food credit each day so i asked how we would go about using that. she said she doesnt have that code in her system. since she started arguing with me i said well im not just making it up . my husband then asked for a manager who asked for my reservation email. i had to look for it on my phone since i didnt bring my laptop since i was on my honeymoon. my husband asked if we could cancel our reservation since they re not giving us what we reserved. She finally said thats fine. Whats a mess. then we go to the 269 dollar a night room and it looks old and dated like its a motel 6. yes the view was amazing but i also paid for the best view so that was expected. We left the hotel after our 2 night reservation and went to the W hotel were we got a suite upgrade and outstanding service. there's over 25 hotels in downtown, DONT choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Too big for proper customer service”
Reviews.Author: Steele723
Reviews.Content: A co-worker stayed here with her husband after being diagnosed with breast cancer. Our office wanted to have a gift certificate to a nice restaurant waiting for her when she arrived at the hotel but the Marroitt would not sell us a gift certificate over the phone so we were forced to find a restaurant nearby. We had the certificate delivered to the Marroitt before the guests arrived, but the hotel never gave it to them. Now we are out $100 and all the manager would say is that since they have 1300 rooms they cannot be responsible. Horrible Customer Service!!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TShip
Reviews.Content: I had an opportunity to stay an extra night in San Diego to enjoy the weather, so I grabbed what I thought would be a night at a 4 Star Business hotel on Price line. I asked for an updated room at check in and was told they were full in the south tower. I recieved a room in the north tower that was so dated and dirty I was in shock. I have seen better then this at 2 and 3 star facilities. The beds wer doubles, the linens were old, even the remote control on the TV was broken. Shame on you Marriott for letting your hotel drop to this level! Not to mention, no wireless internet!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised to find a resort like feel at SD Marriott”
Reviews.Author: GenCooks
Reviews.Content: Great location and if you like to walk, it's perfect we caught the Marriott ferry to Cornodo island for only $5 - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Could not sleep”
Reviews.Author: wonster
Reviews.Content: Paper thin walls.. I could almost make out the words from the room next to me. They were chatting for hours (even at 6 in the morning christ) and I just couldn't sleep. This hotel should be downgraded to a three star. The room felt really outdated. The old school tv in our room would keep turning off by itself. I should've listened to the reviews on TripAdvisor but I made the mistake of using Priceline. Never staying here again. I'm still giving it 2 stars because of the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Any Occasion”
Reviews.Author: maltasr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Valentine's day and night at the Marriott Marina. The hotel is the perfect choice for a special occasion or it could be an excellent choice for any occasion. Probably because my wife is a Gold Marriott Rewards member, we were upgraded to the Penthouse floor (25th floor) of the South Tower which also houses the Concierge Lounge. Our room was beautifully furnished and appeared to have new furniture and carpeting. I believe this hotel was originally built as an Intercontinental Hotel (before they became a part of the Holiday Inn consortium). We had a stunning view of the San Diego bay front as well as a part of the airport. Having the Concierge Lounge at our disposal was a real treat. The first night the offings were chile with build your own nachos, spinach and artichoke dip, vegetables with hummus, an assortment of international cheeses and crackers, deluxe mixed nuts, fruit bowls anda nice choice of yogurts. Later in the evening (beginning around 8:00 PM) the lounge offered chocolate torte cake, cheesecake with raspberries, lemon bars, hazelnut - toffee bars, assorted cookies including raisin oatmeal and chocolate chip. The lounge personnel were very kind and courteous. The lounge itself is beautifully decorated and takes full advantage of the fantastic view of the water. There are two public access computers in the lounge. The hotel houses a Roy's Asian Fusion restaurant that is located along the marina and yacht club. Diners may eat indoors or on the sunny patio outside. One tip: if you go be sure to order the chocolate lava cake. Order it when you are seated as it takes a few minutes of extra preparation. We thought this Roy's had a better ambiance than the Roy's we had eaten at in Hawaii at the Ko Olina Resort Hotel. Our only slight criticism of the hotel was the problem we had getting a wireless connection for our laptop. We simply used the wired connection and left the computer in one place. We also noticed some slight noise from one of the rooms next door. I also feel the $32 per night valet parking fee is unreasonable, but there is really no alternative except self parking which is $22.00. All in all, this is a wonderful property and I think it would be hard to top when staying in the San Diego area. In our opinion it's while worth paying a bit more to have Concierge Lounge access. We paid $159 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: icyclops
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. My wife and I had a bay view room on the 5 th floor that looked out over the marina, bay, and the fantastic hotel lagoon swimming pool. The service was great starting from the bell man who gave us the low down on the area, the hotel services/facilities, and things to do. What a nice way to start a trip. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. It is within walking distance to 5th street (heart of the Gaslamp district) and so many great resturaunts. Make sure you have breakfast across the street at the pancake house and the Brazilian Steakhouse on 4th street.This hotel is a little pricey, but definetly worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JackandMaddie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Hotel and Marina on a business trip in early December. My room had the most gorgeous view! From the balcony I could see the Coronado bridge, Coronado, the bay, and the awesome hotel pool with waterfalls. The waterfalls made me feel like I was in Hawaii! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located downtown on the bay right across the street from the Gaslamp with restaurants and shops. Ecerything I needed was within walking distance, which was great because I didn't have a car. It is right next to Seaport Village which also has a bunch of shops and restaurants. I think the location is excellent. There is a Starbucks inside of the hotel also, which was very convenient. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean and decorated nicely. This is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive views & room”
Reviews.Author: Arcee_CO
Reviews.Content: Very nice large room w/ King bed & harbor and marina views - for just $147 (govt. rate).

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: rzeppieri
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel denies it, there were bed bugs in my room!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Krissy1983
Reviews.Content: Although in a great location on the marina, and just a short walk to the gaslamp, this hotel is too dated to be so expensive. There is a great view of the water, and a great pool scene, if you want to fight for a chair. They were giving out bracelets to people permitted in the pool area. It was hard to navigate through all the furniture at the pool's edge. I have never been in a property with worse elevators. The lines to get an elevator caused arguements, pushing, and all around unpleasantness. It was completely unacceptable. They should have set up stanchions to form lines for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: travelresearcher22
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time at this Marriott. I attend a conference bi-annually at this location. I was there for 5 nights this go around. The rooms are really starting to show their wear. I found the room to be tired and the furniture battered. The safe was not working but was serviced quickly when I called. The rooms were very clean and I like that they serviced the rooms early in the morning. The elevators are painfully slow. There were a few times when I waited close to 10 min. to get an elevator. I ordered room service the first night and requested cottage cheese and fruit and pink lemonade. There was a HUGE plate of fruit which I could never eat and only about 1/2 cup of cottage cheese. I was shocked when they arrived with an entire pitcher of pink lemonade as opposed to just one glass.The cost was $26 for this meal. I felt this was WAY over priced. I ate at Roy's one night and the service was excellent and food very good. I ended up checking out early. I used the in room internet daily but it was impossible to access the wi-fi. You had to be connected to the internet via the cord on the desk which I found irritating as I like to be on the internet while sitting in other locations other than the desk. It was also pricier than most hotels at 12.95 per day. I decided to catch a late flight out instead of waiting until the next morning to fly home. I was pleased when they let me know that if i could vacate the room by 6PM, I would only be charged for 1/2 a day and not the whole night. One of the mornings I took a jog out along the waterfront. It is an easy access from the hotel. The only uncomfortable part was the path takes you through a small looped park and it had quite a contingent of homeless men and as a single lady jogging made me feel a bit unsafe. All and all it is not a bad place but if you must stay at this Marriott be prepared for one that his outdated. There are many other choices close by that I think would be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: MDRedSox
Reviews.Content: Short walk to GasLamp Quarter. Clean, inviting lobby. Room was decent. No popcorn ceiling as mentioned in a prevoius post. My room had crown moulding. Elevators for South Tower weren't working (blown fuse) for a period of 20 minutes or so one afternoon so the staff offered free appetizers and drinks at DW's Pub (in hotel) for the inconvenience. Concierge Lounge on 24th floor offered decent breakfast and evening hors d' oveurs. Only negative was the sound of the trolley horn. I would recommend this hotel but would recommend Marriott GasLamp first. Parking is pricey, as is it is at every major hotel in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, not so beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: eyehearttravel
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of hotel that spends on a few upgrades but fails to realize this highlights the bad parts even more. You walk in to a very modern, unique lobby and conference area but greeted by early 90's decor everywhere else. The king room was spacious but had very dated, dirty looking carpet (I didn't take off my socks), a popcorn ceiling and older dark furniture but a new bed with clean, white modern linens. The room looked strange as a result. The big big plus for the room was the balcony facing the beautiful bay. I stayed out there as long as possible before heading to bed. I didn't have a chance to enjoy the pool but noticed it looked well maintained and fun for the kids. I ate at Roy's twice and the food was amazing. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I was always asked how my day was, if I needed directions, etc. and I was upgraded to the ocean view upon check in. The rate was affordable and because of that I would likely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in walking distance to the marina as well as the Gas Lamp District with any type of restaurant you could want. There is also a Starbucks and a restaurant(s) inside the hotel. Short ride to the airport. The sleeping rooms are average, the furniture and carpet could stand to be updated. Bathroom area is small, no separate shower, tub only. The only way to access the fitness center is by going outside throught the terrace which is sometimes used for guest functions. I was there for a conference. The meeting space is pretty nice, very spread out depending on how large your conference is. The hotel staff were all courteuos. We were told that the area sometimes sees crime because of the large number of pawn shops in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel for a stay at a conference”
Reviews.Author: dedlaw
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Marina is well-located -- if you are in town on business or at a conference. It is easy to walk to the Gas Lamp District with its many restaurants and shops. The room was comfortable and everything was in working order. The room was very clean. The meeting and conference rooms were comfortable. The restaurant/bar was a bit overpriced, but the portions were good and the food was tasty. The only gripe is that the elevators are extremely slow -- it was a constant source of conversation with every single person encountered on (or waiting for) the elevator. Concierge was just okay, but the rest of the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: h2doughboy
Reviews.Content: Great location in the marina. You can see the boats as they go out to the ocean. The naval ships across the bay. Walk to great restaurants and shopping at Seaport Village. Or catch a pedicab to the gas lamp district. Short drive to Coronado Island, Sea World, San Diego Zoo and LaJolla. The higher the floor the better the view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing and beautiful City!”
Reviews.Author: moaudie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 day trip to San Diego. What a beautiful place. We stayed at Marriott on the Harbor and could just walk outside and be within feet of the boats, resturants and Seaport Village. The weather was amazing 70 degree days with sunshine and light jackets required for evenings. Like having a perfect Spring day every day. The Harbor House Resturant was easily a 5 star in our book, food was amazing, view spectacular and the service was truly impressive! We would recommend this trip to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: LuvingIt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriot Marina San Diego from Sept. 26 to Sept. 29. We rented a car from the airport so we had to use the hotel parking which was $22 daily. Check-in went very smooth. We stayed on the 10th floor of the South Tower and had a wonderful view of pool and harbor. Unfortunately, our room did not have a balconey. The room was very clean and had a king sized bed. A USA Today was delivered to our door every morning. I went to the Starbucks every morning for my cup of coffee. The pool was huge with plenty of chairs. There was even a bar next to it. The hotel was next to a boardwalk which had plenty of restaurants and attractions. We had dinner every night in the Gaslamp Quarter. Unfortunately, we did not stay long to eat at most of the restaurants. Overall, I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone visiting San Diego Pros: The pool Starbucks Location to attractions and restaurants Cons: Price of parking All rooms do not have a balconey

Reviews.Title: “Eh, just okay for this business traveler.”
Reviews.Author: Ibct
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the North Tower for a few nights while on business. The room was clean but the furniture and bathroom was scuffed up and dated. I had a bay view, which was nice, but not really worth the extra money I paid. I heard the train several times througout the night each night. I agree with another reviewer about the TV- time to get some new ones! The pillows were lumpy too :(. I bought a getaway package which included 'free internet' but I couldn't ever get online in my room. I probably won't stay here again. I recommend Hotel Solomar or the US Grant for the money. It was very close to the conference that I attended at the Manchester Hyatt. It's also really close to Seaport Village.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: skifast15
Reviews.Content: Great location to everything. Make sure to book a room with a balcony, otherwise I might have selected a different hotel. The view is AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: This isn't a bad hotel. It has it good points and mediocre points but at $225 pn + tax for the four days I stayed, it certainly isn't a great value. I reserved a balcony waterfront view, and the room I got at the end of the hall is probably one of the best standard rooms they've got. I was disappointed that the balcony was almost entirely glassed in, which impaired the view from inside and made the balcony fairly worthless. But there is also a nice view from the window over the desk, so the waterfront request was worth it. The room is pretty small by today's standards and the bathroom positively petite--combo tub shower with curtain, single sink--although the rainfall showerhead was nice. Bed was fairly comfortable, plenty of outlets at the desk, decent lighting for working and reading Time to upgrade the TV to a nice HD flat panel at these prices, Marriott. My biggest gripe is that the internet ethernet connection didn't work for most of my stay, and the wireless connection only worked in a common area on the second floor. This was problematic enough that I cut my trip short. The positive about the hotel is the staff. They were unfailingly efficient, courteous and helpful. Check in took all of about 45 seconds before I had my key, a smile from the clerk and was on my way to the room. When I complained about the internet problem, they removed all charges including the day that it did work before I even inquired. Nor did I get hit with a cancellation fee when I left early. Housekeeping and room service were reliable and prompt. The grounds are nice. I hear a lot of people complaining about the elevator but except for my last night there when hundreds of people checked in at once, I never waited long. Location is convenient for conventions, and a $5 cab ride from the train station which was my mode of transportation from LA. Roy's Hawaiian restaurant was very good food and service, and a prime location with great views from indoors and out. Swimming pool area was pretty small but attractive. To go drinks for the pool area were available from the bar on the Roy's patio, and a telephone outside the gate could be used to order room service food. I can't complain about my stay except for the internet, but this isn't a real resort hotel. It's one of those places that is great for a few nights if you're planning on being on the go all day or you're there for a convention or business. In that light, it is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is not what it used to be...”
Reviews.Author: EANDMINSD
Reviews.Content: Our stay was disappointing. We've stayed at this Marriott a few times over the last dozen years with great results, but it's not a luxury hotel anymore. We stayed the night attending an event being held in the Marina ballroom and we called to check availability for an early check-in and were told that the hotel did not sell out the night prior and so rooms were plentiful. I asked for bay view room and was charged an extra 30.00 for the upgrade into the south tower. I pointed out to the desk clerk that we've stayed before and received the same price as the city view as the rooms were available anyway, but with no luck. The south tower is dated but relatively clean. The air conditioner did not work well so in the afternoon, the western sun really heated up the room. Our room had an outstanding view of Coronado and the harbor, but the windows were dirty on the inside (not cool). We went out for the evening and returned to find our bed turned down (which was nice), but oddly enough, the phone had been moved. When we checked out the next day, two phone calls reflected on my bill and I promptly asked to have the charges removed as we had not used the phone. The desk clerk was indifferent to my concerns about someone using the phone in a guest room while the guests are not in, but she removed the charges. DW's pub is horribly overpriced for drinks and it didn't get much better the next day. The breakfast service at LC's was poor, although the waitress was nice, the restaurant was really understaffed and the overall environment was confusing. At one point, the couple next to us got up to go to the buffet and another couple was seated in their chairs by the hostess. The scene that ensued was comedic to watch, but not a happy event for the overworked waitress that had to clear up the mess and apologize to all. And to end it all...we then stood for 40 minutes waiting for the valet service to reclaim our car. Maybe this Marriott has had a management change that has caused it to slowly degrade to just another 'tourist' hotel in San Diego. We won't be staying here again. It's a shame...

Reviews.Title: “High Floor, Away From Elevator”
Reviews.Author: PricesForTravel
Reviews.Content: Decent location, but the rooms are tired and the elevators are slow. Carpet and paint are pretty worn out in the rooms. I am an elite Marriott rewards member, requested a high floor away from elevator and was given a room on the 6th floor, first room on the right. Don't be fooled into thinking this is the closest hotel to the convention center because it really depends on where in the convention center your meeting is. The convention center is surrounded by at least 6 hotels, all an easy stroll away and all looked to be more modern that the Marriott. Doormen and valets are great, desk staff was indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough place but not for me”
Reviews.Author: WhirledTravelor
Reviews.Content: Arrived here after one night at Best Western Hacienda Old Town. We chose this place based on the pool and closeness to Gaslamp District, Seaport Village and some recommended Irish pubs we wanted to check out. Was looking fwd to a nice place with a good pool/resort atmosphere where we could relax and do nothing but eat and drink and sit at pool. Checked in about 2pm. Bit of a line but moved fast. Check in was easy after straightening out that AAA package included free self-parking. Turns out it was a brand new promotion. Note: print offers and keep with you. Marriott always has good staff. Room was 1447 in the South Tower is a nice king w/view of pool and harbor. Nice if average sized room. Looking down, pool seemed nice but packed. Went downstairs and found absolutely nowhere to sit or lounge for the next 2 hours even with multiple areas. I wasn't surprised as most places are like that, and it was 230pm, but wife was upset that they had who knows how many hundreds or thousands of people staying there and the pools and lounge chairs could accommodate maybe 10% of the guests. I know the pool staff try to free up chairs and keep people from 'reserving' lounges but they just need many more. Lots of folks pouncing on anyone looking like they were leaving was almost comical. We are just spoiled by resorts in Mexico that are huge, clean and inexpensive. This pool area is way undersized, crowded, shallow and VERY DIRTY! Wife wouldn't go in the water (she's smarter than me lol) and sat on the edge of pool on a towel as there was nowhere else to sit. Average depth of the pools was from 3-4 feet but one end I think was 5 feet and very warm from sun. Being 6'3" it wasn't much fun. Not nice or refreshing. Bottom line would be that if you are a family with little kids, this is a kid friendly place even though the price is a bit high. Tons of kids in and around the pool of all ages. Easily 3-4 kids per adult and about 5-1 in the pool. Not capping on kids it's just the pool could have been twice the size and twice the chairs for the people to be comfortable. This place should have a small extra pool for adults to swim and relax. Speaking of kids-we saw many 5-10 year olds running around alone and in groups all around the hotel. There was even one adorable little 5-7 yo riding the elevator alone sipping a Starbucks frozen drink and chatting on her phone. I can't imagine letting mine run around at that age alone in a resort hotel. Back to the pool: there were lots of empty aluminum beer bottles and drink cups all over the pool area along with empty chip packets and food wrappers that were there when we arrived and there when we left 2 hours later. Again: more help. The plus side was our room. The room was nice and a great view of the harbor. Bed is very comfortable and bathroom was big. We asked for extra towels on our registration and there were lots of extra towels. Loved it! There was even a fireworks show saturday night that we had a perfect view of from our room. The Starbucks had a long line and DW's Pub was OK but way expensive. Molly's was closed for remodel. Internet was $7 for 15 minutes and B&W printed sheets were $1 each. Roy's restaurant looked great but food was just OK and no bargain. $27 +tax/tip for a combo sampler takeout was a huge rip off. 2 pieces each of shrimp/pot stickers/ribs/sushi. I've enjoyed Roy's main courses (which are pricey) but will know to avoid this combo sampler in the future. Hotel gift shops were better than most and reminded me of Vegas hotels. Parking was expensive ($22) and very tight. I wouldn't return unless the price was closer to $125 than $175 plus tax/plus parking etc. I feel I paid for a resort I was unable to use. Bottom line would be: Plus side Good room, great staff (could use more) in all the resort area, great location by seaport village and downtown SD, Starbucks, free printed boarding pass at kiosk in lobby by check in/out (not by Starbucks), allows small pets, easy to get to, try the lounge in North Tower, take a walk on marina at night it's fantastic! Negative side Bad pool for adults that want a clean, cool pool and a lounge chair to relax in the sun. No umbrellas at all. Overpriced but decent food and drinks on site at DW's but avoid Roy's. Parking tight and expensive. NON-SMOKING PROPERTY neither good nor bad but you should know that there is nowhere on the property you can smoke even though I did see trash cans w/ashtrays built in to the top around certain spots. I didn't see anyone smoke anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Marriott- pricey but predictable”
Reviews.Author: zman319
Reviews.Content: All aspects of this visit (4 nights) were on par with my expectations of a larger Marriott attached to a convention center; upper bracket pricing for everything from room to beverages, with subsequent cleanliness and precision in customer service. I did not experience any breakdowns in service, food was fine (restaurant visits x4), pool was clean, etc. We had a balcony room in the North tower facing the bay... nice view. Attached to convention center, but than again many of the close hotels would have been fine (less than 5 min walk).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lots of Activities, A Destination Resort. Stay Here If You Can!”
Reviews.Author: smonti
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at the Hyatt Manchester Grand, but they were overbooked. They put us up at the Marriott and that may have been a mistake.... We loved the Marriott and will probably stay here the next time we are in San Diego. Activities: Multiple heated pools with waterfall. One large pool is 3.5' deep throughout and perfect for young children. The bay is just a few steps from the pools and you can rent watercraft. Bikes and surreys are for rent on the property. Setting is very tropical - lots of palm trees and chaise lounges. Can pick private spot or sit at poolside bar. Location: Perfect. Boardwalk runs behind hotel - you can walk for miles around San Diego bay. Easy walk to Gaslamp District and Horton Plaza shopping center. Trolley stops right in front of hotel. You don't need a car unless you just want one. Just minutes from airport. $6 ferry takes you to coronado island (actually I think Marriott may have their own ferry - we just didn't use it). Food: Didn't eat at Marriott, although it looked fine. Walked down boardwalk and ate at Seaport Village restaurants. Cool grocery store (Ralphs) is just a couple of blocks away. Didn't have fridge in our room - but you may be able to ask for one. The pools and lounging area are superior to the Manchester Grand. Rooms are about the same. Staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Marina, Great Views!"”
Reviews.Author: DaMayorBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Marina San Diego, 8/6-8/7. Had a great high floor room with an incredible view of the harbor. If you're staying on the weekend make sure to ask for a harbor view because there are fireworks on fri and sat nights in the summer. Place was huge, actually felt like a Vegas hotel for all the activity, but once we got to our room it was nice and quiet. Nice pool area, crowded and filled with kids, but still ok. You're in walking distance to the gaslamp district, the trolley, and a short drive to beaches. Can't wait to go back!. If you're a Marriott Elite member there is a members lounge with free breakfast but it is totally packed, not worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “The view was great and the food on location was the best.”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaH2
Reviews.Content: Great location by the bay. Good food and off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, great stay”
Reviews.Author: LErin26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend for 4 nights. I thought the hotel was really nice and everyone working there was also friendly and helpful. I felt the rooms didn't match the rest of the hotel though. They seemed dated and not as modern as the common spaces through out the hotel. Also, the bed sucked. There were two divits in the king sized mattress from years of people sleeping on them. Several times self parking was full and we were told that we could valet for the self park price, so that was nice. The pool area was really nice but we never used it. Elevators were slow, but since everyone else has already mentioned it, leave your room a couple of minutes early and you won't be late. As for the trains, we were in the south tower on the 11th floor facing the street and marina. Only a couple of times did I hear the trains. Neither of us lost any sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott = MERRY NOT”
Reviews.Author: durigirl1
Reviews.Content: What a HUGE disappointment. This property is sinking fast. We were return members to the property and we are elite members. Other than the scripted lip service, we were not even given normal courtesy never mind extra service. The room was tiny with a broken safe and a noisy rattle. Neither was ever fixed. We requested a refrigerator for medication weeks in advance and were assured we would have one. I even confirmed a couple of days before and did not receive it until the day before after we arrived. No more mini bars, no shower caps in the room and paper coffee cups. The elevators took forever. For the rest of you who commented about this, I was told by a staff member that they will be working on all the elevators for the next 2 years so the waits are not going away. If they want to compete in this tough market they better learn that return customers are their bread and butter and do a better job with service and amenities. Fairfiled Inn amenities and resort prices don't work. At least Fairfield has free coffee!!

Reviews.Title: “What was that?!?! Oh, it was the train, again!”
Reviews.Author: Honesty-Upfront
Reviews.Content: The overall location of this hotel is good. Very convenient to walk to the Gas Lamp district and located right on the marina. We had awesome views of the marina from our rooms. However, be warned: trains pass in front of hotel across the street and loudly blast their horns at all hours of the day and night. Like many hotels today, this one is no exception, they charge for everything (like parking & internet). Luckily, because we had booked such a large block of rooms, we were able to get the parking & internet fees waived. The rooms were average. Nothing special or spectacular with the size, layout, or furnishings. The staff was friendly and helpful. Large pool area. Starbucks was very busy at times and closed by mid-afternoon. We couldn't find any signs that specifically stated their hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and if you love loud trains at all hours it's even better...”
Reviews.Author: PASkyGuy
Reviews.Content: We were here for a conference and got a great conference rate for 7 nights. We stayed on the 5th floor of the North tower. The standard rooms are cramped for 2 adults and 2 kids. The sink and bathroom are separate which is a plus for us. The bathroom has a toilet and tub/shower combo and little else. The room had a small balcony with 2 chair that faced northwest with a view of the harbor on the left and a view of the city on the right. Looking from the balcony we could see the train tracks. They are active. The 'coaster' commuter rail train seems to run through that part of town every 10 mins or so. The large freight trains run less frequently but when they do...the sound of their air horns is easily heard through the closed windows and doors. Sometimes the windows and glass doors vibrated from that horn. And yes, a train goes through in the wee hours of the morning blaring the horn for 8 or 10 seconds a time. The elevators are slow when they're in heavy use, like when 300 people leave a morning conference in the hotel to go up to their rooms. After the 3rd day I discovered the service elevator.... Other than the sometimes slow elevators and the trains the hotel is very very nice. Great pool area, lots of chairs, a fair amount of towels (not many but they never ran out), very professional service from the valets, room service personnel, and front desk. Location, except for the trains, is wonderful. The convention center is next to the hotel. The Gaslamp quarter is a 5-10 minute walk and the marina is right on the hotel property. If you're staying for a week or more you might want to take some time to drive or get a cab to a laundromat. The hotel laundry fees are ridiculously high ($3.75 to launder 1 pair of underwear) and sending out your laundry - especially if you're with your family - could run over $100 to get everyone's clothes washed. A decent laundromat was on 1st avenue near Hawthorne. I'd go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Too many people, too little staff”
Reviews.Author: blueahh
Reviews.Content: As mentioned, this hotel has a great location. Unfortunately there wasn't any time of day when the elevators didn't have a line. If you had a room on the top floors, you could occasionally catch an elevator on the way down (stopping at each floor to pick up more people) but the poor people who had rooms on the 6th, 7th and 8th floors kept watching elevators crammed with people pass them by. To catch an elevator up to your room, there was a line from 6 am to midnight. Check in was just as bad as the elevators. We waited over 30 minutes to check in at 2:30 pm on a Friday. They had a roped off line similar to Disneyland but only two staff members checking in people. When we finally got checked in, we were told there was a 20 minute wait for our bags to be brought up. The pool area was nice but they had massive amounts of security watching to make sure people didn't move lounge chairs around or wrinkle the "no skid" rug that was placed between the two pools. They had one man in a black jacket watching the rug and he would speak into his collar when he needed someone to come straighten the rug. We tried to order lunch at the pool but there was only one waitress and after waiting over an hour for her to come by to take our order, we decided to pack up and leave. The rooms were clean and views were wonderful but there were just too many people and too few staff.

Reviews.Title: “great central area...but not by the beach”
Reviews.Author: labonvoyer
Reviews.Content: I got a really great rate on this hotel and I live in California, however, I think I would be disappointed if I thought I was coming for the Southern California beach experience and landed here. This hotel is located in San Diego Bay on the harbor so there is no beach. The closest beach is on Coronado Island which must be reached by driving or ferry. Having said that, it is very centrally located. You can walk to the Gas Lamp district for dinner, you can shop in Seaport village, and you can walk to see the USS Midway. Also the Trolly to "Little Italy" is right across the street. You can also use this trolly and then catch the bus to the Zoo if you want to use public transportation. The Concierge at this hotel is extremely helpful. This is a huge hotel with the San Diego conference center next door. It was very busy when we were there and the elevators were very SLOW. It caters to families so if you want quiet time at the pool-probably not. It was a very nice room for the price and I enjoyed the areas I mentioned, but I would rather shop for a great rate for something on the beach for another stay in the San Diego area

Reviews.Title: “Great location...nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: threedragons
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Marriott Marina. Hotel is in the perfect location. Easy walking distance to Petco Park, Gaslamp, USS Midway, shopping, and restaurants. Hotel has a great pool and the staff was always friendly. My kids ordered room service and loved the food...not too overpriced. My one and only complaint is the elevators...we were in the north tower and we always had to wait forever for an elevator but the views from the 20th floor were well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “If you like standing in line for elevators.....”
Reviews.Author: awcute
Reviews.Content: then this is the place for you. We stayed for 4 nights and every time that we left the room, we heard people's elevator horror stories. We stayed on the 9th floor and had to climb stairs with a 3 year old or wait an average of 15 mins for an elevator. Some friends of ours were trapped in one for 20 mins!! We even heard people complaining at the front desk. It was horrible. On the day of checkout, the housekeeping beat on our door at 7AM and asked if she could go ahead and clean our room. We told her no, we don't have to check out until noon. About an hour later, she knocked on the door and asked us again! My husband had to get rude with her! I have never experienced this before. The room was incredibly small for the price. This motel is not recommend for families with small children or people with physical handicaps that require stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Awesome Views”
Reviews.Author: KCtraveler31
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great hotel in a great location with great views. We stayed at this Marriott using points and the hotel staff treated us as if we were paying full rack rates. The maid checked with us to be sure our room was perfect. The front desk took care of all our needs and answered all our questions. The room and the hotel in general was clean and everything was in good working order. The location of this hotel is perfect for a San Diego stay - right on the bay and across from Corondao Island. You are 10 minute walk from almost every attraction in San Diego. My only complaint is they charged - like most high end hotels - to use a PC in the business center. The price was pretty pricey. They did have free PCs for confirming flights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Sophie2604
Reviews.Content: Thought the hotel was great, concierge lounge is excellent when open, stayed on points and upgraded to a nice bay view room. Found Roys restaurant mediocre and expensive but the pub was excellent food and superb value. Bellboys are real stars and great location if you need to be in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here on a vacation trip”
Reviews.Author: kw212
Reviews.Content: I was very unimpressed with the quality of the room. The closet had cheap plastic doors. In the morning when I went to take a shower, I looked for a bathrobe. It was impossible to get through on the phone to anyone in housekeeping, the concierge or the front desk; the line was constantly busy. After calling the operator, she connected me with someone who told me that you have to ask for a robe, they no longer have them in the rooms. When they brought one up, it was so threadbare, that it should have been discarded a long time ago. Next I wanted to use a shower cap; same thing, none in the room. The only amenities in the room were shampoo, conditioner & body lotion. We were in San Diego for a conference of my husband and he was paying over $400 for the room. We travel a lot; most of the time we stay in 4 and 5 star hotels. This Marriott is not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bluepaws
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in this hotel and I would highly recommend it for it's location and amenities. It is a 10-minute drive from the airport and close to many popular San Diego attractions. The SD Conference Center, Sea Port Village, the Gas Lamp district, PetCo field, parks, ferries, and access to public transportation are all within easy walking distance. My room was spacious and clean with a balcony overlooking the pool and great views of the bay. I recommend the north tower as the rooms have balconies and seem to be more updated than those in the south tower. The bed sagged slightly on one side but was comfortable on the other. LC's restaurant in the hotel has a great breakfast buffet and there are plenty of other restaurants nearby in the Gas Lamp District and Seaport Village. All of the staff I dealt with were friendly and professional and even though it's a bit expensve I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reminded me of a business man with a grass skirt but great food”
Reviews.Author: Marykatesmom
Reviews.Content: This is a convention hotel. The pool is much bigger than it looks. There were very few people in casual clothing however the location can not be beat. Seaport Village and the Gaslamp district are right there. Roy's had such terrific food that we went back again for dinner. DW, the casual restaurant had excellent burgers and great fried eggplant but otherewise had a very limited menu. I would definately recommend it to others but it does not have a tourist or resort feel to it at all. The service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer on the Outside Than the Inside”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is a very large, modern looking hotel right beside the Convention Center in San Diego. It backs up to a marina full of yachts, and a nice walking path alongside the harbor. Just a little ways down the path is the Embarcadero Marina Park and fishing pier; a walk down the other way leads to many shops and restaurants along the harborside. To me, the outside of this hotel promises more than the inside delivers... or at least more than the sleeping rooms. The room I stayed in (1642) had a great city view, but was pretty much a typical older-style Marriott room with the usual amenities. My room had an old style TV (not a flat screen or HDTV) and older looking furnishings. Don't get me wrong... it was perfectly adequate for my stay... just not anything spectacular. If you get a chance, eat at Roy's Hawaiian Fusion restaurant behind the hotel. Don't be scared off by the name... they have delicious cooked seafood as well as more unusual dishes. We had a party of 11 and it took quite a while from start to finish, but the food was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved San Diego tho”
Reviews.Author: RALPHWATSON
Reviews.Content: It had a lot of name, the staff was courteous but the hotel itself was very dull. It had no activities of its own. The room had a lot of dirt on the chair so I had to change the room but the next one had no view, an uncomfortable bed and actually dingy. Sorry for the frank opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a cruising ship”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveller73
Reviews.Content: I attended to a conference in San Diego and stayed for 7 nights at Marriot Marina. Stayed in South tower, 25th floor (city view). Overall a positive experience. Pros: - had a (complimentary) upgrade to top floor meaning that I had access to lounge which served breakfast (never tried though) and snacks during the day and evening (soft drinks free etc.). The lounge had great views! - excellent gym (for free) - given the size of the hotel the service was good (not excellent though) - food at Roy's was good. Actually excellent value for money. - location excellent. By the bay and perfect for morning jogging for example. - clean rooms Cons - although I was in the top floor the noice of the trains was REALLY annoying in the night time. So ask for a sea view room! - cruicing ship feeling. the hotel was SO crowded because of the conference (in which I attended, so I'm also to blame:-) that it took ages, for example, to get an elevator not to mention the lack of intimacy in the lobby! - hotel does not have a free wlan - hated it - Prices in the business centre horrible Overall, however, a positive experience and would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: yam1978
Reviews.Content: very trendy hotel, but very confusing parking trails, so to say...got lost where to park and how to get inside the parking garage, and then from the garage to the hotel lobby this hotel has the best breakfast potatoes in the world they have a pool, but it does not get locked, so anyone from san diego marina can just walk through...did this myself on a different trip to san diego, and when stayed at a different hotel, this marina hotel is very convenient to "cut through' from marina into town the trolley stop is right in front of the hotel loved the bathroom amenities, very nice brand we had a room with balcony overlooking the marina on the 18th floors, it was very beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: Spent a night on points to explore the city with my wife and daughter. Used a rollaway as we don't like the 2xdouble bed option, which often puts us in non-marriotts to get 2x Queen beds. Was a little tight with the rollaway, but perfectly usable. Know the two towers; in one all rooms have balconys, in the another (which has the concierge lounge) there are just large glass windows. Great views, easy walk to gaslamp diistrict, marina for harbor tours, ferry to Coronado, Midway carrier museum. My 11YO enjoyed the pool as well, though it was a bit chilly for me! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Marina San Diego - not aging gracefully”
Reviews.Author: seabri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Diego Hotel and Marina in late January 2009 just before a cruise. We used Marriott points and used extra points to be located bayside and on the concierge floor The room was very dated - furniture and carpet was stained and very worn, as was the furniture in general. Bad enough the room was in pretty bad condition; in addition using all of the extra points to be on the concierge floor was not worth it. The hotel will charge $75 to use the Concierge Lounge even if you use your additional points to stay on the floor. The hotel itself has gone from pleasant to attempting to be funky - lots of attempts to be upscale and hip, and fails miserably. In the past the hotel was definitely a 4-star property. Now, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, non-smokers - you should know about this”
Reviews.Author: rcarp626
Reviews.Content: I like my cigarette and cup of coffee in the morning. When I booked, I asked for a smoking room and was told the entire hotel is non-smoking. Asked for a room near an exit so I could comply. They gave us a room with a balcony and I used it for my vice. The weather was chilly so there weren't a lot of people utilizing their balconies (but we observed people in the other tower (w/out balconies) cracking their windows to get in a few puffs. If this had been summer, I would have requested a top floor room so that the smoke would drift up because if the room above had been occupied and they used the balcony, they could have been offended - it all turned out fine. Great room, view and location for our business travel was great. $22 to self park/day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: SweTraveller27
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at the Marriott Marina during a conference at the SDCC which is next door from the hotel, right down from the Starbucks by escalator. Hotel is about 15 minutes from the airport by cab (USD 15) and just minutes from the Gaslamp Quarter, so there was no need for a rental car during these days. We had a Standard Double on the 21st floor of the North Tower, with a partial view of the bay, was up to the usual Marriott Standards with nice bedding (gotta buy me one of those pillows anytime soonâ€¦) and spacious layout. Had a small balcony, towards the Hyatt, which we did not use (chilly nights in January). Did wake up the two first nights of the train horns at night at appr 03:30 - the rest of the way I was not bothered. Is not the hotelâ€™s fault that the freight trains pass right through San Diego at nightsâ€¦ would feel worse if I had bought one of those condos on the other side of the railroad! For most evening meals we headed down to the Gaslamp Quarter where there was much to choose from â€“ only a ten minute walk from the hotel. At the hotel, we had dinner once at Royâ€™s Hawaiian Fusion which was f-a-n-t-a-s-t-i-c and something that we can recommend! Also the DWâ€™s bar featured a nice bar meny, reasonably priced, plentiful, and tasty. The breakfast buffet at LW was only fair, only used it once â€“ settled for a grab nâ€™ go from Starbucks during the conference days. Can also recommend the Seaport Village, which is a five minute walk, for nice lunches outside of the hotel in a nice atmosphere. To summarize, a good hotel for conventions and business, in the heart of San Diego, close to the main attractions in San Diego. When in San Diego again, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pool and views!”
Reviews.Author: LovinAnyBeach
Reviews.Content: While this appears to be primarily a business hotel, it was very nice and the location can't be beat. Staff was very helpful. I'm not sure I'd opt for the additional cost of the conceirge level again, though. I'd also ask for the North tower with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriot Marina and Hotel for a week in January while attending a conference at the San Diego Convention Center. Arrival at SD airport was easy. Picked up my luggage and went out to locate a cab. The cab area was very well organized with an airport official providing assistance and the line moved quickly. A short cab ride and $12.00 later, I was very warmly greeted by the Marriot bellman. My check-in was early, smooth and my messages and pre-arranged packages conveyed promptly. Return to the airport was similarly quick and efficient. I had a standard King on the Marina side. A million dollar view. The room itself was comfortable, well kept and the window opened for some lovely sea air. It was not special or spectacular but very comfortable and serviceable. Soft water in the showers. Good bed and linens. The best part was its location right next door to the convention centre. I'm not one for breakfast, so I grabbed a Starbucks coffee and croissant and went off to my sessions. for early morning sessions, or returning to the hotel after the Gala dinner the convention centre the location could not be beat. For extra conference excursions it was located right near SD's Fifth Avenue and the Gaslamp area. It was a short walk to Macy's, Nordstrom's and Ralph's and an excellent restaurant area. Notably NOBU, which might have been worth the trip in itself. The hotel also is located on the sea walk area, also very pleasant for lunch or an early morning walk. The DW's bar/restaurant was casual and reasonably priced with generous portions. Roy's Hawaiian Fusion for finer evening dining, excellent as well. On the last day, I did the full breakfast at the LW. I was informed that the buffet was not available due to low occupancy. I was warmly greeted and offered coffee and juice which I accepted. It added $8.00 dollar to my breakfast bill that came in at 25.00 and change before tip. It was very generous (too generous, what's with the ginormous US portions?) in size and OK, but I wouldn't have it again. All service contacts were friendly and consistently good. Nice gym, rather awkwardly located but with a lovely view of the Marina. Pool area was nice enough, though only the small, shallow pool was warm enough to get into. Nice hot tub. Gift shops were good. ATM and Hertz car rental on-site. All in all, it was an excellent location and a very good base to the convention center, a good place to conduct business and meet and entertain clients. Promised a professional product and delivered. Don't think I would choose it for a "personal" resort vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Marriott, Staff Attentive, Comfy Room”
Reviews.Author: travelmutt1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights at end of Dec 2008, before heading to Rose Bowl. Location is great, walking distance to shopping in San Diego and many bars/ restaurants esp Gaslamp area. Our room overlooked the city. Room had king bed, very comfy. Room was corner room so kind of weird shaped but it worked fine for us. Hertz rental car in lobby was convenient as well as Starbucks. Pool area nice, but a little too cool to get into water. Nice marina area. We found to staff to be very friendly and accommodating. No complaints except trains outside of hotel can be a bit noise during night if your room faces city. My husband slept right through it, but I am more of a light sleeper. WOuld still highly recommend hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: SuessBD
Reviews.Content: A hotel I stay in 4-5 times a year on business and they remain one of the consistently best.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Todd_HC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (age 35) stayed at the Marriott for three nights in October. Overall, we had a very nice stay: - The location is terrific (near many restaurants and shops). - The room was nicely appointed (standard Marriott). The view of the harbor from the terrace was great. - Bed was the new Marriott type and was very comfortable. - The pool, while small for a resort, was great. The only issue that folks should be aware of is that the concierge has some deal worked out with some restaurants in the Gas Lamp district. We were sent to the same set of restaurants at least twice. The restaurants were good, not exceptional, and we felt like they were not giving their best advice.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing location, rooms need an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: jrman66
Reviews.Content: Typically when I travel for business, I find myself to be quite lazy at night time after a full day of working. This is especially true when I work in a booth; selling all day long. My requirements are simple - comfortable bed, clean room, inability to hear my neighbors at 5AM, great internet connection, close proximity to restaurants so I do not have to go far for dinner. Maybe I got unlucky with my room in the south tower- 2360, which look weathered and definitely was in need of a facelift. I travel at least 8-10 times a year and have developed certain expectations of the workspace of a hotel room since I do find myself working at night to catch up on my e-mails. My room's workspace was average at best and the chair at the desk had a piece missing from the arm. Also I felt very closed in while working in my room and actually found the room size to be small. I was also not impressed with the bathroom. OK, enough of the bad. The great was the hotel lobby, restaurants, pool, meeting facilities and LOCATION. Roys, the restaurant attached to the hotel was amazing!!! I ate at the outside bar 2 nights in a row and watched football. Also I took a walk along the water every morning before I started my day. There is also a village full of shops and other restaurants within a 5 minute walk along the water from the hotel. The pool area is fantastic. It created this whol tropical feel. After working all day I would go to the pool area to just decompose with a drink; and twice for a cigar. If you ask me if I would recommend this hotel for play and business, I would 100% say yes, even with the issues I found with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy but good”
Reviews.Author: mike_at_los_altos_CA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Marriott for 3 days two nights. We stayed in a bay view room on the high floor. We got nothing to complaint about except that it is a bit expensive. The room is very clean. A little bit old. Internet is $10/day. No WIFI. We tried Roy's Hawaiian Fusion Restaurant, food is good, not great. The pools are very nice, especially with the San Diego weather. There were a lot of people hanging out at the pool on a Sat afternoon. The hotel is next to the convention center, short walkable distance to Seaport Village, Horton shopping center, Gas Lamp area. The Gas Lamp distance has some interesting shops and lots of restaurants. We did not rent any car. Cab ride between the airport and the hotel is around US$12.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Barb_and_John
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the San Diego Marriott Hotel and Marina when I attended a meeting held in the Convention Center which is next door (and less than 5 min. walk!) After reading the Trip Advisor reviews, I requested a North Tower, high level, bay view room. We stayed in room 1228. We were not disappointed! The room was very nicely appointed, comfortable bed with nice linens, very clean. We had two chairs on our balconey and enjoyed the view of the harbor and marina (especially lovely sitting outside with a glass of wine at the end of the day!) Honestly, I cannot complain about a thing and my standards are pretty high. Staff were very friendly and accommodating, check in was a breeze (in fact, we checked in very early in the day.) I think they are working on the restaurant situation--only the Pub open while we were there in mid October. The location is a quick walk to great restaurants in the Gas Lamp District or Sea Port Village. If we return to San Diego, we'll be staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and efficient”
Reviews.Author: TwinComanche
Reviews.Content: Very attractive property adjacent to a marina and the convention center. Swimming pools, nice shopping area nearby, excellent restaurants within walking distance, beautiful area to jog along the water. All good things. The rooms are a tad on the small size -- they're fine for one or two but three would be pushing the limit a bit. Bathrooms have the shower and toilet in a separate room and the sink in an open space adjacent to the main room. That means if one person is getting up earlier than another, you'll see the light and hear them washing up. Meanwhile, the bathroom itself is very tight so if you're in there washing your 3 year old, there isn't a lot of maneuvering space. You want to be in the north tower as it has balconies - small ones, but nevertheless a big difference from the rooms without. Internet is accessible in the room for a $10/night fee. Annoying, but typical of higher hotel tiers these days. Check-in was smooth, efficient, and friendly. Room service was punctual. My oatmeal was hot, my juice cold, and service was friendly. Bath & Body Works toiletries have replaced San Diego Marriott branded soap/shampoos. While the new ones are fine, I always prefer a room that has some personality by carrying its brand throughout a room (this can be seen at high end spas like Miraval or any Disney property). The room was clean and well appointed with easy access to electrical outlets. The beds had a soft plump comforter though the mattresses were a bit tired. The HVAC cycles with a loud click but turning the system off solved that problem. The downside here is noise. I checked in on Friday night. There was music somewhere in the distance which I heard through the sliding glass door to the balcony. The trams which run along the nearby boulevard were not annoying, but a significantly louder "something" came through in the early hours of the morning - a freight train, perhaps. Also, the plumbing needs some attention as it makes a loud whistling noise in my room when others have their sink or shower on. Since this is California, many east coasters are getting up and showering at 4 and 5 in the morning. The whistling pipes woke me, and I'm a sound sleeper at that hour. I've stayed here many times over the years. It's a very convenient and comfortable all-around hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Freight Train at Night”
Reviews.Author: kjs32
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel while attending a convention in San Diego. My time over the weekend was fine, light traffic noise from the street, but nothing too unexpected. However, from Monday through Thursday, a freight train runs outside the hotel several times a night, blasting it's horn. The first night the train woke me at 1:30am and continued with the horn for 30 minutes. I asked for ear plugs, but was told they had none. The hotel bed was very comfortable and the staff were pleasant, but a good night's sleep is tremendously important when traveling. I will not stay at that hotel and would not recommend it to any but the heaviest sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blaze_03
Reviews.Content: This isn't my first stay at this hotel. It is a conference hotel located next to the Convention Center. Probably the best thing is the location directly on the water with a short walk to the Gas Lamp quarter, PETCO park, and the shops along the marina. The hotel common areas are very pretty however the rooms are just average. I travel for business often and was disappointed in the tiny old television. The rooms are small and unimpressive. However everthing was clean although our room wasn't done until 3pm each day. The food at the hotel is very good but everything is expensive. You can find great dinners in the Gas Lamp area. We attend a Padres game which is a great new stadium and everyone we talked to was nice, friendly and helpful. We rented a car and drove to LaJolla for breakfast one moring and walked along the sea wall. It was fun to see the seals on the beach. You are allowed to walk onto the beach with them but we didn't see anyone do it. We drove over to Torre Pines Golf course which is beautiful. My husband played Golf inland and it was hot inland. Staying at the water is so much more comfortable. The pool is pretty with a pleasant breeze but there is nothing really special about it. The hot tub was always crowded. A second tub would help.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bay views and swimming pools!”
Reviews.Author: janeypiejesus
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego on our California road trip and thought we'd only stay for a day but loved it so much we stayed for a night. This hotel is stunning and we splashed out on a room on a high floor with amazing views across the bay. Our room was huge with sofa's to chill out on whilst enjoying the view. The hotel's got great facilites and the pool, jacuzzi's and sauna were lovely. The only thing we were disappointed as we thought we were paying les for the room until we checked out and the staff weren't very accommodating in sorting out the confusion. Saying that, the views, location near the Gaslamp Quarter and over all vibe made up for it so we still enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: marchoffmann314
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Marriott. The hotel is very nicely decorated, the service is great. Traveled only with my wife. This is not a hotel that is great for a large family, at least not in the regular bay view hotel room we had. We ate at the D&W pub, which was cozy. Also dined at Roy's (which we frequented in other cities). The views of the marina were nice, but service was not great. The food was good. Overall very positive. A few negatives: - Walls in rooms are not at all soundproof. We heard entire conversations of our neighbors, as well as loud snoring and coughing. - Close to the downtown train tracks. Trains sound their horns at all times of the day. - Close to airport, can often hear planes take off - Self-Parking was $21 per night, and the slots were very small

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: NJtoSF
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on a family trip. While the walls are thin, and there were times that I could hear sound from other rooms, I was overall very pleased with our stay. Check in and check out were hassle free. Bed was comfortable, room was clean, and we had a terrific view of the city from our 23rd floor room. I accessed the business center to have some copies made and was delighted to learn that 20 copies were complimentary. At check in, the keys come in a card that state that USA Today is delivered and a copy of Wall St. Journal reserved, and that if you want to decline, call the front desk during your stay. I wanted WSJ, but it was a small hunt to find the copies at the Concierge desk. There is clearly the intent that most won't go to the trouble. Small inconvenience, and only when having such a positive experience would it be noticed.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay again!”
Reviews.Author: tedandlisa90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for an overnight stay before heading to TIJ airport. We usually stay at the Marriott Gaslamp. I actually liked this hotel better as it is right on the marina with beautiful views and a nice size balcony. The hotel itself seems to cater more to business people and families. Its an older hotel but looks to have been renovated . Its very large with a resort style pool area restaurants and bars etc.. Our room was good size and was a typical Marriott quality that we've become used to. Easy check-in and check-out, nice staff.Great location to gaslamp area and marina. We'll stay here again next time we visit San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Nice View but very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLeoNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Diego Marriott Marina Hotel for 3 nights for a business convention. The room was okay. i have stayed in other Marriotts where the rooms had more updated and nicer bathrooms and furnishings. There were 3 other people from my company staying here and we were paying the same price for the rooms and we had a wide variety of rooms in which we stayed in. My room was the largest and I was on the 23rd floor with a balcony with a water view. I checked out the other rooms that people I was traveling with stayed in. One other person had a room with a balcony and a water view.The other two had rooms with no balcony, no view of the water and the rooms were much smaller, no refrigerator and there was very little dresser space to keep their clothes. The thing that was the same for all rooms is that you hear the train going by in the middle of the night. If you are a light sleeper you will hear the train.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: BJRicks
Reviews.Content: This was a "tag along with my husband" on his business trip relaxation vacation for me. I first researched the assigned hotel that was the site for the conference to decide if I wanted to go. Definately a yes! Per the reviews I asked for a room in the balcony section. I also asked for a room with an ocean view, but they cost more so I settled for a city view. I was very pleased to find my "city view" was of the harbor, boats, partial ocean, and seaport village. I even asked if they had upgraded us but they hadn't! The room faced over the AC motors/fans so opening the balcony was a bit noisy but it was still nice to let in the fresh air and look out over the water. It was also nice to know what the weather was like. The room was very comfortable with a small fridge for my food I had brought along. The bed had the very cozy new bedding. Just a delight to relax in. I did not get into the pool but spent an afternoon reading under one of the umbrellas after I had to check out, but wait for my husbands seminar to be over. It was delightlyfully pleasant, beauatiful, and very big! I really should have taken the time a previous day to enjoy it. Seaport Village was right out the back door, easy access to very nice meal spots. We ate a dinner at a very good Greek "taverna" right on the water with very simple prices. I took a day to play with our new handheld GPS, hunting the Harbor area on foot for hidden treasures (see geocache.com) and saw a whole new San Diego I didn't know existed even though we have been many times. This was a very pleasant hotel to relax and pass the time, although very large and lots of walking. Parking was a bit confusing and access to the Hotel entrance was kind of strange. Hotel and parking was expensive, but not on our ticket. I would have loved to have been able to stay longer. Definately recommend. About the cost...after staying in a more expensive (not so great) Sacramento RI this week, this doesn't seem so bad after all. If you had to choose...go SD.

Reviews.Title: “High humidity in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: EyeConnect
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times for conventions, and the hotel is very nice -- clean, convenient, good food, friendly staff. However, my recent stay of 4 days was most uncomfortable due to the high humidity in the air. The air conditioning simply doesn't remove the humidity, and I was never comfortable. The air always felt way too damp, and I was clammy even with the thermostat set to 68. It was the same throughout the hotel - not just in the rooms. The bed was noticeably saggy but not hard like some. One problem is the smell that I believe comes from the bathroom sink. When the water first comes on, there's a bad smell. It probably comes from the overflow drain as water going down the drain forces some air out. The hotels should regularly spray a cleaner or disinfectant into the overflow drains since those things never get cleaned. The smell might also be rotten stuff in the trap, in which case the hotels should regularly maintain those as well. Ditto for bathtub drains.

Reviews.Title: “A sad ending to a great trip”
Reviews.Author: twcsmom
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is huge hotel with 2 towers. As far as restaurants, the food was fair, but there was not alot to choose from for kids. My son did like the Starbucks that was downstairs, though. The hotel is pretty and the pools are nice. The hot tub was a little small. On one of the nights, they showed a kids' movie by the pool, so kids could swim and enjoy the show. The problem came upon our departure. When we left the hotel, we were homeward bound. Upon landing, my children and I remembered that we had left some souveniers in the hotel room. I immediately called the hotel to see if they had found them. The lady who answered the phone could not contact lost and found because they were already closed. After trying to contact the person who cleaned the room, she found that the room had been cleaned, but the person who did the trash was already gone and they did not have a contact number. The lady who anwered the phone was kind enough to go to the room herself to look for the items. She called me back to report the items had already been cleaned and removed, but that I could check back the next day to see if they were in lost and found. When I called the next day, Marriot contact the man who did the trash for the room and after much conversation with Marriot, it was found that the items were indeed thrown away. To their credit, Marriot did have some people search through the trash as best they could, however the items could not be found. I was very frustrated that a hotel such as the Marriot would so carelessly throw away souveniers. These souveniers were in a DISNEYLAND sack. Easily, if someone had bothered to look inside, they would have found that they were items that were not meant to be left behind. It was totally my fault for leaving them, but I do believe the person who cleaned the room went the easy way out in order to not have to be bothered by taking items to lost and found. One of Marriot's reponses to this was that they are a convention hotel and people are always leaving items they don't want that have been give aways in their hotel rooms. The supervisor over housekeeping did acknowledge that the cleaners should be more observant to what they think is trash. Marriot did offer me and my family a 2 night stay at their hotel in San Diego in case we are back in that area. The sad thing is, the drawings that were lost are ones that cannot be recreated, and are not something I can just purchase online. I am largely responsible, but I would have expected more out of a high dollar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, priceless view but noisy...”
Reviews.Author: CaTraveltheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Mariott. The location is great.You can walk to Horton Plaza, the Marina is just in front of you.... The pool is great, Starbucks is at the lobby, yes there is a charge for the parking but it is a part of staying in a city. We had the top floor, half ocean half city view towards the airport side. The view is breaktaking, priceless. The room is good size, pretty clean but noisy..... First night I was tired and did not hear anything. The other two nights, I could not sleep at all. It is the train, the tracks are right behind the hotel and when it is quiet at night, that horn is endless.... The service truck was making noise in the parking lot around 5 a.m. Single pane doors... Maybe ocean front rooms do not hear this.Although I loved the the location, the view, I would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely fabulous time at this Marriott. From some additional help I received prior to our arrival in getting our reservation straight, to a smooth and welcoming registration, everyone was very helpful and efficient. I was impressed by the level of customer service they maintained, even while being the official Comic-con host hotel.
