The rooms aren't overly large, but the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. Room service was quick and satisfying. Housekeeping was great and we weren't bothered by anyone whenever our do not disturb sign was out. I never had any problems with self-parking, even with the convention going on. We stayed for 6 nights and were in town for both business and pleasure. We will return again! And even with a room on the 19th floor facing the city, the train was never an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Rude, and dreadful”
Reviews.Author: AaronMichaelTCU
Reviews.Content: Our problems started before we even checked in. The hotel has nearly 1400 rooms, yet probably only about 250 self-parking spots. So, if the hotel is even remotely busy...guess what... you are stuck paying the $32/nt to Valet (plus tip of course) instead of the $21/nt to self park. We rode around for awhile and found ONE available spot and grabbed it. However the rest of the trip we weren't so lucky and ended up paying the steep valet rate. This hotel seems to be built out of cardboard as it was incredibly loud, even on the Bay side. We could hear every little thing our neighbors were doing, even above us. This included hearing the guy in the hotel room next to us doing his "morning business." It was the loudest hotel I have ever stayed at, and that includes staying in the middle of NYC or Kuala Lumpur. You would think a bay side room in San Diego would be somewhat quiet...not the case at this place! Since there was a convention going on they also gouged people on price and our room (standard king size room with no balcony) was $515/nt. (We didn't have a choice in hotel and if so we definitely would not have stayed here at that price.) So by the time you tack on tax, valet, tips, internet, etc it can get all the more pricey. The other major problem at this hotel was our rude maid. Upon checkout on a Sunday morning at 10am, we found a note on our door that she had written herself that exlaimed, "Please take down your do not disturb sign so I can cleanyour room!" Ummm at $515 a night and at 10am on a Sunday morning!? Excuse me!? Bad bad bad customer service. It would have been one thing if it was say 2:00pm, but it was 10am on a Sunday the day we were checking out! Give me a break. And to top it all off we received a grand total of 40 AAdvantage miles from staying here because someone messed up and only included our internet charges when awarding us points. I can honestly say this is about the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and I always try to be optimistic about things too so I will end on a good note by saying a concierge guy by the name of Chris was wonderful. He was the one redeeming thing in that entire mess of a hotel. I am very dissapointed in this Marriott property and would never recommend it to anyone...not even at $150 a night.

Reviews.Title: “AMazing location...service and amenities perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: MattHolly
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible experience the night before at a Days Inn( traveling on business trying to keep costs down) This Marriott is an amazing location, great service and lots to do close by LOVED IT!!!! although you pay for it $300 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: stevesnis
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days at the Marriott Marina last week. Room on the 16th floor, Marina side. Never heard the train once (so book a Marina room!) Beautiful view of the marina, harbor and Coronado Island from the balcony in our room. Maid service was great every day, never had to wait or had any issues. Room was very nice (albeit a bit small) and bed was quite comfortable. Why no free internet tho??? Hotel itself is in a great location. Walking distance to Gaslamp and easy access to the harborfront walking/biking path. We used valet parking on the first day ($30.00/day), but switched to Self Park after that ($20.00/day) with no issues. Easy in and out from the self park lot and found no problems with driving around town. For those taking cabs, it's really simple to get one at the front entrance. They wait on the street and the bellmen wave them up as needed. My only issue is a minor one. There was a 5k that held starting at 6:30 AM on Saturday morning!!! Right on the waterfront and right next to the hotel. Between the music and the people using the microphone to pump up the runners, it was incredibly annoying. I'm all for a nice run, but at 6:30 am on a Saturday morning with an entire hotel full of sleeping guests not 50 feet away???? Not sure who planned the logistics of that one. Other than that, we had a great stay and would recommend the hotel to any travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a Hotel or a Train Station??”
Reviews.Author: Blueboro
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in the hotel for a convention. While the property is nice, the room itself is nothing special. The hotel is expensive and it irritates me that most $75 a night hotels can provide free internet access but a $300 per night hotel charges $10 per day. And the valet parking is $30 per day. If you like trains you will LOVE this property. I have never stayed in a louder hotel and I stay about 100 nights per year in them. I was in the North Tower with a balcony looking out over the city and part of the marina. Each night from about 11:00pm to 4:00am large freight trains would make their way through the city. They go about 3 MPH and, due to the large number of crossings, constantly blow their horn. And one night they decided to switch cars and it sounded like an earthquake each time the couplers hit. I used to live close to a railroad track but I have never experienced louder trains. It may be because the sound echos off of downtown buildings. With all of the screwy laws California has I am surprised they do not have some type of noise ordinance restricting the trains to certain hours. Unfortunately many hotels I assume have the same problem since Harbor Avenue is one of the primary streets. The pool area is nice and service was good. The hotel is convenient to hundreds of restaurants, clubs, Petco Park, and almost anything you need. But I would rather it be less convenient and be able to catch a few hours sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again - from Alabama”
Reviews.Author: TrojanBill1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this property June 21st - June 28th. The primary advantage is its location and the price ($169.00 per night). It is a $10.00 cab ride (one way) to Balboa Park, it is located 4 blocks from Horton Plaza and the nearest city bus line, and it is across the street from the city trolley system. This was my second stay at this property, and I was able to reserve a bay-view room. Of the 25 stoey building, I was on the 21st floor, and my wife felt that the views were the best part of the trip. I spent two days ay Balboa Park. I purchased the Balboa Passport, and I was able to visit all of the museums that are of interest to me. My wife and I took the city bus (route 901) to Coronado (25 minutes each way). I suggest seeing the Hotel Del (Coronoado) and strolling on the beach, but there is very little else of interest on the island. We also took a city bus (route 30) to La Jolla (45 minutes to an hour each way). We spent the day there, but wished we had rented a car to go further inland. We also took the city trolley to La Mesa, for antiques shopping. We considered the Zoo, but the weather was unseasonably hot. I would stay at this property again, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Metsfan5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in June to see a Padres game. Fairly typical large, convention-type hotel, but with great location downtown, As mentioned in other reviews, while the location is great, the noise from the trains can be annoying. Based on the prior recommendations, we requested a bay-facing room. However we still heard the trains, though I'm sure it was even louder on the city side of the hotel (we were on the 17th floor). One other note - we were in the south tower with no balcony (great view though). I noticed that rooms in the north tower all appeared to have balconies if that matters to anyone. We avoided the hotel restaurant breakfast and went to a local pancake house a few blocks away which was fine. Overall, the great location near Petco Park, Gaslight District and the Seaport area more than made up for any shortcomings from the noise. I would stay here again if in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loud! Busy! Small room”
Reviews.Author: wherecanwegonext23
Reviews.Content: We took our children to this hotel because it was in a great location and had a wonderful pool. The pool scene was the best part of the stay!! The room was very SMALL and shaped weird, having 2 adults and 2 kids. We were on the 23rd floor with a great view of the city but at night the train is SOOOOOOOO loud be prepared!! Also, our air didn't ever get cold or blow fast!! Be sure to check that out before deciding to stay in your room. We valet parked and it was pricey (like every other place) but they were quick to get our car. The drink prices were too high. We ate at Roy's and it was very good, recommend it. The drinks were not very strong for 10.00 bucks! The pool was wonderful for the kids.... The hotel was very busy when we were there, they were having a conventions and this meant you would wait a long time for the elevator to come and when you finally got on you would stop at every floor to get someone..... I think the hotel is great but could use some upgrades, and a call to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: TravelMavin
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel! This place has very nice rooms, and friendly and helpful staff. It's right next to the convension center and has a nice view of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and staff”
Reviews.Author: dmsmorgan
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here one night while attending the US Open. The location is fabulous - next to marina and Seaport Village. The trolley is right across the street for transportation to local attractions. We loved everything about this hotel - our room (corner room in south tower with wonderful city and bay views), pool (beautiful resort-style), lobby and grounds. The staff was especially pleasant and helpful. We did hear the train once during the night, but expected that after reading reviews. I highly recommend this hotel, particularly the corner rooms (book a city view and request a "40 series" room in the south tower, upper floor - fabulous!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: BZTraveler
Reviews.Content: Plus: Right at the marina and adjacent to the convention center. A convenient walk to the Gaslamp District. Beautiful view. Wonderful pool area for a hotel on that location--great for adults and kids. Has a Starbucks in the lobby. Plus/Minus: Self-parking was $20.00 per night with unlimited in and out proviledges (far cheaper than other places but a long walk a way). There is valet parking, depending on the wait it may be worth it. Huge hotel. Nice: The room and bathroom were nice but nothing memorable. Clean and comfortable. Nice bath products. Note: During the same time, I also stayed at the Westin. The Westin was OK but between the two I prefered the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: HappyAtlantaTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are here at the Marriott right now. I'm up writing because we haven't been able to sleep for the past 2 nights because of the incredibly noisy conditions outside the window. We're on the 22nd floor but we might as well be trying to sleep on the sidewalk. The train is a nightmare. I just counted 12 - that's twelve - long blasts from the train horn. Noises from the city traffic, as well as people shouting downstairs, add to the noise level. The first night, we called about the noise and were told that it was the same throughout the hotel. This morning we called at 4 am and were told that we would be moved at 10 am to a quieter room. We are hoping that we do indeed get a new room as we are completely exhausted and not looking forward to the next 6 days of this trip. The Starbucks in the lobby is convenient and opens early (since we're awake already we have been waiting outside by 6 am). I had dinner at DW's Pub last night. The bill was $28 for an order of fish and chips, house salad and an ice tea. I don't think I'll have another meal there as the quality of the food was not very good. There is no shuttle from the airport to this hotel. While waiting for our bags at the airport, I called the Courtyard Marriott and they said they'd be happy to send a shuttle for us if we were staying there. It's unclear why one Marriott in town would have a shuttle while this one does not. We were told to take the Express shuttle which costs $7 per person. We took a taxi which cost us less than the shuttle. Internet service is not complimentary. Everything is very expensive. In addition, when we arrived, our room had not been serviced properly. There were dirty towels in the closet, no bath mat, toiletries, or soap, and the TV was broken. This is the worst Marriott experience we have ever had. If you book here, beware.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Marriott brand, but still under renovation”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Marina three times before and this is the first time I've been here since the main lobby was renovated. The renovations make the area larger and, unfortunately, it can get crowded as people -- especially groups -- wait for taxis, buses, etc. At the time of my stay, they had not begun upgrades of the sleeping rooms, but were working on the outside restaurant near the marina. Despite signs indicating it was open, the restaurant was in fact still closed. DW's Pub in the South Tower serves the traditional Marriott bar food and you have the option of sitting in the bar or by the large windows overlooking the pool and gardens. Molly's in the North Tower features an upscale, expensive menu. The wait staff here were very prompt and the sommelier stopped at each table to chat with customers, which was a very nice touch. There's also the standard Marriott breakfast buffet also in the North Tower. The rooms are the standard, older-style Marriott rooms with the upgraded bedding. The desk is a decent size and the lamp has two outlets to plug laptops and phone chargers into. However, if you have more than two things to charge at the same time, you'll be hunting around for unused outlets. The bathroom was moderately sized and featured Bath & Body Works amenities. Housekeeping was efficient and respectful of my "do not disturb" request and the concierge was very helpful. I had a King, City View room that did not have a balcony. Although I was close to the elevator, I didn't hear the binging all that much, However, I could occasionally hear my neighbors, especially as they were entering and exiting the rooms, closing the doors with a loud slam. The meeting and banquet staff were some of the best I have worked with in a long time, easily exceeding my meeting expectations. The catered food was excellent and they had no quibbles about bringing in a specialty wine for my event. Keep in mind that this hotel is *huge* and next to the convention center. It's great for families that are traveling since the pool area is nice and there are plenty of places to walk. The hotel's location is nice as well, within walking distance of an open-air mall (about 15 minutes) and a few blocks away from the Gaslamp District. Why settle for hotel food when you have a wide variety just down the street? Downsides to the hotel: The noise. With freight trains and passenger trams on the "city side", be ready for clanging at 3 a.m. as the freight passes. Even when I had a Marina View room, I could hear the clanging. You will also probably be able to hear noisy neighbors. Internet access fee. $11/day. As a business traveler, this annoys me to no end, especially when I can go down the street to a Courtyard and wireless access is free. Fitness room not in the hotel. A minor quibble, of course, but you have to exit on the fourth floor and walk over to the convention center. Getting lost between North and South Towers -- As I mentioned, the hotel is huge. If you are staying here for a convention, be sure to request a room in the South Tower since it is closest to the convention center. The Business Center is located in the South Tower. While the staff is friendly, there are only a few computers available for use. Nonetheless, it is a quality Marriott hotel that is in the process of renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs a little make-up”
Reviews.Author: srhmmj
Reviews.Content: Attended an event at the Conference Center next door; great location to be. Also, in comfortable walking distance to all al-fresco restaurants. Loved the pool area. Rooms pretty big but especially bathrooms need an urgent touch of modernisation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: andiamo
Reviews.Content: Joined my husband attending a seminar last week of April and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this Marriott. Generally prefer to stay @ Westin, Ritz, but this was very nice. The location is perfect for walking. Food in the hotel was very good. The room overlooking the bay was large (with couch, sliding glass door/ balcony) and spotlessly clean! All staff I encountered, were very professional. The only downside was the nightly train that sounds it whistle when approaching intersections.... that can be heard from every room !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Very nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: shrbear
Reviews.Content: Stayed and got excellent Govt. rates. The staff was friendly and helpful. The views were very pretty. Cannot wait to stay at this hotel again. A+

Reviews.Title: “Woken up at 3am every morning: really noisy!”
Reviews.Author: cheeki_munki
Reviews.Content: My first impressions of the hotel were good: Lovely reception area and friendly staff. The room however was distinctly average and in real need of decoration. It had a motel feel to it and was not what I would expect from the Marriott. I did however have a nice (although not very functional as it was very small and pokey) balcony. The balcony half looked towards the marina, providing an excellent view, and half faced down town San Diego (not so excellent). I thought that the hotel was nice enough until my first nights sleep....... I was woken up at 3am in the morning to, what I initially thought, was a really loud fog horn!! The train that runs along the back of the hotel made very frequent nightly trips past the hotel, sounding its horn intermittently 6-7 times (no exaggeration) as it (painfully) slowly passed. I am not normally a light sleeper but this really was annoying as it happened every night throughout my 5 night stay at the hotel. Besides the rude awakenings, the hotel had a nice enough pool area (which is mainly in the shade in the mornings) and nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Views”
Reviews.Author: ccs124
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Easter weekend. My family lives in San Diego and we got a good rate on the room. The room was above our expectations. It was a bay view room which had extraordinary views of coronado and the marina. It had the cartoons for my daughter and HBO for my husband and I. The bathroom was a good size and the beds were very comfortable. My daughter loved the pool area and it stayed open to about 11pm so she was very happy. We ordered room service in the morning and it was very well presented. She set the whole thing up for us, even pouring us our first glass of coffee. For $45 for 3 people it was worth it because the food was excellent. Especially the San Diego omelette. We had a great stay and will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: gooooogirl
Reviews.Content: Wow! This place has the most beautiful view! There are only a few balconies -get one! Well appointed rooms. Close to downtown and the convention center. Gorgeous grounds! Hard to check out!

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: akfs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Marina San Diego for 3 nights with our 4 year old son and 4 month old son. My 4 year old loves vehicles of all sorts--so this place was a dream for him. From our north tower hotel room (16th floor) we had a view of the marina with all of the boats passing by on one side and on the other side, he could see the trolleys and amtrak trains passing by., as well as airplanes landing and taking off from the airport. That said, our room got a little noise from the trains and such, but it wasn't loud. The room was very clean, well-decorated and comfortable. It is also within easy walking distance of the USS Midway, the carousel and tons of restaurants. It is also convenient to all the public transportation stops. The customer service at the hotel was excellent--every staff person was highly professional and friendly. The swimming pools are beautiful and very well heated. My only complaint is that it is a very popular hotel with lots of conferences going on, so there were times (especially around check-out time) when we had to wait a whie to get on an elevator. Also, the hotel room did have a small refrigerator but it would have been nice to have had a microwave as well. However, if given the opportunity, we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with 1travelca -- avoid the city side”
Reviews.Author: Travelor088
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok but the trains on the city side can be very noisy-- I was awake from 3-5 am and I am not usually bothered by noise.

Reviews.Title: “The worlds most intellegent waiter?”
Reviews.Author: aasekristiansand
Reviews.Content: So I go the the bar to order a beer and the waiter ask`s for an ID. I give hime my drivers licence but it`s no god for him. So I show him my PASSPORT when he answers "We don`t take foreign ID`s". And bear in mind that this is a hotell!! Unbelievable service, realy makes you feel welcomed, oh so not!

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: A huge convention hotel with some california touches (for instance cucumber flavored water in the lobby), by the personality challenged San Diego Marina (nevertheless by beautiful waters and with easy access to many restaurants and shope). The room was comfortable but small after a switch because first room was much too noisy (some vent problem). Internet access was without problem, room service excellent. Starbucks on the first floor is convenient and pastries are better than at usual starbucks actually. Hotel has several restaurants, all good if expensive.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class at a Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: pcmendez99
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids have stayed at this hotel several times. What we enjoy the most is its prime location. It's at walking distance to many places such as the Convention Center, Seaport Village, restaurants, Gaslamp Quarter, the Trolley, and more! It's also a short driving distance to any area attractions like the San Diego Zoo, Old Town, Seaworld, or any stadiums. We especially love the proximity to Seaport Village, where you can take a stroll along the bay and check out the many shops, gardens and restaurants. I would recommend you request a room in the north tower, or any room not facing the city. The last time we stayed here our room faced the city, and the ringing bell to the orange metro train kept waking me up. Rooms in the north tower have a bay view with beautiful sunsets and these are the only rooms with a balcony. The pool is great and offers a unique tropical atmosphere. It has fire pits, a grass shack bar and many sitting areas. Great fun for the family and kids. The only draw back for me personally is the $20 a day parking! But we keep staying here, so the pros, definitely out weigh the cons!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to kick your feet up!”
Reviews.Author: deadgrassdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a special romantic get away weekend. The location is great for a tour of the Gas lighter district and still experience a romantic sunset at the beach. We stayed in a balcony suite was very nice clean and comfortable. I would forgo the Balcony room next visit cause we really didn't need or use it for the extra price. Overall a very nice experience at a great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top shelf. Highly Recommended business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Warftr5
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed here on a business trip and I joined her for a weekend away together. The amenities, cleanliness and location are all what you'd expect from a large chain hotel. First class, nothing unique. I must compliment the staff however. They were a cut above and consistently went the extra mile to meet any service request. Location is perfect for accessing Gaslamp District and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Large Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leclaire68
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Marriott in San Diego twice now, both times for conventions. If you're attending a convention in San Diego, chances are this hotel is one of the main hotels to be used by your convention. It is convenient for that ... practically attached to the convention center itself. And compared to other convention hotels in other cities, the location right on the marina is fantastic. But I think this hotel is just too large and teeming with conventioneers to be appealing for much other than convention travel. The lobby area between the two towers seems like a busy ant highway to me sometimes ... people zipping every which way ... nobody seems relaxed. Getting to your tower's elevators is a hassle ... especially in the north tower: you have to basically walk through a crowded lounge area where crusty salesmen down a drink after a day on the convention exhibit floor. The rooms are just fine ... typical Marriott ... nothing too special. The views, if you get a room that has one, are fantastic though. For business and convention travel, I would (and probably will!) stay here again. For R & R or just a getaway ... nah, there are better places to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: eastm
Reviews.Content: Just returned business trip from San Diego. Great location near by the Marina and Seaport Village. Next door to Convention Center. Also close to Gas Lamp Area. Lots of good restaurant. Hotel room is OK. You pay most price for the great location. Staff are very friendly. Good for business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay over Labor Day weekend '07”
Reviews.Author: RanAndNess
Reviews.Content: Overdue review, but hopefully of help. We stayed @ The San Diego Marriott Hotel & Marina for 3 nights over Labor Day weekend, and were overall satisfied based on our expectations and previous experiences with the Marriott chain. Location: Cab ride was about 10 minutes, and location is very nice. Gaslamp district for dining and nightlife is about a 10 minute walk, or $3usd cab ride. Rooms: We stayed in a King/Resort room on the south tower, which is the newest of the two but in which rooms do not have balconies. Room was spacious enough for 2, and kept clean and replenished with towels/basic ammenities daily. Food: We had breakfast at the hotel twice and enjoyed some good omelettes and your usual breakfast fare. All served warm and by nice servers. Activities: The hotel's pool is larger than most @ hotels in the area but because we stayed over a holiday weekend it was very crowded. Nevertheless, it was nice to sit underneath one of the palm trees and enjoy the cool water. Also, the hotel does offer a water taxi (at cost) to Coronado, for a nice day at the beach or bike riding (rentals). Overall, the hotel was centrally located, rooms and common areas were kept clean, and staff was friendly. We would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Darkwing_Duck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Marina while attending a convention at the convention center next-door. Loved the hotel. Perfect location for convention-goers as well as quick access to the gaslamp district in the evenings. The view of the Marina was very nice. The price was a bit high but when the company is paying for a business trip there's no reason to complain.

Reviews.Title: “NO value”
Reviews.Author: avidtravlers
Reviews.Content: We decided on a San Diego vacation to bring in the new year with the family. I didnt even blink twice at the high rate that was offered because I knew from past experience that Marriotts are great hotels. Unfortunately, now, I will think twice next time.. the "view rooms" requested didnt happen, upon entering our room it was at least 85-90 degrees with the heater full blast...only to find out later that the heat was on full blast because the carpets had just been shampooed and were soaking wet.....causing for wet socks and a VERY slippery bathroom floor....outside noise was rediculous, it was like having the door WIDE open....traffic, trains, planes, you could hear everything, even people talking from the ground floor..and we were on the 14th!......upon making the reservations I asked if there were any new year party's going on, I was told there was, but I didnt expect the "kegger" that insued....there were people all over the hallways, drunk, loud, broken bottles, puke....all nasty..we did not even attend any of the partys at the hotel, we saw all of this as we returned to the hotel and our room.....no lie, it took 40 minutes for an elevator just to get to the 14th floor.....and nobody was concerned even after asking for assistance, we were blown off.....I think that guests staying at the hotel should be priority over the young party goers.....yeah, im bitter.....feel like i was ripped off.........I'll definitely read reviews before booking any hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: shelleyrtaylor
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. The hotel makes you feel like you are home. If you stay and are interested in spa services I would recommend Suki on 4th in the Gas Lamp district. The front desk at the hotel had me go to Suki as they did not have spa services available there is also a spa accross the street I have to believe Suki is by far the best. $89 for a 3 hour facial. Best I have ever had. Also we had a mix up with our room but the hotel made it right. There are wonderful places to eat at the hotel as well. Molly's is a must. Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sabre823
Reviews.Content: Fantastic & friendly staff. Super views of the harbour, easy access to areas of interest in/around San Diego. Close to international airport & shopping. Rooms were very clean & of good size. Overall good value

Reviews.Title: “good location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: onoman
Reviews.Content: Went to a business meeting for the weekend at the San Diego Marina Marriott. Good location adjacent to the Convention center. Next to Seaside Village, nice walk at nite. Also very close to Gastown and Downtown area, although these require a little more of a walk. If you are travelling from LA or Orange County and do not want to drive, the Amtrak station is very close by. Hotel itself is OK. I was a little disappointed by the noise from the trains that are nearby and I was on the 9th floor. My room looked like it had not been vacuumed or picked up. I had to pick up a few stray coat hangers that were lying on the floor and there a few pieces of sharp black plastic on the dark carpet, fortunately I found them before taking off my shoes. Otherwise the room was nice. Also had to explain to the hotel staff that there was no ethernet cord in the room, they kept asking me to search the room. Wireless is probably only available in lobby. There is a charge a $10/day charge for internet access and parking is $20 for self-park and $28 for valet. Food was OK, may have due to what was ordered for the meeting. Healthclub is available 24 hours and looked nice. If you like tennis courts, there are 4 available on site. Had a better dinner at the buffet at the nearby Hyatt. Pool available, but there is no beach access nearby. Would I stay here again if I was going to a convention next door, probably not, there are many other hotels nearby. Would I recommend staying here for a vacation, I guess so, but there are also other options around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient, and as expected”
Reviews.Author: WI-Couple
Reviews.Content: The nice thing about Marriott is that you know what you're going to get, clean, quiet, and nice location. This hotel is no exception. The room was clean and nice, nothing special but spacious and accomodating. The balcony with the "Bay View" (north tower) was spectacular. Unfortunately I never got a photo. The hotel is right across from the convention center, which is why I came to San Diego. They have a dry walkway since it insisted on raining several days. They have a very nice (but expensive) breakfast buffet downstairs. The hotel has several restaurants on site but is also close to the Gaslamp district (walk up either 4th or 5th street for lots of choices) or Seaport Village (didn't love the food anywhere but the views are gorgeous). Their concierge service helped us out a lot, and cheerfully. They have a water ferry that goes over to Coranado island for $6/each way. We took the shuttle back from the Hotel Del Coranado to the Marriott on the way back for $24. Internet (no WiFi) is $9.95/day and supposedly includes local and long distance calling although I never used that. On a separate note, I found taxi's to be rather expensive in San Diego overall. This was a $20 ride from the airport and from the hotel up to Mission Beach area I paid over $30 each way with tip. After being spoiled in NYC the week before it was difficult to adjust. Luckily this hotel is close to many restaurants and attractions, in this town that's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 at Ritz prices”
Reviews.Author: HeatherWilson
Reviews.Content: I agree the view is nice and it is near the convention center. However the service is terrible, it is a bit run down and outdated, and the room rates are out of controll. The quality of the rooms was at best a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient, Best View of Bay”
Reviews.Author: mainetoday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and 2 nights as part of our honeymoon in Sept. First off, upon checking in we were warmly greeted and instantly upgraded to this room for our honeymoon, what a treat!!! We got a bayview room w/ a balcony in the North tower on the 23rd floor overlooking the bay. What a great view. A few minutes after we checked in, the manager sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne for us. Now that was classy!!! We happened to be in town during the Red Bull Airshow and it was just amazing to see the show below us from our balcony. Great view of Coronado as well. This hotel room had a small sitting area and a fridge in it. It was very convenient to Seaport Village and to downtown and the Gaslamp District. All within easy walking distance. Plenty of stores, restaurants and bars close by. We even walked up to Little Itally one day and had an excellent meal at a nice little trattoria there. We did spend some time at the pool, which was nice as well. All in all, a nice hotel which was clean and convenient to many of the downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Marina”
Reviews.Author: lowrider_67
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the Marriott! My husband and I arrived from the East Coast at 10 PM on a Thursday evening for a 4 night stay. We were greeted by the valet and he quickly helped us with our bags. There was absolutely no line at check-in. I had requested a feather free room due to allergies. They originally did not have this request in their computer but they quickly and efficiently changed our room. We had booked a king bay view room on the hotel website. Make sure you check it out. They were running a special stay 3 nights get the 4th free. What an incredible savings this was. Our room was in the south tower with a gorgeous view of Coronado Island, the pool, and Seaport Village. The room was clean-no hair, soap scum, etc. as other guest has mentioned. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was a good size and had a chair with ottoman, a desk, and an armoire with TV. The bathroom was spacious and the bath products were very nice. You do hear the train occasionally but it really did not bother us much. The location of this hotel is one of the best in the area. Only a 5 minute walk to Seaport Village and the Gaslamp Quarter. If you stay directly in the Gaslamp you will have considerable noise due to the large amount of bars and restaurants. The USS Midway was a 10 minute walk and well worth the trip. Valet is a must. Call down when you leave your room and the car will be waiting. They were always very polite and asked each time if we needed directions. This was helpful since we have never been to San Diego before. We had room service one morning for a quick start to the day. Otherwise we only had drinks at the hotel. The hotel was full but we never experienced any problems with the service. Rooms were cleaned promptly and staff was overly helpful. We will definately stay at the Marriott Marina when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: supernovea
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews of his hotel before going so I was expecting the noise train to pass around 6am. The first time it's scary, the next morning you're ok with it. However, better windows would help. The room was very clean and a very good size. However the matresses are in need to be changed as they are just too soft. The location of this hotel is perfect for business as well as family trips.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: Tecuya
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had. I was there on business for three days and from the moment I stepped out of my car until the moment I regretfully had to leave, every staff member was friendly, professional and helpful. I was using Marriott Rewards for the first time and had my room upgraded to a bay view in the South Tower. The beds and the pillows were amazing--the most comfortable I've ever had! (Too bad I didn't take an empty suitcase!). The bed was like sleeping on a dozen quilts and there were about 7 stay fluffy pillows. I'm sorry I didn't bring a bathing suit because the sparkling pool looked so inviting, very large with waterfalls and a hydrospa. It was a bit pricey in the restaurants, but there were many to chose from. Plus being in the downtown area you can walk to the Seaport Village and Gaslamp quarter in only a few minutes. A lot of hotels are nice and accommodating, but like I said in the beginning, it was the staff that really made a difference. Always smiling, anticipating your every need, just plain out friendly. Quite a change from other "fancy" hotels I've stayed at. Room rate was $131 a night for one king size bed or two queen beds.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for a business trip this early august. The bed sheet had a very strong disinfectant smell the first night and I couldn't sleep very well. Other than that, everything else was as expected from a four star hotel and price. Good service, facilities are clean, great pool, and nice view. It's convenient and close to the convention centre. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: phladun
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel - it's clean, the beds are soft, the bedding is new and the pool area very pleasant although small. The hotel is also right on the beach and within walking distance of downtown and GasLamp district. The trolley line goes right by the hotel, so it's easy to jump on and travel around the city. A shuttle runs to the airport every half hour for the price of $5 one way. I stayed here at a convention for the rate of $215 plus tax per night which, in my opinion, is highly overpriced for the quality of the property. Although everything is clean, the property itself is older and needs a bit of refurbishing. I would not stay here as a tourist as there are hotels of comparable quality available for much less money.

Reviews.Title: “very nice with a conference room rate. great location and views.”
Reviews.Author: aablackmon
Reviews.Content: Great spot to visit the area from. We did a day up at La Jolla, a day over on the beach at the Hotel Coronado, a day at Balboa park and a lot of time in Gaslamp. I've stayed at a lot of hotels for business and this one has one of the better breakfast buffets. Drinks poolside are really expensive but everything in So Cal is. Rooms aren't anything special but beds are the good new Marriott type, comfy. Check in during conferences can be rough. Room view was great of both harbor and city.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: isletraveler
Reviews.Content: Get a view of the harbor and it's great! The hotel has two towers...we stayed in the North Tower. The hotel is very clean, with good shops and a Starbucks onsite. The staff was very helpful and the request for early check-in and extra pillows was done with no problem. The room was clean and bed was comfortable. The pool is nice...there is poolside service and a Tiki Bar that plays good music. The drinks are expensive and the Tiki Bar food is terrible, but we were on vacation and it's to be expected! The location of this hotel is wonderful. It's a 5 minute cab ride from the airport...walking distance to Seaport Village (safe at night) and a pretty quick cab or rickshaw ride to the Gaslamp district. I would stay here again, or try the Hyatt that is right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a convention, great marina location”
Reviews.Author: puddlejump
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a work conference. We had a marina view from about the 20th floor, in the southern tower, and it was fantastic. This is near the Marina village area with restaurants and tourist shops, as well as the nearby downtown area with more nightlife and restaurants. We ate at Taka Sushi, where the food was good, but the service was slightly obnoxious; white rice was an additional charge, and it was a few dollars; come on, a bowl of rice should come with the each meal, or be $1 maximum. The hotel's pool was large, but a bit cool. The food in the hotel is a bit pricey. Definitely try to get a room looking out over the Marina side. You can see US Navy ships going by, as well as military jets. Very clean hotel with good service. The food in the convention hall was a B+. When we stayed there, internet was an additional charge. We went to the San Diego Zoo, and the SD Zoo's Wild Animal Park about 45 minutes north, the Wild Animal Park was amazing, better than the Zoo downtown. We also bought some local strawberries and avocados from a farm stand up in the countryside, and the produce was incredibly fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: wiggles1101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our 2 boys (21 months & 3 1/2 yrs) stayed 5 nights at this hotel from 8/20-8/25. We live in Orange County, California and wanted a nice get away vacation that did not entail having to fly or drive to far. San Diego seemed like the perfect idea as there is so much for families to do. Upon arrival, I immediately ran into problems checking in. I had reserved a city view king room using my rewards points and the room type was guaranteed . The front desk person said that only doubles were available as the hotel was completely sold out. I told her a king room would only work as we had 2 little ones and they would be sleeping in cribs. After spending about 5 minutes working on the computer and making some calls she informed me they did have a nice king room available in the south tower overlooking the pool and bay. She also gave me 2 gift bags for the boys that contained little toys and trinkets. A very nice gesture on her part. In the end we ended up with a nicer room then what I had booked with awesome views. My oldest son was so excited when we saw the room for the first time he kept jumping up and down. He especially enjoyed seeing the boats and trains go by. The room was clean and well maintained. No issues with tired looking furniture or worn and stained carpet as previous guests had noted in their reviews. All in all a very nice room. We enjoyed using the pool and the close proximity to Seaport Village, USS Midway and other attractions. Many guests had noted that they could here people in the rooms next to them and this was not an issued for us until the last night of our visit. We had a hard time falling asleep that last night as kids in the room directly above us were laughing and running around until midnight. Things got quiet once their parents came back to the room. We were then awakened 5 hours later by the people next door getting ready to leave for the airport. Then the guy on the other side of our room woke up at 6:15am and started talking to his girlfriend and burping. So if there is anything negative to say about this hotel it can be noisy if you have loud inconsiderate neighbors. One other downer, do not trust the valet parking attendants. We had $5.00 of quarters stolen out of our cars center console. Overall, our experience was a good one and we will have no reservations staying at this hotel again. Aliso Viejo, CA

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: am12pm
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott Marina in San Diego for 4 nights. We chose this hotel primarily for it's proximity to the Convention Center. While it is right next door, I don't think that the location makes up for many downfalls. Check-in was rather fast, but the small lobby was really loud and crowded. I requested a bay view in the north twr (based on reviews here), but was given a room about half way around the north tower with a view of bay, Hyatt and city. We did enjoy the small balcony, but since the hotel is non-smoking our neighbors were always smoking outside, so visits were short. Our room contained king bed, plus sofa (bed), chair, desk & desk chair. It was nicely decorated, bedding was nice w/duvet. However, the carpet had seen much better days & had been patched in front of the sink. In sum, this hotel is not a good value. Much too expensive for what you get (even @ group rates)--you even pay extra for wired internet in your rm.!! The only wireless access is in the very crowded lobby. We will try another hotel for our next meeting in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Listened to the Other Reviewers”
Reviews.Author: gopheliad
Reviews.Content: When it comes to business travel, I am loyal (for the most part) to Marriott. I was therefore easily able to pay for this two-night stay with points. The purpose of my trip was to get a little sun the weekend before some business in town. On the plus side, the location was good and the front desk recognized me as a platinum guest and upgraded me to a bay view on the concierge level. Overall, no complaints about the front desk/reservation process, etc. However, I was given a room adjoining a family with a small boy, and as mentioned in other reviews, the walls are THIN! Awakening to a mother-son rendition of some song about a spider at 6:30 am was not cool. I've stayed in a lot of hotels, but I think this one just might be the worst as far as neighborly noise goes. Also, the band playing by the pool was clear as day in my 24th floor room - though they did stop at 5pm, after which there was little noise from the pool. Speaking of the pool, the lounge chair service was AWFUL, again as mentioned by previous reviews. After finally being able to flag down a waitress after twenty minutes, she left me with a menu, saying that she would return right away to get my order. I waited thirty minutes and she never returned. The next day I was able to get my server's attention quickly, but after waiting thirty-five minutes for my drink (and seeing other people order and receive drinks in the meantime), I conculded that she never put the order in. I guess I just wouldn't put this in the same categories as the Marriott hotels that I'm used to. Maybe for a family or group of partiers it would be okay, but not for a single gal looking to get sun and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Nuce
Reviews.Content: We paid $460 for one night for a room of 4x5 meters. Very overpriced for the fact that (1) the minibar was not full, (2) the interior looks and feels old and ugly, (3) the balcony is ridicoulousy small, (4) no plasma/lcd as tv, (5) overpriced room service, (6) poor food, and (7) no gadgets at all (usually, for such a price you get some nice ideas like superb shower cell, or just small things like champagne glasses, whatever...). The only good thing is its location and the nice view from the balcony. When we checked out, we realized that they charged my credit card ALREADY. We intended to split the bill, so they had to reverse the transaction, which resulted in the situation that my card card was empty till the reverse transaction is performed (which takes about 4-5 days). We had to wait more than 1 hour on the reception desk, till everything was 'okay'. Unbelievable bad checkout experience. Would never return there. I know that big hotel chains like Marriot etc have quality problems and that only the building shell and looby looks good, but this was defentitely below everything I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay at the Marriott Marina San Diego”
Reviews.Author: bell987
Reviews.Content: Wonderful vacation stay at the Marriott Marina with my family of 5. We had 2 connecting rooms with great views and a small refrigerator in each room. Great place to use as a base to explore all of San Diego tourist atractions (Zoo, Seaworld, LaJolla, Coronado, USS Midway,etc) Convenient Self-parking ($20/day I think) and nice area to walk in the evening along the Seaport village and the rest of the waterfront. Easy walk (less than 5 min) to downtown breakfast spots - Richard Walkers Pancakes and Cafe 222 . Would stay away from the Cheese Shop - one waitress on a busy morning and they were out of OJ and bagels after explaining that they had had a busy weekend 3 days earlier! Overall, reasonable rooms, great location and best to take advantage of lower rates when big convention is not in town.

Reviews.Title: “go to the Omni or the Hilton instead.....tired and "so so"”
Reviews.Author: SugarWahine
Reviews.Content: this place is a very tired marriott. as one of the older hotels in this area you can surely do better at the Omni (fab and great service) or the Hilton (nice, newer and right across the street from the convention center). We had breakfast one morning that was simply abyssmal... both in service and the food. I asked for toast, the server said she had to check to see if they had any (huh?) never came back, 45 minutes (i am not kidding) another server showed up with wheat toast (i guess there are no toast choices here) that was ice cold and not toasted on one side and burnt on the other. (go figure) When we tried to voice our dissatisfaction to manager, he simply shrugged his shoulders (huh X2?) The rooms reminded of a circus tent, though we had a nice view of the downtown. Our air con did not work even after repeated requests to fix it..... It was like staying in a swamp, all our clothes were wet and slimy as well as the sheets. ugh. The pool is nice, but very very small for the number of people staying there.,.... there is even a sign that says no reserving lounge chairs, so there must be a problem..... For the price, there are nicer places to stay. We were there for a convention and it was fine, sans soggy clothes, but next year we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “ONot a typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Donnel
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from 3 nights at the Marriott Marina in San Diego and were very disappointed in the hotel. I notice that the first three reviews I read were from families-- and that is exactly the people for whom I think this hotel is suited. The walls are paper thing so you can hear everything! And on both sides of us were families with children from 3 to 16 years old and there was certainly no peace or quiet until after 3 a.m. We stayed at the Hyatt the week of July 4th and it was much the better spot for the same price. The bathrooms are very inconvenient and the rooms are small. Our bed was supposedly a King size but there was a regular sized thick pad on it which was very uncomfortable. Anyway, as well as we like Marriott, this is one hotel we will check off our list!

Reviews.Title: “Everything A-OK”
Reviews.Author: rodndtube
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a one-week business trip. It is a modern, 4 star business/tourist/convention hotel. As you guessed, it is located next door to the convention center. Other positives are being one block from the eaterie & boutique Gaslamp section of town and a home run away from Petco Park (baseball stadium). The hotel seems to have all the amenities although I used very few of them. A pricey Starbucks is on the premises (more costly than most airports). The pool area looked nice from my hotel window. Everything was clean and the room included a safe for your valuables. Early check-in and late check-out requests were accommodated. My only real beef is that there was very little self-parking ($20/nite) and that a space was usually a 10-minute walk; valet parking is also available ($26/nite).

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: Familyoffour_7
Reviews.Content: Location and pool are the best aspects of this hotel. Situated right at Seaport Village it is great for accessing many San Diego attractions. Seaport Village has a great running/walking path so you can get out morning or evening. Also, rental bikes are on site. Pool is large with plenty to offer for both adults and children. As mentioned in several reviews, rooms are nothing special. Upgraded bay view room is quite crowded for a family of four. Also expect waits at elevators and a lot of noise coming from the pool area - we were on 10. Biggest disapointment was lack of offerings for an evening meal. Avoid the Irish pub- food comes from room service kitchen and it was extremely slow. Starbucks in the hotel was convenient at breakfast time. Got to wonder if the Hyatt next door or Embassy Suites across the street would have been better all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: Hotelagent
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family in the Marriott Marina in August 2007 for four days (weekdays). We had a rental car and chose valet parking over self-parking in the hotel's garage. Valet Parking is $26 per day and self-parking is $20 per day. It is better to choose valet parking on weekdays because there aren't as many people in the hotel using their cars (at most a 5 minute wait for the bellboy to retrieve your car). However, on Friday and the weekend the wait becomes much longer due to the influx of short-stay tourists. It might be a better option to just self-park during those three days. Check-in was swift, easy, and polite. We reserved a room in the North Tower, which is basically the "deluxe" tower of the two that comprise this hotel. When we reserved the room a few months ago, we asked if there were any things that might disturb us during our stay (such as planes, trains, clubs, etc.). The hotel replied that nothing was there to bother us. However, once we checked tripadvisor and saw the reviews of the "loud" trains, we called the hotel back and confronted them about their previous statement. They apologized and promised to give us a room where the least amount of noise was, which was the highest floor of the North Tower (25th floor). The lobby is modern and pleasant. However, there was an unpleasant smell during the day there and in the elevators. It might be from the pool just outside. I definitely encourage anyone to go for a room in the North Tower facing the marina. Each one in this tower has a nice balcony with a beautiful view. The room I reserved had two double beds, both fitted with several pillows. The Marriott beds are very similar to the Westin Heavenly beds. The Room was pretty basic and the ceiling had a few cracks in it. The bathroom is also basic, nothing special. The bathroom vanity had a several cracks in it and the bathtub had a few hairs in it as well upon check-in. The floors were also not vacuumed properly; I found pieces of cookies on the carpet behind the armchair. We did not hear any train noises in our room. The breakfast was served at LC's, and the service was exceptional. The waiters and waitresses were efficient and friendly, as they should be. The food was also delicious. On Friday and the weekend the breakfast room becomes crowded and a waiting list is formed. However, the wait isn't too long- about 15 to 20 minutes. Realize though that the hotel is probably filled at capacity during the weekend. The fine dining establishment is called Molly's. The food is wonderful and the service is impeccable. However, the prices are high. A dinner for three people (without alcohol) cost around $200. The setting is also very elegant and comfortable. There is also a Starbucks in the South Tower lobby as well as a bar in the North Tower. There is also a bar and a stall selling ice cream next to the pool. An outside cafe next to the pool area serves lunch. The pool is absolutely wonderful. But even in the weekdays, it gets extremely crowded in the afternoon and is difficult to find lounge chairs. It is open all day long and the best time to use it is in the morning and evening. During the weekend, it would be impossible to find a chair. The Marriott also rents out boats and jetskis in the marina. My sister used the jetskiis. You have to place a $500 deposit (you get the money back) but you have to pay $100 per hour. Overall, it was a positive experience for her. There was also a problem with the elevators apparently. They broke down twice during my stay at the hotel. I definitely recommend going to Fashion Valley, Soak City, and Chianti's Restaurant. Overall, this is a good family friendly hotel in San Diego. It is not exactly a luxurious hotel, but is still comfortable. The staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “So-so Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: pointclick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott for 2 nights on a pleasure trip. This is not a luxury hotel. So if you are looking for luxury, look else where. Our room cost $265/night for a Deluxe room, King Bed with Balcony and Bay view. We were in the North Tower. We had requested a high floor a week before our arrival but did not get it, we were on the 3rd floor instead. Hardly the "Bay View" that we paid for since we were on such a low floor! This was a huge disappointment. It was a noisy room. You could hear the band playing at night and you could hear the train/tram whistles! The balcony was small with 2 plastic chairs. The walls are thin. We could hear the people in the next room talking and coughing. This hotel is also not very clean. The hallways needed to be vacuumed. Hair in the sink and tub. Large stain on the sofa. Breakfast in the hotel at LC's is pricey and the food quality is just okay. It was $60 for 2 people. We opted to order off of the menu instead of the buffet. Go to Cafe 222 for breakfast instead. The good things: Hotel staff was nice and courteous. It was in a great location for our needs. We did have a car, but if you did not have a car, Seaport Village is very close within walking distance. Cafe 222 (for breakfast) is also within walking distance. Molly's restaurant is outstanding! It was about $175 for 2 people for food only (no liquor, we don't drink). It was well worth it! However, we will go to Molly's again. We will not stay in this hotel again. The next time will try the Hyatt that is near this Marriott. The Hyatt is under going some renovations so hopefully the renovations will be completed by our next visit to San Diego. Overall, we do not recommend this Marriott Hotel. It is truly a sub-standard hotel. It is more like a 2.5 to 3 star hotel as far as the accommodations are concerned. Not worth $265/night!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for a San Diego Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: BooTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience a truly fantastic San Diego vacation, book yourself at the Marriott Hotel and Marina (as much as possible book the South Wing)! What's great about this besides the excellent accomodations? It's the location! This hotel is situated right beside the Marina, so you'll be able to walk around and enjoy the harbor! This is my 2nd stay at this hotel...everyone is courteous and helpful. The beds linens have a high thread count and the pillows and comforters are feathered...so prepare for a restful night! The pool and gym is just fantastic! Dine outdoors as much as possible by the pool...they have a bar and entertainment. While you are there, the following is a MUST try: 1. Take a walk to the Gaslamp District and enjoy shopping and streets full of fine dining and exciting cuisines! 2. You have to see Shamu at Sea World...as much as possible stay until the park closes to see Shamu Rocks and the last show and fireworks...totally worth it! 3. Spend a day at the San Diego Zoo 4. Ride a bike or do a morning run on the Embarcadero 5. Stroll and shop on Seaport Village (designed by Walt Disney!) 6. Take a Harbor Cruise and learn about the bay 7. Spend at least 4 hours at the USS Midway (absolutely facinating!) Tips 1. Instead of eating at the hotel, take a short walk to Seaport or Gaslamp...food is fabulous! 2. Go to Costco to buy tickets to both San Diego Zoo and Seaworld. 3. Check out hotel coupons for the Harbor Cruise and USS Midway Entrance Fees.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: thumpersmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great...wonderful resort atmosphere. The pools were wonderful, too! Plus it was pet-friendly as well. It was clean, the room was comfy (but somewhat small), and the bed was very comfortable. It was very expensive, however. I understand that resort-type hotels are more expensive, but we usually don't travel like this :) A company picked up one night for us and we had another night booked at another hotel, but promptly cancelled it when we walked into the lobby. All in all it is a great hotel, just a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “For a week- this was heaven”
Reviews.Author: workinhard
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled out to San DIego for a week away. The marriott marina is a fantastic place. I think they have about 1 million rooms. It is large and overlooks coranado bay. We stayed on the 14th floor with a balcony and the view was spectacular. The pool and bar are great and in perfect condition. We did not eat at the hotel except for the starbucks every morning in the lobby. The staff was average for a marriott, but the property is perfect. It is just five minute walk from the gas lamp & seaport village. When we return to Sandiego, we will be staying at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Below par for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: wyodaytripper
Reviews.Content: A one night stay prior to an early am flight. The facility was clean and well kept and the room was very nice. Unfortunately, the room was located in a very noisy corridor. When the female cat fight broke out at 2:45am we finally notified the front desk but nothing was done. Also, not many parking options and very pricey valet parking ; they didn't answer their phone for call-ahead service and the wait times were lengthy. It was an expensive, jaw-clenching 12hour stay and I will never return to that particualr facility again.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Really Happy Here”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Marriott Marina San Diego. Yes, it's a big hotel, but we were there for a convention with lots and lots of attendees, so that's what we were expecting. We didn't think it was loud and the trains didn't bother us. In fact, I think I only heard one train one night, it woke me but I went right back to sleep. Actually, I thought the train sounds were nice! We were upgraded to a wonderful suite, complete with separate bedroom and a bath where the toilet area was almost floor-to-ceiling glass. That was an experience! I don't think you can beat the location. Right on the water, but within easy walking distance of all the great restaurants downtown. We would return!

Reviews.Title: “felt like an airport”
Reviews.Author: idta
Reviews.Content: not great!! cant really say anything bad about the place but somehow you felt you were checking in at an airport and the rate differentials on room prices was staggering. I did complain over this and other discrepencies to no avail just the usual sweet sorry smile. Would not stay here again and I do agree the train was loud!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Enough but the Train is LOUD”
Reviews.Author: yastreb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in early June, 2007. This is a typical 1980s refurbished Marriott business/resort hotel. Rooms have been upgraded with comfy beds and new furniture, but not new windows. Common areas are nice, LC's restaurant was decent for breakfast. This is a large double-tower hotel with a lovely pool area and pretty harbor view. The drawbacks are as follows: 1) By far and away the noise from the BNSF freight trains that come through at all hours of the day and night is horrible and will blow you out of bed. Even staying on the bay side view of the hotel will not eliminate the sound (here is my comment on the Windows -- Marriott really needs to upgrade them to make them more soundproof as they are visibly old!!). Bring earplugs. I understand that the trains are an enormous local problem in downtown San Diego for residents, who are organizing an appeal to create a rail quiet zone (a great idea!) to solve this problem. 2) Parking at the Marriott is expensive, and the self-park garage was $20 per day to park a major distance away. Plus there are aren't enough spaces. The staff was pretty nice, and kept apologizing for the train noise -apparently everyone complains about this. I would not stay here again for this reason, but I would stay at other Marriott hotels as I have had good experiences with many of them.

Reviews.Title: “over-priced for what you got”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriot Marina in June 2007 for a convention and then stayed a couple of days for leisure. Since it was a large convention, the room cost me $299/night. For that lofty price, you got a decent room but nothing special. My room had a view of the convention center instead of the bay (more $$$). The bathroom was decently sized but the toilet was not in its own partition. Also, the bathroom didn't have any ventilation fan, so it was steamy after a shower. The shower head was a Grohe (expensive German brand), but the volume of water was not very high. I believe a major advertising point for Marriott are their "perfect" beds. For me, the mattress was much too soft. They certainly give you a lot of pillows though - two small ones and two larger ones per bed. Some bright points: I had ordered food from room service a few times during my stay. One time, I had ordered a plate of steamed veggies (not enough healthy food while on the road) and what I received was a very nice combination of small squash, cherry tomatoes, broccolini and asparagus - I was impressed. For their beds, they use down comforters instead of plain blankets. There's a gym and small pool system on the bay side of the hotel but I didn't have time to use either. The main reason that I chose this hotel was its location - right next door to the convention center. Given the amount of walking I was doing those days, I was grateful that my room was close by. If I were to go to this convention again, I would choose this hotel for the small reason - location rather than anything special about the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not for The Hungry”
Reviews.Author: Momofboyz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located for easy walking to Petco Park, Gaslamp District, SeaPort Village, USS Midway, not to mention the beautiful marina. Sea World is a 15 minute easy drive. The view of the city was very nice from our balcony. The buffet breakfast was very tasty and fulfilling. The kids enjoyed the pool, mostly because they brought their own pool toys. On the negative side: Four of us were staying, yet we only had two sets of towels despite asking several times for 4, even on the second day when the staff was coming in to clean. The ice machine never worked on our floor. Didn't realize both beds would be doubles which don't work for 4 people very comfortably. We ordered a roll away bed which did come in a timely manner. My 13 yr old reports it was pretty comfortable. It took up what little space was left in the room because it's pretty big for a roll away and the rooms are small. We thought we should just order 4 roll aways so we could all be comfortable. Hope you like train whisles and the dinging of cross arms because you'll hear it every 5 minutes on the city side. The food at the Pub was nasty with very slow service & little attention to anything. My salmon sandwich was a raw salmon which was never mentioned on the menu or by the staff and it's very expensive. I got some weird, tasteless chips with the sandwich which were gross. The waiter didn't know what they were called and said that no one seems to like them. That was just the beginning of the battle with food. There is nothing for kids to eat in the whole hotel(for lunch or dinner), unless they can exist on chips and popcorn from the gift shop. Starbucks closes at 7pm so the hope of eating their sandwiches was shot when we arrived at 8 after a long day out. We ordered from the room service menu out of desperation. The sandwiches looked exactly like the Starbucks sandwiches, only double in price, not to mention the tax and gratuity they add to your bill. The last morning we spent looking out upon the city from our balcony and noticed a Ralphs grocery store a couple blocks away. Wish we had known about it so we could stock up on much cheaper food for our refrigerator. Live and learn. I would stay at a different hotel next time becuase of the small beds and lack of available food choices for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kobeeight
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days what a perfect location. Within walking distance of anything including PETCO park. We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: JNW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice facility in a very nice area. There are many attractions within walking distance or a short cab ride. The rooms are nice and clean. The bed was too soft for my liking (needed a new mattress). It is also right near the tracks, so the train whistles at night could keep you awake. I was attending a convention, so I booked at a decent rate. If paying full price, however, I would choose other nearby hotels with better rates. Overall, a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over Memorial Day weekend 2007. Had a king bed room with balcony and bay view in the North Tower. Main part of the room measured approximately 16 X 22 feet. Bathroom vanity in separate area from toilet/shower. Good shower water pressure. Excellent housekeeping and the room furnishings were in good repair. Bed very comfortable. Check in was fast and easy; valet parking worth the additional $6 per day IMO and we were in and out a lot but the car was always ready if we called down 5-10 minutes ahead. Buffet breakfast was excellent and the spread is extensive. Very attentive service. No problems with noise in the room/noise from nearby railroad tracks. The hotel is within very easy walking distance to the gaslamp district and the many attractions/restaurants there and right next door to Seaport Village. Very satisfied with the stay and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “What wonderful employees”
Reviews.Author: MarkRosenthal
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay at the Marriott. From the moment you enter you notice how clean everything is and this was carried out throughout the hotel, the restrooms, the room, and the pool area. But that doesn't make a great trip, it was the absolute wonderful attitudes of the employees starting with the valet, through the greeter at the door, check in, and everybody else we came in contact with. It was an absolutely wonderful vacation and having the movies by the pool only made it even better for our son. I can't recommend the hotel any more highly and we are already booked to go back. And this doesn't even take into account the great location next to gaslamp, a 5 minute walk to Petco Park, and being right next door to seaport village. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Suite life!”
Reviews.Author: mslarue72
Reviews.Content: This is just a lovely hotel. We stayed in a suite on the bay side. fantastic views. Weather was cool in San Diego so we didn't get to enjoy the pool as much as we would have liked but was very nice. Great stay for 2 nights. very convinient to downtown and fantastic staff. Love Marriotts and this one is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawggirl
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights with my 18 year old son and although the weather was pretty chilly, we had a great time. From the hotel valet to the bell staff; the housekeeping and front desk staff, everyone was AWESOME and super helpful. We had a nice king bed room overlooking Coronado - beautiful view from our balcony. Plenty of room to sit out there - 2 chairs and a little table. The bed was so comfortable and there was a queen size sofa bed as well as flat screen television. The bathroom (toilet and tub/shower) was separate from the sink, so two people could use it at the same time. Our only issue was what looked like animal hair on the floor when we came in but following a call to the front desk, the housekeeper was there within 5 minutes and cleaned it up. I stay at Marriott's alot and this was the first time I'd experienced this... was kind of weird at first but handled very well. Otherwise, everything was SPOTLESS. As Silver Elite members, I had reserved a microwave and there was a small fridge, so worked great for leftovers for the 18 year old. Room service was about what you'd expect to pay for a nice hotel like this - but came promptly and portions were hearty. The concierge was very helpful and all the bell staff also knew just as much area and event information. Its close to the Padre's new baseball park and Gaslamp district so a good location. They also have a really nice pool area which we used, regardless of the poor weather. It's right on the boardwalk about 2 minute walk from Seaport Village which offers some great shopping and dining. Also a great fitness center. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fine All-Around Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cubsfan73
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel in order to attend a conference. Firstly, the hotel has an amazing location on the Bay with wonderful views. It is easy walking distance to the Gaslamp District and to Petco Park. The walking trail just outside the hotel is pleasant and uncrowded with plenty of nice resting spots. Secondly, the staff is exquisitely friendly with everyone seemingly smiling and making an effort to help us. We brought our small dog with us and they gave us no hassles with the dog at check-in ($75/fee for the pet). Third, the rooms are quiet, clean, and pleasant. The balconies are a very nice touch. Did not try the restaurants, and the pool area seemed fun, but small. Overall, an excellent hotel for a quick stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: WDMA
Reviews.Content: We just got home after spending a wonderful week in San Diego. The Marriott Hotel and Marina was really great . My husband, myself and our 7 year old son have nothing but praise for this hotel! From the minute we arrived, the staff made us feel right at home and by the end of the week we felt like family. We had a beautiful room on the 18th floor of the North Tower and enjoyed the spectacular view of San Diego bay and the Coronado Bay Bridge from our balcony. Our room was very clean and nicely decorated, the pool was great and the hot tub was our favorite destination after a long day of walking around at the many area attractions. The location of the hotel is excellent. You pull right out of the front entrance and go straight up First Avenue for access to the freeway that takes you to Sea World, San Diego Zoo, Legoland, Wild Animal Park, etc.. The hotel is right next to Seaport Village with lots of nice shops and restaurants and is also walking distance to the Gaslamp District and al of that area's great nightlife. The trolly to Old Town stop right in front also. Another thing that was really convenient is the computer in the lobby which allows you to print out your boarding passes before you leave for the airport. Saves you having to do it at the airport, so that was a plus! The only negative thing I can say about the hotel is the $25 per day parking fee for valet (self parking is $19). I think that's really high, but all hotels in the area seem to charge around the same amount. And, it was always nice to pull up to the front of the hotel and have one of the valet parkers say "welcome back... how was your day?" or always ask if you need directions somewhere before you left. I'm incredibly picky when it comes to hotels, but I promise you... if you stay at the San Diego Marriott Hotel and Marina, you won' t be disappointed. Clean, beautifully decorated, great shops and restaurants, lovely pool area, spectacular views, unbeatable location, wonderful friendly staff... we can' t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ChiTwnGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Marina for business. I chose the hotel because that's where my conference was located. Great service. They were pet-friendly, which was extra nice because it meant I could bring my small dog with me on the trip! They have a great pool scene. Also the location is fabulous---right near the Gaslamp area with great restaurants and bars within walking distance. Room was very clean and the bath products were really yummy smelling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: poston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Marina in mid-April for a 5 night trip. Some pros and cons. Pros: Great location! Right next to Gaslamp Quarter, trolley stop, Seaport Village and short walk to Ferry and Midway. Bed was extremely comfortable, very similar to Westin Heavenly Bed. We rented a car only one day to drive to La Jolla and Torrey Pines (must see), all other attractions are accessible by trolley or short taxi ride. Service was acceptable, not great for the price tag, and hotel very clean. Great Views of city and bay. Pool and grounds are very nice although it was too cold when we were there to use pool, it was unseasonably cold when we were there. Cons: Too Noisy!!! The Marriott sits right next to train tracks.
