There is a train that seems to run every 2 hours during the middle of the night, I think the conductors job is to wake everyone in the hotel up! Hotel is extremely busy with conventions (it is right next to convention center). The lobby is always busy and full of convention delegates drinking and meeting. Overall I think you can get more for your money elsewhere. While in San Diego, you must go eat in Little Italy a this little place called Fillipe's. Hands down the best italian place ever! It is worth the wait. Also, Fred's in Old Towne has fabulous Mexican Food. Sea World was fun, the Zoo was good if you like zoo's, and the Wild Animal Park was extremely misleading, not worth the drive or the money! Coronado Island is nice and Hotel Del Coronado is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Marriot for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: BKKandKSK
Reviews.Content: Am currently sitting on the balcony of the 20th floor of this lovely hotel enjoying a beautiful Californian evening. Sailboats are out on the water and Bob Marley music is wafting up from the pool...not too shabby after a series of all day meetings at the convention center next door. As others have mentioned, the location is perfect for business meetings. I can roll out of bed and be at my meetings in 5 minutes. Also, there are a number of wonderful places to eat within an easy 10-15 minute walk. Lovely running/biking paths by the water. The room was clean and reasonably up to date--just what I would expect from Marriot. Service was great--at check in I was able to get a water view room (definitely suggest this) just by asking. I was granted this request although the hotel was full. (Probably doesn't hurt that I am a Silver level frequent guest.) Downside: Because the hotel is shaped like a football, the rooms have an odd configuration. I didn't loose sleep over this but it is funny to see. Room safe was not working and it took two requests to get it fixed. Not a deal breaker, but annoying. I would certainly stay here again, but would not be excited about paying the full fare (I paid reduced rate as I was part of a group.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: bigredfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided a mixed experience for us. Even though I booked two rooms for a total of six people many weeks ago, when we arrived we were told that each of our two rooms would only have one bed each. The front desk person was very apologetic but could do nothing about the fact that we'd be short on beds. He said the only thing he could do was give us a 14th floor room with a better view. When the sun came up the next morning we realized that he'd given us a room with a fabulous view of the city and the bay! We slept on rollaways (which turned out to be just fine) and enjoyed the fantastic view every waking moment. Of the many staff people we encountered during our stay, only one was cold and uninterested in our problems. Everyone else was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Location & views are the best! ”
Reviews.Author: JMSC-92
Reviews.Content: Definitely get a bay view room with a balcony -- it is SOOOO worth it! The rooms are large with a great layout and that magnificient bed, although the decor is a tad dated and could use a facelift. This facility has an amazing pool area with waterfalls that can be heard from the bayview rooms, outdoor firepits with conversation seating and a fantastic tiki bar. Staff is incredibly friendly, very knowlegeable, and consistently went above and beyond. We honestly did not remove our car from the parking lot the ENTIRE time we were there. We were able to walk to the Midway, Seaport Village, and the Gaslamp District (all were less than 1 mile away), and Coronado was a fun water taxi ride away. We love San Diego and plan on returing, and won't even think about staying anywhere else but the Marriott Marina.

Reviews.Title: “I Picked a Winner!”
Reviews.Author: mkb03
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter for a spring break holiday to San Diego. After reviewing many Hotels I chose the Marriott. I'm so glad I did. We arrived at 9:30 am, I was sure we wouldn't be able to check in, but to my surprise we were in the room within 10 minutes! I got a top floor with a great view just like I requested. We did not have a car so location was important. Right out the back of the hotel was a boardwalk that lead to Seaport Village. Shops, dining, entertainment, a carosouel. All right there. We walked out the front of the hotel to the Gaslamp district for more shopping and resturants. One day we walked to the ferry launch and took a ferry ride to Coronado island and had a great beach day. The pool was warm and beautiful. Near the pool there was ratan chairs with smal fireplaces.. it was great place to relax before dinner. We went to the Zoo also. Here are some Zoo tips: $12 cab ride from hotel Do not do what others have said on this site and go right to the polar bears. They do not get into the water for the underwater viewing until 10:30 or 11:00. Buy a tour bus ticket and get on it right away. Later in the day the lines were 40 minutes long. After the tour bus tour, take the express buses to the places you want to walk around more. Lots of walking and many steep hills! Wear good shoes. A bottled water is $3 and a coke $5. So you may want to bring your own. San Diego was clean and beautiful. I am already thinking of comming back with my husband in the fall. I will be staying at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: poosu
Reviews.Content: I went there for a convention next door for 3 days and 3 nights; I never expect much of the hotel next to the convention center. But this Marriott is just way more than my expectation. I had a room with balcony with the view of the marina. The bed is so devilishly good that you do not want to leave the bed at all! And the service is just amazing. I'll be staying there again when coming back to San Diego. Promise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelaknpb
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights because my husband had a conference here. We have stayed at this hotel before but I have to say, this last time, we had a wonderful experience. From the bell hop, front desk staff, maid service... anyone who and anything to do with this hotel provided world class service. They remembered us, and went out of their way to make us feel truly pampered. We had a wonderful time and wold definitely stay here again. Thanks, Marriott, we had a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: LarrySwanson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Marina for a conference. When I travel for business I usually stay at higher end properties (RC, 4 seasons), so my expectations weren't particularly high. I was pleasently surprised. My room was nothing special--typical lame hotel furnishings. But the bathroom was recently renovated and nicely appointed, and the bed was exceptionally comfortable with very good linens. The best part was the surprisingly responsive, excellent service. Room service was good, simple food, served quickly and accurately. Unlike in many hotels, I did not have to place a breakfast order the night before. Each morning I called for room service breakfast at a peak time (7:45) and it was in my room in less than 30 minutes. Business services (faxes, fedEx) were fast and efficient. Had drinks at the bars with colleagues, and enjoyed great service each night. I really liked this place a lot more than I expected to, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DCReviewerWashington
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Hotel & Marina for three days during a conference in February. We had a room in the North Tower with a balcony, facing the pool and the bay. The view was beautiful. The hotel is quite large, but they maintained great service despite their size. The hotel is located right along the bay and you can easily take a boat across the bay to Coronado Island. It was also located next to Seaport Village, a quaint little shopping and dining area. My only complaint would be that the maid came to our room at 8 am in the morning, which seemed quite early. My husband asked her to come back after 11 am, but she came back at 9 am again. This happened on two separate days. Other than that, it was a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Will definately return”
Reviews.Author: rainbwblu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb 9-12, 07. We booked it through Priceline for a great price. We were unsure where to stay and let Priceline pick it for us and am so glad that we got the Marriott. We arrived around 10pm after our flight from Pheonix. We decided to go with valet parking. It is more money but if you are pay for parking, might as well pay a little more and not have to worry about parking etc. One nice thing about it was that on Saturday night there was a huge party at the hotel and the self parking was full so it was nice to just do valet. The front desk people were nice and efficent and the bellboy was polite as well. The room was a nice size. Its wasnt huge or anything, but the space was a nice space for just two of us. I loved the colors - navy blue and golden yellow. The bathroom had a nice layout, other than the door when open blocked the hallway and if angled weird, you saw yourself in the mirror as you went the bathroom. The bed though.... It was wonderful. This was a second stay at at a Mariott and have fallen in love with their beds. The down comforter, the soft beds, the pillows..... we didnt want to get out of bed! Now, we didnt have a great view, but who needs a great view when you can just walk outside the hotel and wander along the pier. The pier is just an elevator ride down to the lower level and stroll through the pool area to the pier. There are numerous restaurants in the hotel. We didnt go to any of them though. The hotel is connected to the convention center and the hotel seems very business friendly. My husband used the conceige service and the business center to mail off a huge package. They were very friendly and went beyond the call for service for us. We enjoyed one evening laying on the lounge chairs at the pool area, sipping on our drinks and enjoying the waterfall trickling beside us. We didnt actually use the pool, but there were others out there enjoying it. The pool is heated. The have a computer set up by the front desk to print off boarding passes. They also have a nice size gift shop. As for the reports of things being stolen. Im sorry to hear that has happened to others. We were cautious of our belongings by using the safe in the room, not leaving anything in our rental car when parking, and keeping the 'do not disturb' sign up on our room at all times to keep housekeeping out. We loved our stay at the Mariott and will definately return here next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “One of my least favorite marriott hotels, ever!”
Reviews.Author: sulley73
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel unless you look rich, are rich or can pass for rich. Most of the employees at this hotel are snobs and do not even bother to ask how your stay was, when checking out. Our room was in the north tower and had a balcony. We didn't discover until the second night that the balcony door had been left unlocked because the lock was MISSING. Sure that doesn't seem dangerous but if you were a criminal this would be a great oppurtunity because it so easy to go from balcony to balcony because they are connected. I reported this to managment and got a very generic, weak email saying they would check into the problem. The room itself was fine, though very small, but for the money they charged it should have had at least a mini bar. So if you like to overpay for a room that is comparable to a red roof inn room, with no amenities, and staff that really doesn't give a damn about safety, then definately stay at this marriott hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: benellyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Marriott Marina. It couldn't have been nicer. We had a room with a balcony and view of the water in the north tower. The room was attractive, the housekeeping excellent. The location of the hotel on the waterfront had easy access to the path along the water. The pool area is attractive and clean, the pool is heated--very important in February, and although it is oddly shaped you can swim laps. Altogether we enjoyed the hotel very much especially since we came from the Hilton Gaslamp which we didn't like at all. The location of this hotel, though not directly in the Gaslamp neighborhood is close enough for easy access to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: orp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel one night on a day trip from OC and as this was our first visit to San Diego; we wanted to stay by the water, close to the city center, have easy access and parking and close to the USS Midway and Coronado. This hotel fitted all of the aboce, and eventhough this is a HUGE hotel with a lot of conference guest, we did not feel akward in our tourist leisure outfit. Everything is within walking distance and it is especially nice to walk around the marina and the cluster of restaurants and shops in right in front of the hotel in the evening. As you would expect, service is excellent, everything is spotless clean, be sure to ask for high grounds and a room with a view of the Coronado and enjoy the vistas from the balcony. There are similar quality hotels in the neighborhood, e.g. Hyatt and Radisson, but Marriott takes precedence due to the on-site marina and very nice pool grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for fun, food and business”
Reviews.Author: M2inApril
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Diego for business. We were greeted promptly at the front desk. There were no lines. We were checked in very quickly and told that we had an executive suite. We were disappointed to walk in and figure out that the room was not a suite of any kind. I called down to guest services and asked for a larger room or a room with a balcony. The employee really wanted to accommodate us and worked for at least 5 minutes to find us a satisfactory room. I was very impressed with how helpful all the staff was. We ended up with a beautiful, large room on the 21st floor with an amazing view of the bay. Location is great. It is next door to the Convention Center and a 5 minute walk to the Gaslamp Quarter. It is also within walking distance to the Seaport Village, which is a bit touristy but has several restaurants and shops on the water. It is a nice place for a stroll or a jog. Check out Cafe 222 for breakfast. It is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. LC's in the hotel is great for breakfast. They have an extensive buffet for $18 and a continental buffet for less. I was very happy to see many healthy selections on the menu including a whole wheat French toast with light syrup topped with strawberries and bananas. I have never seen this on any menu, and it was very good. There is a gym at the hotel. It is actually part of the Convention Center building and attached to the Marriott. You have to walk briefly outside to get there. The gym is very spacious with many treadmills, stairmasters and stationary bikes with high quality TVs attached to each machine. There are free weights and weight machines. The gym is accessible through the South Tower. This would be a bit of a walk for people staying in the North Tower. The concierge was helpful in finding restaurants and entertainment. They provide a great map of the surrounding area and restaurants. There is a Starbucks in the lobby of the hotel. You will see many pedicabs stationed close to the hotel. On a whim, we decided to take one to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse for dinner. It was very fun and a great way to see the docks and ships. I would recommend taking a ride one time while in town. Overall, we loved out stay at the Marriott, primarily because of the awesome room we had.

Reviews.Title: “iPod STOLEN from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hsblendo
Reviews.Content: I was concerned that a recent guest had a cell phone stolen (they kindly wrote "lost") from their room and had to post our experience. An iPod was outright stolen from our vehicle compartment while valet parked. I waited for over 60 minutes for the manager to arrive (who never did) and the desk staff refused to give me the local police number. (I called them through information.) Security immediately read me the contract that they "are not responsible for lost and stolen articles." They were clearly not going to do anything more than shoo us away. If you are considering a stay I would obviously recommend against it; there are so many better options in San Diego. But please do not leave any valuables in your room or car, and if you experience theft - as at least two of us have - PLEASE phone in a police report. Unfortunately, the hotel appears to be absolutely unwilling to address this problem and security is... non-existent. The only response from the hotel was a bogus claim form that advised to take up the matter with ACE parking. As they contract the valet/parking services, I would have expected some/ANY response from Marriott on this.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kegowhisky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights and was relatively impressed, although this is what i've come to expect from this hotel. Checked in early with no problem. Room was nice, adequately sized, comfortable bed and bedding, nicely sized and appointed bathroom including a phone, broadband internet available for $9.95; all the standard stuff. I wish I had requested a room with a balcony overlooking the bay/ocean, but I forgot to and just had an oceanview through a window - won't make that mistake again! The hotel's location is perfect; right next door to the convention center and less than a five minute walk to the Gas Lamp district. For my purposes, the hotel was in such a good spot that I didn't need a rental car - just a taxi to and from the airport. The food in DW's pub in the hotel is adequate, and there are several git shops and vendors such as Starbucks to give you plenty of choices to pick up ancillary stuff and snacks. This hotel was very close to an "Excellent" rating, but lacked just a little to put it in that strata. No turn-down service, staff was accommodating although not overly outgoing and ultra-friendly. I had some minor problems with the pre-designated buttons on the phone not being programmed correctly, and with the wake-up service. All are little nits, but when put together can be annoying. On the other hand, this hotel could easily overcome these minor issues with a little increased oversight. Having said all that, I would have no problem with staying here again - it's still a good place!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Wish I could live here! Never wanted to leave!”
Reviews.Author: momof2greatkids
Reviews.Content: Amazing! This could not have been a better trip! A coworker and I attended a conference January 6th-10th and this was an amazing place to stay!!! It is a beautiful hotel, beautiful city and the weather is amazing. The location of this hotel is ideal! You can walk everywhere. Restaurants, shopping, the marina, it's all wonderful. The hotel amenities were great; comfortable beds, nice shower, clean rooms, and the view was the best part of it all. We could see the bay, the mountains, and the city skyline from our window. The food at the pub downstairs was excellent, the conference accomodations were perfect, and the staff were so helpful. The concierge was always helpful and recommended some of the best places to dine. Make sure you eat at Chianti's Italian restaurant on 5th avenue, and also shop at So Good, a jewelry store on 5th. Take the time to do the tour of San Diego, which you can schedule at the Concierge desk, and shop at the malls!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: CGOKansas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three kids stayed at this hotel last December. We had adjoining rooms. Everything about this hotel was wonderful, from the kids' giftbags at check-in to the ornate gingerbread houses that adorned the lobby, to the Starbucks in the lobby (very convenient) and the restaurants (we really enjoyed the sports bar at this hotel - great chicken wings). The location is great - right on the harbor, very close to a wonderful shopping center and great restaurants. We loved the Fish Market, which was about a 5 minute cab ride away. The rooms were very clean, (although a bit on the small side) the linens crisp and the beds very comfortable. It was a bit chilly when we were there, but the pool looked great. We wish they had an indoor pool. All in all, we would definately return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location!”
Reviews.Author: CruiseLori
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 3 children (4,8,12) stayed here for 2 nights before leaving on a cruise. We had a really good time. The rooms were spacious, we had of course asked for an adjoining room with our kids room and was pleasantly surprised that we got a King bed that connected to their 2 Queen Bed room. Beds were very comfortable and the view off the balcony was so pretty. We did bother with a rental car and was able to walk almost anywhere. We did take a taxi to the zoo, but we walked back in order to see some of the city, and since it was a Sunday, it was not real busy. The shops along the harbour are fun and some good resturants too. They had an art show going on and we enjoyed just browsing through it. Husband loved the running path along the water. My girls liked the tennis courts. We rented a 4 person bicycle from the hotel and my 4 year old was able to sit up front in the basket of it. We had a blast tooling around in that. The pool area was nice. We had good service at the breakfast and never had to wait, though our meal came with our package, otherwise would have not spent that much on a breakfast buffet. The cruise port is very close, and with the stroller, and luggage for 5 of us for a 10 day trip, we figured it would be just as easy to just walk it rather than pile into a cab for a 1-2 mile ride. We got quite a few looks and had a 'bag lady' say something to us about being a 'family on the go', which I had to explain to my daughters that we probably looked like homeless people. :) Let me tell you that I spent hours and hours trying to pick a place to stay while in San Diego, was going to stay on Coranado even, but in the end was satisfied with the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: mitti
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family recently while attending a conference. We had a room with a balcony facing the pool. It was a great view from the room . The pool in the back and the bay along with the greenery created a calming experince. This was also very close(nice walking distance of 10-15min) to the gaslamp district where a variety of restaurants were located. The location was not close to the zoo nor the museums. I wish they had free internet access from the room. Also, we had to ask for a refrigerator since our room did not come with one. The hotel employees were cordial. We loved our concierge( a mid-age lady whose name is skipping me right now) who was particularly helpful. We had a great overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Paranormal Experience in the South Tower???”
Reviews.Author: HIChick
Reviews.Content: I feel almost silly to be writing this but I had the weirdest experience during my stay at the Marriott Marina in San Diego this past weekend and wanted to know if anyone out there had a similar experienceâ€¦ I just came back from attending a conference at the San Diego Convention Center and stayed in a room in the South Tower. On the first night, I was awakened by someone kicking/pushing my legsâ€¦As this was happening, I kept thinking to my self, this is weirdâ€¦am I awake or having a dream? Well, I WAS awake and I WAS NOT having a dreamâ€¦I was soooo scared that I pulled the sheets over my head and curled my body up under the sheets and the kicking and pushing stoppedâ€¦ Overall this was a nice place to stayâ€¦beautiful groundsâ€¦Yes, I'd come back and stay here except, I would make sure I donâ€™t stay in that same roomâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: CoCoa04
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time in San Diego. This property is great for families, couples & singles. The hotel staff was was very friendly. We had a beautiful marina view room. The beds were awesome. The pool was great, along with the poolside beverage service. Restuarants were great. Location was perfect. Could walk to everything. I just cant say enough about this place. Would definently stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “They did everything right!”
Reviews.Author: flights
Reviews.Content: Request a room with a balcony (I think that's the North Tower?). Having a balcony made our stay special. We loved being able to get outside in the great San Diego weather and watch the bay and boat traffic, and enjoy beautiful sunsets! We stayed at this hotel because of its proximity to the Convention Center. This is a busy, convention-oriented, extremely well run hotel! Our room, and the hotel in general, was spotless. Staff was courteous and efficient, concierge was helpful and knowledgeable. The only hotel restaurant we tried was the casual restaurant by the water, and the food was good, service excellent. Laundry/dry cleaning service was available on a Sunday. Room service was "30-minutes-or-less", the orders were correct, the food hot. But remember, do try for a room with a balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Make the Mistake...”
Reviews.Author: coppellite
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Marriott. This was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. Although San Diego is a great city, it is quite funny how staying at a bad hotel can ruin your experience. The rooms have no style and it looks like the decorators went to a flea market to find anything with a nautical theme. There are paper thin walls so you can hear everything that anyone says. One night, at about midnight, a bunch of drunk people came up to our floor and started singing in the hallways and yelling vulgar language for about an hour. We almost left the hotel, but then moved to the North Tower where it was much quieter, but still had the "charming" look of the other room. There also are many trains and concerts going on right outside your window. On the plus side, there are many things within walking distance of the hotel. So, if you love ugly decor or don't want to sleep your stay, this is the place for you. If not, here are three properties I would highly reccommend: 1. The Westin Horton Plaza 2. The Manchester Grand Hyatt 3. The Omni San Diego And above all, don't stay at the Marriott!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Marriott Marina”
Reviews.Author: niclou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Marina last week while my husband attended a conference. It was a very nice hotel. I had called ahead and requested a room in the north tower and that's what we got. We were on the 19th floor with lovely views. We paid for a city view , but the way our balcony was arranged we could acually see more of the bay than the city! It was room 1908. The bed was incredible - so soft. There was a fridge in the room, so I kept it stocked with water. It was nice having the coffee maker also. There is a safe in the closet along with an iron/iron board. Your typical room. The bathroom was ok. It would have been nice to have a double vanity, but it was adequate. We ate breakfast at LC's every morning having the buffet. It was pretty good. The pool area is very nice. Good service too. The hotel is within walking distance to so much. It's a great location. Seaport Village, Gaslamp Quarter and much more right there. My husbad has another meeting in 2 weeks and we will be back at the Marriott Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, what about the free movies?”
Reviews.Author: PHXroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: I am a guest at this hotel as I write this, and stay at Marriott properties about 150 nights a year on business. The hotel is in a great convenient location, and although not new, is still very fresh and has a nice range of facilities. The view from the city view rooms is great, and my colleague, who has a water view room, has a beautiful view of the harbor and passing boats. The rooms have new carpet and the new Marriott beds. The bathrooms have also been re-done within the last few years. My only critique is that the credenza, desk, etc. are a bit dated. I read the review a few posts down before checking in, and laughed about the woman who was all worried about the "soft core porn" available in the rooms. So I went to the TV to see what she was talking about. The Marriott TV has exactly the same set-up as every other Marriott everywhere, and it's very obvious that the pay channels are being accessed. There's also a very clear menu option that allows you to lock out adult channels...and none of the previews that are available show any nudity. So, my two cents' worth is that it's not quite what you read below, and I wouldn't worry if I was there with my children. Overall, great hotel and feel free to watch the TV without worry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Five Days”
Reviews.Author: firekapy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay. Had a wonderful time. Arrived around 2:00 pm on Tuesday. Check-in was a breeze. Was given a very nice room in the north tower with views of the marina. Since I was on the end of the tower I actaully had two balconies, one with a view of the city and the other of the marina. The pool was great and not overcrowded at all. Pool service was excellent. Location is great with easy walk to Seaport Village, Gaslamp District and the Midway. Would definitely stay there again, in fact, planning another trip next month.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in beautiful SD!”
Reviews.Author: vegaslover73
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a two-night stay. Despite being totally sold out due to two conventions, hotel staff made me feel very welcome and displayed consummate professionalism. Room service was speedy and delicious, the room was impeccably clean, the large (Hawaii sized!) pool was perfect, and this was a really nice stay in beautiful SD. Yes, there is some train noise if you're on a lower floor, and the rooms could be a bit larger, too. But, all things considered, this is a very nice property perfect for business, pleasure, or a little of both. I recommend the hotel and the Yacht Club Restaurant, too. 4* for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - except for the trains...”
Reviews.Author: Fabia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights last week. The rooms were clean, the pool was great, the food was good. I would definitely stay here again but would request a room that was not overlooking the city. There is a freight train that runs by the hotel blaring it's horn all hours of the day and night. This woke us up around 1:45 am every single morning, and my husband is usually a very sound sleeper. It reminded me of that scene in "My Counsin Vinny" - that is really how bad it was. I know that it is not the hotel's fault, but you think that such a nice hotel would do something about sound proofing this annoying train.

Reviews.Title: “Have Children? Beware!”
Reviews.Author: spunkjoy
Reviews.Content: Our vacation got off to a rocky start. The hotel room itself was nice except that the TV was not facing the beds in our room (this turned out to be a good thing for my son, age 8, who was lying on the bed). As my husband was channel surfing looking for a sports channel at about 9:30 p.m., a lady with her full chest exposed appeared. Fortunately, just our daughter, age 12, saw this. Long story short, is that we went on to find about six channels (free of charge or personal request) with what would be considered soft porn (even a hotel staff confirmed this). After I called the front desk they informed me that they could block the free, in-house channels for us (afterward we did find a note on top of the TV that said this), but that there wasn't anything that they could do about the other 2-3 cable channels that they subscribed to that had pornographic material. The hotel did agree not to charge us for another night and we switched to the nearby Hyatt Regency the next morning so that we did not have to be concerned with more accidental exposures. We enjoyed out stay here without one channel with pornography!

Reviews.Title: “A little impersonal but quite convenient”
Reviews.Author: fabiobol
Reviews.Content: We stopped 3 days and nights in San Diego during a longer trip in California. We chose the Marriott Marina for its location, near the Gaslamp Quarter with shops and restaurants and with a view on the bay at the same time. Both came as expected and made our stay quite pleasant. The hotel is very large with two towers of over 20 floors. Traffic in the lobby over weekend was quite crazy, but on Monday the hotel returned to a more relaxed and acceptable atmosphere. Check-in was efficient, though a bit cold. However they accepted to swap our 6th-floor room with an identycal one on the 19th, as we did not want to get noise from the pool below. Valet parking can be messy with long queuing, on the contrary they booked us restaurants in a very efficient mode. The room we were given was small but acceptable with two queen-size beds. Bathroom size and equipment were below the standard of the hotel class; towels were small and not very soft. No mini-bar in the room but the small fridge was working properly. Room size was a little disappointing, we found hard to place luggage around. One of the two towers has rooms with a tiny balcony. Not a great extra but day and nightview on the bay's harbour is pleasant. There are two swimming pools, mostly crowded during the day -given size of the hotel- and not particularly clean. The pool bar is however a special place at sunset and night, thanks to some nice seating areas and a few tables with fire in the center. 2 and 3-seat bicycles can be rented near the pool area to have some fun with kids in Seaport's streets. The Marriott Marina is at walking distance from the joyful Seaport Village and from 5th street were lots of restaurants and shops can make your stay in San Diego a wonderful, though expensive, experience. We dined at the Yacht Club, with music and fireworks in the bay. Careful and brilliant service and excellent meat and fish. Breakfast is unfortunately a disaster at LC's: 20 to 30 minutes wait-time for a small place with average choice of food are simply not acceptable for such a place. Suggestion, which we experienced on all 3 mornings: exit the hotel, turn right and walk down the little harbour five minutes and enter Hyatt's Lael restaurant to enjoy a super-breakfast and great waiters.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Employees - Mildew smell in room”
Reviews.Author: bluewater0667
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 2 nights at the San Diego Marriott Hotel & Marina. I went with my wife and our 5 year old daughter. I had spent 3 nights there in the South Tower 2 years ago and it was magnificent, this year, everything was horrible. The price of the room was $285 a night that included parking and breakfast in the morning. The room they gave me was a high room in the North Towere but it smelled like mildew. I went to the front desk to see if they could get me a room in the South Tower, they did not have any with a balcony which I had paid for, so they offered me a different room in the same tower. I agreed but when we got to the new room we noticed the smell was less prevelant but the smell was still there. The room in itself was very average for a Marriott. We decided that we would just let it go. I had also asked at the time of check in for "the card" that we were supposed to give us that indicated that we were entitled to the breakfast and discout tickets to Sea World, the Zoo etc. I was told that I did not need the card and to give them my name and room number. I had gone to someone else at the hotel front desk and asked them for the card as well and they gave me the same answer. The next morning we went to purchase our discount tickets to the zoo and the lady asked me where my discount card was. I told her that I had asked for this card twice and they did not have them. She told I needed that, and I could tell from her attitude that she thought I was making this up to get discount tickets. She checked with the front desk and found out that I did have that package and got me the card which stated that I could get tickets to the zoo. Fast forward, we get to the zoo the zoo won't sell us discount tickets telling us that we should have got them from the hotel. I call the hotel they tell me to come back to the concierge desk and they will credit my hotel bill I did return and they did refund the discount but not before I have spent more of my time staigthening out their mess that they so discreetly delivered to me, but I did get plenty of attitude from the lady at the concierge desk with no apologies for the problems. Fast forward again, to check out time and the luck of the draw I get the same nasty woman who had got me the change in rooms. Guess what? Same attitude. A thank you for staying? NO, nothing. The one thing is that I was confronted by the bellman demanding to me what did I need when I parked out front during check out. Now the topping on the cake, they charge me $5 for an Evian water that I did not open and did not drink, but they charged me for it after I had already checked out. I called to ask them to correct this and they gave me some other number to call to get it corrected as they said it was over 24 hours from when I checked out. AHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!! It's a shame because there were a lot of great, warm wonderful people that worked there, but not enough for me. I cancelled the remainder of my nights at the Del Mar Marriott and ended up moving to the Hilton Garden Inn Carlsbad - Highly recommened. Best move of my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Hotel and Marina Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: momLA
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline to find a 4-star hotel in San Diego for a three-day getaway for my husband and I and our 8-year-old with the plan to go to Sea World, eat, relax and swim. I was disappointed that I got a Marriott (4 stars, I thought, yea right) that wasn't right near Sea World and that saved me only 75 dollars for the three nights. (On another trip we got the Islandia for $90 a night!). But, I was glad to be getting out of town. My disappointment began to ease when on (very late) arrival the lovely desk clerk upgraded us to a balcony room when I said it would be great if we have a view for our daughter, who loves to be high up. I did not specifically ask for an upgrade, but it was available so she gave it to me. She discussed with me the merits of the various views available and then changed us from our original room assignment. We were given several goody bags for my daughter's amusement and were taken up to the room and given the fridge we'd asked for. The room was nicely decorated with a sort of nautical flair. The throws on the bed were a nice touch. We fell into our exceptionally comfortable beds. (Their advertising is correct -- their beds and bedding are just lovely). My normally restless daughter was asleep very quickly. The view was great -- the marina and its lights to our left and downtown San Diego to our right. I should mention the shampoo and conditioner they offer is terrific as are all the room amenities. We had purchased two-day Sea World tickets on the park's website, but decided to go Saturday so we could just relax on Friday and my husband could get some work done. (I recommend their website -- if the park is busy, you just go to the turnstile and present your print out -- no lines). We had to pay extra for his online access, but the charge was reasonable. My morning mood depends on a double espresso, so when I went to LC's (their casual restaurant in the north tower) with my daughter I asked if they had espresso or should I go up to Starbucks in the hotel and bring it in with me. They said no, they could offer it. But, when breakfast came, they brought regular (weak, awful) coffee apologizing that their machine was broken. I explained that that wasn't going to work for me and they went and got me my coffee upstairs. It took a while, but was done with very good grace. They also brought a bagel instead of an English muffin and hash browns instead of fruit. These mistakes were again corrected with a good attitude. We then walked around -- my daughter was delighted with the ducks and fish in the ponds encircling the tower near the pool. After that we changed and went to the pool, which is a freeform design and is quite large and pleasant. A towel kiosk is right there and fresh towels are always available. After swimming and sunning, my husband joined us and we all ate lunch at umbrella tables near the pool using the poolside dining service, which was basic but good. The Irish girl waiting on us was very busy, but had a great attitude, so the wait didn't seem so bad! With no shade next to the pool it was a little hot, but I doubt there'd be room for umbrellas. My daughter was tired from the trip so we got her an online movie and we napped and read. After a pleasant walk along the marina looking for a restaurant, we realized our daughter was too over-the-hill and opted for dinner in our room. The delivery from outside restaurants had stopped, so we were left with room service. Her kid's pizza meal was reasonably priced and pronounced delicious. She thinks room service is just awesome. I have to agree! We waited to order after her bedtime and had a romantic dinner in the little area between the bathroom and the closet! But the chicken porcini pasta with a tomato cream sauce was excellent and came with a very good ceasar salad. The room service table had a warmer so we could eat our salads and still have hot pasta and dessert. Our wines by the glass were excellent. Next time I'll bring candles for the table! Based on the prices I was seeing on our walk back to the hotel, I think we did just fine. Next morning we did Starbucks breakfast for all of us so we could get an earlier start to Sea World. The Marriott parking attendant gave us a map on our way out and explained the best way to go. We ended up saving bundle of time because we didn't take the obvious exit marked "Sea World" but followed his directions. We weren't far at all from the park, and given the traffic, I'm not sure being close would have helped that much. You still have to line up and get into the parking lot. Again, good service, offered in a friendly way from the Marriott made our stay more pleasant. We ate at the park that day -- it is what it is. Our daughter had seen the late nght swimmers at the Marriott and was dying to swim at night, so we ate at the Yacht Club restaurant to save time. Based on the menu I was expecting good things. Her kids meal was fine. The crabcake starter was excellent -- good quality crabcakes well prepared, so I was looking forward to the rest of the meal. But our shared salad and seafood pasta left a lot to be desired. Yes the salad was fresh and the dressings were original to the restaurant but strangely flavored. The house vinaigrette was very sweet and the honey/mustard we got to replace it was made with Chinese, not Dijon, mustard so was overly strong and unbalanced. The seafood pasta also was odd. The shrimps and scallops were very well prepared, but the sauce, which sounded like a classic garlic and oil, was very strongly flavored of lemon -- as if it were for a seafood salad. Big mistake and a real wine killer. My pinot grigio was not as good as the one I got with room service. We didn't have time to replace anything as we wanted to get swimming and get our daughter to bed, but if it had been just the two of us, I think we would have sent both dishes back. The night swim was lots of fun for all of us. The pool was thankfully nicely heated, since a wind had come up off the harbor. The swim plus the lovely bed sent our daughter to dreamland very quickly. That's it. I'm getting her a featherbed! Sunday, my husband and daughter headed to Sea World. I had a tummy upset (I think I can blame that on Sea World's food!) , which gave me an excuse to finish my novel and rest. I then had a lovely swim after packing up our things. We had asked for late check out, which they let us have until 1:30 pm. They stored our bags until my family arrived back from the park. The very nice baggage guy explained that it could take a while to get the bag out of the baggage claim, so to be aware of that. I was able to go call for the bags when my husband called to say they were on their way back. He also advised us to get on the road as the traffic from San Diego to LA can really pile up in the late afternoon /early evening. We did after a quick lunch at Horton Plaza (a nearby downtown outdoor mall with many food choices) and made excellent time. So. I have to concede -- it is a 4-star hotel. Service was excellent, friendly, and courteous. It's a big hotel with a combination of families, young couples and conventioneers. It seems to be bustling all the time. It's part of a chain and a huge hotel group, but it felt as if each person who helped us had a personal stake in our stay and our enjoyment. Requests from the "at your service desk" were delivered promptly (extra towels, extra plastic bags, etc.) Advice we received was correct and helpful. The only improvement I could see was in the food at the yacht club and LCs. But, again, in both restaurants, the service was very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott - go elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: jat7
Reviews.Content: Online the pool looked wonderful but it wasn't. The pool was overcrowded and too small for the hotel. Even my son didn't want to swim there! It wasn't too clean. They took the slide area out and had a dirty koi pond. We were guaranteed a ocean view room (even stated such on our web receipt) but when we arrived they didn't have it available. Room was $300 per night - bed was very comfy but bathroom a let down - small tub, etc. Some wallpaper peeling. Halls need a good scrubbing and painting. Towels were sparse. Tried several timesw to get additional towels but they never came. The valet parking was a nightmare! It took ages to get your car and to drop it off. Be sure and self park. Service wasn't very good when we checked in or inquired about lost items... Wireless didn't work the entire weekend but they charged us anyway. My thoughts, stay at the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Location is their saving grace”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTravelGal
Reviews.Content: Service is fine; rooms are nice; pretty views, etc. However, just remember you are only paying for the location in downtown/convention center/seaport village. If you don't need to be right by the convention center, there are other much nicer resorts to stay at for the same price (paradise point). The only reason we are forced to stay there is b/c of Comic-Con convention each year- it kills me what we have to pay for a weekend stay (let's just say for the same price, I could be at an all inclusive Caribbean resort!). The pool is NOT heated. Typical hotel pool. The gym is OLD and barely has any equipment. The food at the restaurants are nasty. Parking is $18-24/nite self vs valet The best thing about the hotel is the nice workers/service and the convenience of the location, otherwise you're better off saving your money to stay a little farther away and use the $ on activities, entertainment, etc. instead. Or spend close to the same amount, just go to paradise point resort instead (about 10 miles away in Mission Bay)....

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not as nice as Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Mortimerfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the North Tower, fairly low floor, for six nights. Other than the partying conventioneers below our room two nights, it was quiet, which was a huge improvement over our last stay in the South Tower. We still love the breakfast buffet (although $18 is on the expensive side), and the location can't be beat. That's all the positive stuff I can think of. The experience wasn't *terrible, by any means, but there was a constant trickle of annoyances, from a broken shower handle that cut my hand (and was apparently the source of the bloody shower curtain that was there when we arrived....) to the thow-up-the-covers-and-call-it-made approach to bedmaking our housekeeper employed. The refrigerator didn't work and smelled of mildew. The bathtub didn't get cleaned well once while we were there. We didn't get the foam pillows we requested in advance, and our inability to get TWO extra BATH towels, every day for the duration of our stay, requested in writing via the Marriott website (and confirmed) in advance, reached the point of absurdity. By the end of the week I did a commando raid on a housekeeping cart to get the towels. We got six bottles of conditioner, and only two of shampoo, over the course of the week. The pool area, which looks lovely, still, was festooned with little dabs of duck poop from the three families of ducks that live there. Worse, it stayed in the same spots from day to day (ew). The piped-in muzak at the pool was incredibly loud, and the bass was turned WAY up so you got hours of constant reggae beat, full-blast. We'd go ask at the pool shack for them to turn it down, they would, and then twenty minutes later some other shack employee would blast it again. For the money, the Embassy Suites (where we stayed earlier this year) delivers a much nicer facility and better service. (Did I mention the surly, sarcastic bell-boy who said that NO they do NOT have a shuttle, and that perhaps the best thing to do if I wanted inexpensive airport transportation would be to take a CAB?) (Did I mention the housekeeper who barged into our room at 7 am when she obviously thought we were at breakfast, looking for her tip?)

Reviews.Title: “Love this Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Tonya
Reviews.Content: What a great time we had in San Diego, and a great experience at the Marine Marriott. Very impressed and will definitely stay here again. First of all I booked on Priceline, two rooms, $143/room/night. Great value for the location, even though the previous times I had gotten much better rates through Priceline for the Grand Hyatt and Hilton Gaslamp, this time there were conventions in town and I guess that is why. We were arriving in San Diego around 9:30am, my husband just happened to call to see if there would be any possibility of checking in early. Imagine my surprise when they said yes, gave us perfect directions from I-5. Upgraded our rooms, we had really cool rooms, on the very end of the north tower. We had two balconies, one pretty good size and one small one. Pretty much the seam of the building. Rooms were non smoking, king beds and side by side. Just as we had requested. The bed and shower weren't as great as the Hilton in LA, but we would have stayed at this Marriott a week. Everyone was very friendly, helpful, and when we checked out the next day the girl at the parking booth asked how many people I had with me and she gave me complimentary water (2 each because they were small she said)to take with us. Right at Seaport Village, and walking distance to the gaslamp quarter, we were just too tired to walk. My husband used the hot tub, the pool area was very nice, lounge chairs, with fire pits made for a very relaxing area. Although we didn't get to enjoy it, I would like to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CenlaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the Marriott Marina for a business function. The location can't be beat. Walk to Seaport Village for fun shopping and dining. Horton Plaza is just blocks away, and the trolley stops directly in front of the hotel. My north tower room had a great view of the bridge and pool area. The rooms were very well appointed with a great feather bed and down comforter. I can't really comment on the dining options because most of my meals were either eaten off-site, or were catered private functions inside the hotel. I ate the breakfast buffett and a quick burger lunch at the Marriott and both meals were good. I would recommend this hotel for location over anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Bay Views”
Reviews.Author: DaveAndBetty
Reviews.Content: From our 23rd floor bay-view room in the North Tower, we observed the sweeping Coronado Bridge, the picturesque Island of Coronado, the marina, and passing ships--a photographer's smorgasbord. We have admired these scenes in calendars and travel magazines in the past. Now, here we were, celebrating our wedding anniversary and enjoying a room location recommended by previous Trip Advisors. The hotel has several noteworthy qualities; some are highlighted as follows: 1. Striking architecture and lush landscaping. An almond-shaped tower and its neighboring concave-curved tower, both with dark, reflective glass, are unique to San Diego's skyline. 2. Comfortable and clean guest rooms. We appreciated the bed with six pillows; sofa, chair, and coffee table; and a small refrigerator. The spotless bathroom had thick towels and ample sundries. 3. Variety of food service. We enjoyed the full buffet breakfast at LC's in the North Tower and salads and sandwiches for lunch at the Yacht Club Restaurant. Tasty and generous room-service meals for dinner were delivered in 30 minutes. 4. Hotel maintenance. We made one phone call to the hotel operator to report our broken desk lamp. It was repaired in an hour. 5. Reservations and registration. We called the hotel directly to reserve our senior-rate room. Upon arrival we received everything for which we had asked, and the staff made us feel like welcome guests. Other comments: 1. We arrived when there was a great deal of activity at the city's convention center next door. We were caught in the wrong traffic lane for hotel registration and spent 20 minutes to correct our error. 2. Valet parking cost $25 per day for hotel guests. With all of the activity, we were grateful to use the services of a polite and helpful vehicle attendant. 3. There was loud music from a nearby outdoor amphitheatre on both Sunday and Monday evenings. This could be a positive for some. However, we prefer selecting our own music and listening when we choose to do so. When we closed the balcony door and drapery, the sound was mitigated but could still be heard in the room. Conclusion Overall, we appreciated the location, comfort, cleanliness, and service of the hotel. We will not forget the views from our upper floor bay-view room, and we thank previous Trip Advisors for the recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: EscapeMichigan
Reviews.Content: Spent a fantastic week in San Diego! We had a great opportunity to visit several Marriott hotels in the area ( for other reviews from this trip check out Marriott Coronado Island Resort, Courtyard San Diego Downtown, and Gas Lamp Marriott) The Marina Marriott was probably my favorite hotel we stayed at. We always like to have a nice large pool area, this one rivaled any resort. There are 2 pools, lots of chairs and towels, extra room on a near by grassy area for lounging when the pool area gets to crowded. They have a great Tiki bar by the pool and food service delivered right to your lounge chair. Pleanty of servers in the area to get you anything you need. The grounds are very nice, we really enjoyed the fire pits and sitting areas, there is a restaurant overlooking the marina, I think another 2 inside on the lower level, one is more casual, the other is more upscale. There are also 2 bars up on the lobby level a pub type and another more of a chill lounge. The hotel has two towers, the North seems to be a little newer and had a more contemporary feel, the South was also nice but has a more standard hotel feel, perhaps to be restyled, but both are clean and nice. The north side did have balconies on the majority of the rooms however, so maybe just more expensive in general. (we stayed in both sides) This location of this hotel is great, obviously right on the water, walking distance to the Gas Lamp district and Seaport Village, connected to the convention center and there is also a trolley stop right out front. There was lots of staff and they are well trained and friendly. The Marina Marriott and the Coronado Island Marriott have a water taxi that runs between hotels for $5 each way. Favorite random city tip: Breakfast (or Lunch) in Nordstrom at Horton Plaza, maybe one of the best city views from restaurant balcony. No waiting, good food, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: pennsylvaniamom
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay over July 4th week. We had a North Tower room - all have balconies. Overlooked the pool and marina and the Coronado Bridge! Spectacular. Walk out of the hotel in the back and walk right into Seaport Village and the Embarcadero - we walked to many restaurants in town easily. the place to stay if you plan on doing Seaport Village and all the Harbor Drive area has to offer. Showed up in San Diego from Pennsylvania without any luggage.....the staff - front desk, concierge, bell desk - they were all professional, compassionate, resourceful, and very good at their jobs. Chris at the front desk -worked night shift during our stay - KUDOS to you - he really put in the time to help us 'locate' our luggage. They even acknowledged valet parking at self-park prices the first day, since they were so busy on check-in. Great place. Starbucks too, in lobby - as if there weren't enough Starbucks in San Diego - can one have too many of those anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JHanshaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for a conference. The hotel was beautiful. The grounds were wonderful and it was so close to the shops, right next to the convention center and a short walking distance from the Gas Lamp district. The rooms were very clean. The hotel bar had a great sports bar type atmosphere. Very relaxed. Hey, it is San Diego! The pool was a sight, waterfalls and caves and there was a coy pond along the sidewalk coming out of the hotel toward the pool. Each room in the South tower, if I remember correctly, had a balcony and I was one of the lucky ones. If you look to the left you can see sail boats galore in the Marina when you have a city view. The hotel restaurant offered a wonder buffet style breakfast with pastries, omlettes and a lot more. One of the other neat features of the hotel is that it had a computer in the lobby for guests to print their boarding passes. Saves a lot of time when it comes to check in at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “9 Years and Counting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This 4th of July marks the 9th time we have stayed here for the holiday weekend. What we like best about the hotel are the pool (along with bar-b-q and live music) and its proximity to shops, restaurants and entertainment. We've found it to be a great hotel for families with small children. My son will only stay in the North tower so that he can watch the trains. We have since turned other families on to this Marriott and always have at least one other family join us. Our only bad experience was with one of the conventions - Narcotics Anonymous. They may not have been using drugs, but they did smoke, drink and use profanity. It did not make for a family friendly weekend. However, Marriott management let us know that N A and similar conventions would no longer be booked during holidays. We now ask in advance for list of groups.

Reviews.Title: “The Trains, The Planes, The Jackhammers!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanWonderer
Reviews.Content: It's twue, the Trains run through your room, even on the 15th Floor! The MM is a stunning work of architectural art, but is it only a facade covering a cheaply constructed cardboard box hotel. The walls are paper thin, you hear your neighbors conversations, their choice of TV programs, even their bowel/bladder habits. And if you wish to retire early and they don't, fuggedaboudit. At 11:30 pm on Saturday night June 17 a train whistle blew...and I shot straight up in bed thinking the train was going right through my room. The engineer continued to sound that horn at every street crossing, and there are ALOT of street crossings in San Diego. The freight trains run all night long at erratic intervals, and you never know when that whistle will howl again. If you finally enter a deep sleep towards dawn, at 6:30 am the pile drivers from the construction site down the street start clanging. At 8 am the maids start yelling, "Hello, Housekeeping" to all the doors in the hallway. At 9 am the Navy Helicopter Taxi service begins, with up to 50 no-muffler helos a day passing not more than 1000 feet away from the hotel, back and forth all day long. At 5pm the happy hour thunder pounder speakers begin rocking on the patio 15 floors below your room, and at 7 pm 3 days a week a live concert on the lawn at Embarcadero park blasts free rock music into your hotel room until 10pm. Peace and quiet are rare commodities at this hotel. Other observations: The conference meeting rooms are comfy, the conference food service is tasty, but the Marriott exhibition hall in the basement of the meeting hall reeked of sewer gas all four days we used it, somewhat nauseating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AZVoyager
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Marina from 26-29 May. Had a room in the north tower on the 19th floor. We thought the room was just very average, even though the view of the bay was fantastic. If you're on the pool side(bay view) it will be noisy until 2200-2300. This hotel is very crowded on weekends because of its location and there are a lot of young children. Breakfasts were good with a lot of selection. If you're on the city side of the hotel you will have to contend with a lot of noise from the trains. We much prefer the Coronado Island Marriott to this one.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great! No Complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: azroyalsfan
Reviews.Content: This place was great! Stayed here 3 nights over Memorial Day Weekend with my wife, 7year old, and 4 year old. Could not have picked a better location. This hotel is basically the hub of south San Diego. We had a Bay view room that also looked down over the huge pool area. Bike rentals, Boat rentals, poolside lounge, poolside entertainment, kids movies under the stars, all part of the hotel! There was also a water taxi that takes you across to Coronado Island. Seaport Village, USS Midway, Gaslamp District, and Petco park are all within walking distance. Had Room Service for breakfast each morning which was excellent, it is delivered within 30 minutes guaranteed. The fitness center is also great and there are also tennis courts and an outdoor basketball court, all with bay or city views. Numerous bars, lounges, and places to relax with a drink. The hotel is extremely busy, but well staffed and so expansive that there are still places to relax in peace. Will never stay at another San Diego Hotel again! If you desire a balcony, be sure to specify a North Tower Room. Boat rentals go fast so try to reserve a day in advance. The boardwalk Runs right into this hotel, so you can stroll right up the bay without any trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break '06!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I along with 3 other girls stayed at this hotel during our spring break. We had a beautiful room overlooking the pool and the bay. Overall everything about this hotel was awesome. I wasn't bothered by the trains or anything like that. The location is prime, you are near the gaslamp district, seaport village, and horton plaza. Pool was great, so was the hot tub. Very relaxing and convenient. I didn't even notice that the T.V was missing some chanbels because we were barely in our room so that wasn't a big deal. Parking does cost quite a bit of money so just watch out for that. Other than that I would highly reccommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Heartbreaking Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: lholtze
Reviews.Content: This is a tough one to write. We stayed at the Marriott Marina last weekend and it is a beautiful place. The room and the service was great. Itâ€™s definitely a 4+ star hotel. Thereâ€™s just that one little thing about the freight trains. Iâ€™m not a light sleeper by any means, but the first night at 4:40 AM, then the next night at 3:45 AM the train pulled in, and for 5-6 minutes each time, it laid on bursts from itâ€™s horn that were LOUD. We took the advise of previous write-ups and got a room facing the bay, but still the noise came through like it was right below us. I love this place, but sadly, I will not return to any hotel in this area until this situation with the train horns is resolved. $250 a night is a rarity for us to pay, but this was our anniversary and the hotel, by itself, is definitely worth it. But I wouldnâ€™t pay $50 a night to stay somewhere when I know Iâ€™m going to be jarred awake in the middle of each night. This hotel, along with others in the south part of the Gaslamp Quarter all suffer from the same affliction. They need to either lower the tracks or build bridges over them so that they can fence in and isolate the trains and eliminate the need for the use of the horns. In the meantime, my only suggestion would either be to wear earplugs or leave the TV on as loud as you can bear it and still sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: UCFTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Diego Marriott and Marina for a large conference. Everything about this hotel was fabulous. We paid a rate of only $179.00 per night, this is wonderful for a hotel of this caliber. The staff from the front desk to the concierge were all exceptional. There was no wait at check-in either. The room was huge with VERY comfortable bedding. I would highly recommend getting a room in the NORTH tower. These have balconies and offer the best views of the harbor. The hotel backs up to the marina and offers breathtaking views of Coronado and the water. Seaport Village with its quaint shops and wonderful restaurants line the path on the back of the hotel. You can walk to PETCO Park, the Gaslamp Quarter, Seaport Village, the trolly station, and the San Diego Convention Center. The resort style pool area is huge with hot tubs and waterfalls everywhere. Negatives that are not a big deal: wired internet access in the room is available for $9.95 per day, the breakfast buffet at LC's was $17 and not very good; the shower head is fancy so the water pressure is slow. I would stay here in a heartbeat and would recommend this property to my business associates, colleagues, friends, and family members.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected for Marriott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2nights at the Marriott Marina on a business trip. I had a 23rd floor North tower bayview room with balcony (I had requested this based on the prior reviews). I was defintiely glad I had requested the North tower/balcony/high flower because it was nice to be able to walk out onto the blacony and the views were awesome. I think the Marriott Marina location is ideal for a visit to downtown San Diego. However, I think if you're renting a car and don't have to stay downtown La Jolla is a much prettier setting. Anyway back to the hotel... I requested a wake-up call 2nights in a row which did not work. The room and hallways had a cleanser smell which at first I found obnoxious then I got used to. Parking is overpriced 24/d. The television was lacking several channels which I normally like to watch - MTV, VH-1, E, lifetime, tlc (not a big deal).

Reviews.Title: “WARNING - Ask for a room facing the water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is a huge hotel with 2 towers. Half of the rooms face the city. Ours did. We had a cute little balcony which we couldn't use due to the incredible noise outside. The worst of is the train track directly outside the hotel on which trains, trams, freight trains run every 10 minutes from 6 a.m. to 4 a.m....And then there is the level crossing DIRECTLY in front of the main entrance. Obviously this is not Marriott's problem. However, double-paned windows and free ear-plugs in the rooms (!) would help with the noise reduction. The staff is super-friendly and always available. The conference facilities are very good. The food however in the casual restaurant and in the Yacht Club was mediocre, but service OK. The beds and pillow were very comfortable, the amenities were OK. The place is a bit dated. Overall, a great location and good hotel, but watch out for those TRAINS!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location....”
Reviews.Author: RKNLOVESCOFFEE
Reviews.Content: If you want a great view, great location, easy walking along bay and a safe area, choose this hotel. I am a Marriott employee and although I can't disclose my rate, I was in heaven. We had a bayside 19th floor room in the NORTH TOWER. The views were breathtaking, really....our balcony was big with two nice chairs. Those afraid of heights might want to sit inside, but you still can look out with a great view. Like other readers wrote on here, the South Tower had no balconies (some for some rooms), but most didn't and even though they probably had a great view too, they didn't seem as nice. The pool was a nice size but we didn't spend much time there because it was only in the high 50's this week, yikes! We walked (not far) every evening to Seaport Village which had little shops and great restaurants. Upstart Crow was my favorite coffee stop because they had great coffee, pastries and books to sit and read (or buy). There was a homemade cookie stand that was great too. The Fish Market was at the farthest end of the village (a nice hike), next to the SS Midway ship. We sat outside (on the lower level) right on the peer and had the best PRAWNS in cocktail sauce. Saw the sunset...etc. really good food. Negatives? Well, someone wrote before about dust behind their dresser and even put a picture on here. I too felt they needed to really concentrate on those little details. They needed a good vaccuum to go along the baseboards, etc. I complained to the concierge and he made sure they vacuumed really well the next morning. The bathroom was nice, and the area with a mirror, sink and closet was around corner not to disturb sleepers around the corner. Yes, I heard the trains, but no they didn't bother me at all. We didn't sleep with the door open, even though we could have, but it was a bit chilly. So, we barely heard them. I can see if someone faced the street side, then it could be a big problem. There is a Starbucks on the lobby level, fresh cold drinks in lobby, great bellman, gift shops and those brave enough to try the trolley, it was write in front of the hotel. We just couldn't figure out the trolley (it was really the train), and gave up and drove to places. Parking was too expensive, ($24), but all the hotels charged about that. Valet's very fast though. I really think this is the most beautiful (location and view wise) hotel in downtown. It is attached to the Convention Center, right next door to Seaport Village, easy access to N. Harbor and access to all the main streets. BREAKFAST WAS GREAT! My daughter who is 14 and I both ordered the kids breakfasts and they were good and plentiful, and less expensive. STAY HERE FOR LOCATION AND VIEWS FROM YOUR BALCONY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: DhKhan
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the hotel March 12 - 16, mainly due to the fantastic view from the 23rd floor Bay view room. The room was great too - comfortable bed, good furnishings and nice bathroom. But it almost ended badly when I forgot a bunch of computer and electronic items in a drawer when checking out in a hurry. Fortunately I got them all back, due to the outstanding service by housekeeping in finding them, and turning over the items to Lost & Found, who then sent them by overnight delivery to me. A great ending to a wonderful stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Service is Great”
Reviews.Author: JD3
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by how much I liked this hotel. Even though the hotel is so big, the service was excellent. There was never a wait for check-in, valet service,food and drink service at the pool, housekeeping ect. There is a North and a South tower. The North tower has the rooms with balconies, and ours had a view of the pool and the marina/bay. The rooms were an average size with high ceilings and a nice bathroom. Bed was very comfortable. The balcony was a good size. What I really enjoyed was the great location. It is a very short walk to the Gaslamp Quarter, and right next to Seaport Village. The pool area was nice, with freeform pools and a hot tub. The gym was really nice, but was quite a hike from the North Tower. It is actually located in the convention center next door.This was the only negative for me. Complimentary coffee is put out in the lobby about 5 am, but seems to be gone by 6 am, when Starbucks in the lobby opens.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the nicer Marriott's that I've stayed at. I had a city view room with two double beds with a balcony (which also over looked a little of the harbor). The view at night couldn't be beat. The pool was terrific for a city Marriott - it had a tropical resort-like feel (free-form pool, waterfalls behind the pool). The buffet breakfast at the hotel was nothing to write home about and was a bit pricey, at about $20. The only thing I didn't like about staying at this hotel was the smell of the room - I was allergic to the cleaning soultion they used, which smelled like cinnamon. If you have bad allergies to things like this, I would not recommend staying here - I would stay at the Hyatt next door instead. The back of the Marriott had a long sidewalk going past the convention center in one direction and up to Seaport Village (shops) in the other direction - very nice for walking/jogging! Overall, I would love to stay at this hotel again sometime!

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: christy2064
Reviews.Content: this is in a great location for sightseeing. right at seaport village. The only problem with this hotel is that the walls are very thin and you can hear everything between rooms and in the hallways. It is filled with families so there can be alot of noise and running in hallways (my experience). Otherwise its your normal marriott type room. the pool area is large and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at the Convention Center and stayed at the Marriott Marina Hotel. View was of the Marina and Coronada Bridge, and so, so beautiful. The Gaslight District and Seaport Village were wonderful and we went to the Village almost daily after conference. Right out the back of the hotel and a very short walk along the marina to get to the Seaport Village. Food and service again were excellent. Rooms very comfortable and good night's sleep on the mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Dragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year's Eve 2005/2006 and had a fantastic experience start to finish. From the moment we pulled up and saw the palm trees out front outlined in Christmas lights we need this was going to be a cool place. (Note to hotel - keep those lights on all year - they're great!) Every service person from the valet to the bellmen to the front desk were just great. They provided excellent service without being overly fawning. (One con - my father had left a welcome gift with at the bell desk for us and we were never notified. Only after he asked how we liked it did we know to go to the desk and ask for it. That got you 4 stars instead of 5, Marriott!) We asked for a high floor room (you should too). Yes, the train rain outside the hotel kind of often, but on a high floor you don't hear it too much. It never interrupted our sleep. The bed was awesomely comfortable! (And we're fussy about beds.) The room was spacious and had an awesome view of the city. The hotel complex is very nice with a lot of restaurants, a beautiful pool complex with hot tub. The pool grotto is just lovely to look at. (Another small con - the outdoor pool is supposed to be heated for year round swimming. It was heated, but not to a comfortable level for swimming in Dec.) The hot tub was very nice and felt wonderful. The location absolutely can't be beat. You are literally steps from Seaport Village (lots of great shops and restaurants). You are also right on the edge of the Gaslamp District. It's walkable. One last con, and this is iffy - New Year's Day there was about a one hour wait to get your car from the valet because so many people had stayed over for the night and were leaving at the same time. I think they should have anticipated this and brought on temporary extra staff. So, just a few minor negatives for an otherwise 5-dot hotel review. Stay here - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for those trains”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a city view with 2 balconies...very nice. Hotel room was small but beds were comfortable. Good customer service, too. Would have been a nice stay except that a train came by at 11:00 PM, 12:45 AM, and at 3:45 and 4:30 PM and was very loud. If you are a light sleeper like us, this would bother you. Our little boy slept through it all. Didn't read anything about the train being a problem from the reviews so didn't really expect anything like this...front desk didn't tell us about the train when we checked in. We asked for a room away from the elevator as we wanted a quiet room. Unfortunately, it's something the hotel has no control over since it's the location.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel/service lacking”
Reviews.Author: NancyJL
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion at this Marriott. There were problems with either check-in or check-out and often both for all 11 rooms. For instance, our immediate family, with 3 young children, booked 2 connecting rooms. After realizing they didn't connect, I had to argue with the front desk clerk who insisted they did. When she finally conceded the point, she asked couldn't we just stay in adjacent rooms? Although a parent's dream perhaps, I think that's called child neglect. The concierges were quite variable; some fabulously helpful, while others were downright dismissive. One day the valet presented a family member with the WRONG CAR! They couldn't find the correct car, so we had none of the car seats for that group. This nearly ruined our outing that day. Some of us were charged for both self-parking and valet parking. One family member received her bill a day early and called to say that wasn't her checkout day. They agreed she was indeed booked for one more night, but insisted she would have to move rooms anyway.
