This was the last straw. Only when the brother who made all the reservations called and lost his cool did they finally admit alll their screw-ups and 'allow' her to stay in her room. The service at the hotel provided numerous inconveniences during the 7 days we were there. We were able to have a fabulous time despite it. The views are fabulous and the location ideal. Room service was quick and accurate. The hotel's Yacht Club restaurant was the only disappointing dining experience of the stay-all of the concierge-recommended places were much better-from fine dining to places well-suited for all 17 of us, ages 2-76! It is difficult to believe the service is always this slapstick bad, but it did just keep happening. If we return, I would probably look for a different hotel closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: nemama
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Marriott in September 2005 for our Anniversary. I thought I was getting good rates until I talked to a lady at Marriott reservations and she told me to check online for Marriott rewards members and see if there were any specials. I found a special for $70 less per night (and breakfast and free parking were included). We used the difference to rent a car. The agent changed the rates as soon as I gave her the special code(not all of the agents are this helpful). It pays to ask and look for specials. Now about our stay. It tuned into one of the nicest stays we have ever had. Because we told the hotel we were celebrating our Anniversary, they gave us the upgrade we asked for, plus when we walked into our room, there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us. The view was gorgeous. We had trouble with our refrigerator, so they immediately brought us another one. We had trouble with that one(freezing our food) so they replaced the refrigerator againg AND comped us for food to replace the ruined things. We thought this was great, but were very surprised when (after an outing) we returned to our room and found a HUGE basket filled with fruit, nuts, bottled water, crackers, cheese (and many more things I can't remember) with a note from the staff in that department wishing us a Happy Anniversary. We ate at Molly's Restaurant & Bar and had a wonderful meal. If you are looking for a low priced meal this is not the place, but if you want an exceptional meal, pampering, and good wine, try Miolly's. The lamb was superb. The Yaught Club Restaurant & Bar has an outside bar that is fun to sit at and is very relaxing. They inside part was nice also, just watch out for the birds. The food was very good. We wanted to sit on the second floor, but that part is no longer in use, too bad, it would have been a gorgeous view. We found some items on our final bill that were not correct, but if you are calm with them and explain your concerns, they are very helpful and corrected the items that were wrong. Were we happy with our stay? Extremely, will we return there? In a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money - adendum”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the host hotel for the AHIMA National Convention 10-15 to 10-21-05. 5 of my nights there were to be charged to a corporate card, and 1 to my card. On returning to work, our Assistant found that not only were the charges posted incorrectly (5 to my card and 1 to corporate), but that the hotel had also charged me a $174.00 no-show penalty! This on top of the hotel trying to charge me $5 for bottle of water that I never asked for!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelers1
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days here as part of our honeymoon in October of 2005. It was a nice room - comparable to other Marriotts. It's a very nice location on the water and very close to the Gaslamp District. I would say the Marriott is comparable to other Marriotts but the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad Hotel, Managment Sucks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the rooms are clean, but when I tried to extend my stay for an extra day because of work, I got a room (I"m Marriot Gold) while my collegue's reservation mysteriously disappeared. Managment was very unhelpfully and said the only rooms available were for $300, eventhough it was their screw up. There was a conference that day and what they basically did was give away his room for someone willing to pay more. I would still recommend the place, my collegue will never return to a marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Good but the Gaslamp Marriott is a better location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in September a tthe end of our vacation. generally the hotel is very good although our bathroom was a litle tired, and the washbasin leaked (although the hotel fixed this immediately we identified the problem). The views are great, and it is not too far to walk to the gaslamp quarter. It is a very busy function and convention hotel though- with people moving through th elobby at all times of the day and night. I think on the Saturday evening - the last of our stay there were three school reunions nd a large ball being held at the hotel The shuttle boat to Coronado only goes on the hour, and is more expensive than the normal ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-room are dated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At our arrival the hotel lobby was packed with people as this hotel is very popular for conventions. But the staff was still very friendly and patient. We got a room in the North tower with a fantastic view on the 28th floor. Unfortunately the room itself could not hold up to the high expectations as it was not very clean (do not lift the toilet seat, urgh) and our carpet had a lot staines. We loved the location and took the trolley for a sightseeing tour which departs right in front of the hotel. After sunset we had the most beautiful view over the marina and city. If our room would have been cleaner this stay would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pleasure Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from September 1-5 for an extended weekend in San Diego. I had the Wild @ Work Package which included breakfast, bayview room, free parking, and a discount on restaurants (which we didn't use) We arrived late from the East Coast on the 1st and were given a balcony room on a high floor in the North Tower, as I requested. We were very hungry, but no restaurants were open (it was about 10 pm), so we had to order room service. It was pricey, but not ridiculous for room service. The room was clean and nicely decorated. However, as we went to bed I noted that it had a pass through door to the next room, and the person next door was clearly watching TV. It was very loud. The elevator was also close by and you could hear a 'whooshing' sound. The next morning, I went to the front and desk and asked for a quieter room. They mentioned that about half the rooms had pass throughs, but found me one on the 16th floor that did not and was slightly further away from the elevator. We set up there and that room was much quieter. I also liked that the beds faced the open balcony, so you could actually see the Harbor while lying down. The rooms have refridgerators which is a nice touch, also--there is a grocery store (Ralph's) two blocks from the Convention Center to buy soda/water at. I also announced a few minor cleanliness issues--some dust accumulate, etc. Nothing major. The decor in the rooms is modern and fresh and looks fairly new, as does the North Tower lobby (where there is a fairly bad lounge singer on weekend nights). Two problems areas: Elevators and parking. I'm not sure if all the elevators were working, but in peak times the waits could be bothersome...10 minutes or so and very crowded. Self parking was also a problem. I'm not a fan of valet parking and my wife and I like to go out and back a lot (plus self park was included), but space was pretty tight and at times we had to fight with other cars for spaces (like at the mall during Thanksgiving shopping week). Perhaps when the hotel is less busy, it isn't a problem. Also, you have to give your room number and name to the attendant and wait while they look it up (problematic if you change rooms like we did the first night)--I wish they would install a device where you can just insert your room key and go. That would be much simpler and faster. Breakfast each morning was very high quality. The package included the full buffet which featured the standard Marriott omelette and waffle bars, among other goodies. However, since it was Labor Day weekend it was very crowded. Servers were friendly and trying hard, but I don't there were enough to handle the crowd. Wait time was around 15 mins for 2 people, plus a decent sized wait up at the buffet. Still, I'm a picky eater but the food was excellent and I would recommend this, especially if you have a package. We didn't eat at the other restaurants because of all the options around San Diego. The location of the hotel is fanstastic...adjacent to a board walk that includes the Hyatt and Seaport village. Its an easy walk down to the USS Midway, which by the way was an outstanding attraction. Its also just a short stroll over to the Gaslamp Quarter, but the setting is nicer than the hotels there because its a little more sedate and relaxed setting. The grounds of the hotel are quite nice and tropical. There is a large pool, but as another reviewer noted it was quite busy with kids during the day. At night it was very nice (though San Deigo weather makes it a little chilly). The jacuzzi was crowded at night (they could use a larger one) and a bit too hot for my tastes, but my wife liked it. Overall, this is a very nice hotel. We did look around the city at other hotels and ended up being very happy we went with the Marriott Marina. We were also considering the Gaslamp Marriott which is only a few blocks away, but that new property is very 'chic' and didn't strike us as anything special. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel despite a few minor flaws. The staff is attentive and friendly, location is fantastic, and rooms have great views and are nicely decorated in the North Tower. Hopefully, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: tjk1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott San Diego Hotel and Marina August 31 - September 5, 2005 for a pleasure trip. The public areas of the north tower are newly renovated, which is very apparent when you compare it to the south tower. Most rooms in the north tower have balconies, so itâ€™s the tower to stay in if you can. We had a harbor view room, which was reasonably nice, but there were some major cleanliness issues which were surprising for a Marriott and quite a pain to resolve. The issues ranged from dried toothpaste residue on the bathroom faucet, short black hairs on toilet, dried filth on the bathroom floor grout, dirty fingerprints on the bathroom door and mirrors, a build up of hair and dust balls on the carpet next to the bedside table, and hairs on the sheets (honestly!). It took several calls to the front desk to get these issues resolved, and even after multiple attempts, the room was not clean to our satisfaction (and I don't think our expectations are unreasonably high). For our trouble, they gave us $50 off, which I thought was a bit shoddy. We also had a few billing issues, which have yet to be resolved as I write this, namely the fact that they have apparently been unable to apply a 15% discount on food items, which was supposed to be included in our package price. The staff was pleasant for the most part. The Marriott Elite concierge lounge is located on the 24th floor of the un-renovated north tower. Typical of Marriott, it was nothing spectacular, but it did offer honor bar and snacks. Strangely, there is no bathroom on the floor of the lounge. The pool area is great and expansive, with a kids' pool and larger adult pool with waterfalls and waitress service. We were there during Labor Day weekend, so the pool area was VERY busy (getting a lounge chair after noon was virtually impossible) and the pool was full of screaming, splashing kids, but it was pleasant during the weekdays before all the weekend guests arrived. Parking isn't cheap so it's a good idea to look for a package that includes it. The hotel location is great and overall, it was a reasonably good experience. I would stay there again if they dealt with the cleanliness issues.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: jasper1
Reviews.Content: The Marriot was great and far surpassed our expectations from the service to the location. We had requested two adjoining rooms bayside for us and our 2 teens and ended up with a city view but it wasn't an issue for the short time we were actually in our rooms. The rooms were spotless as were the bathrooms, the beds were feathered and very comfortable, all in all the hotel was very hard to beat. The pools were open until 11.00pm which our boys thought was great. A short walk out the back of the hotel and we were on the marina with numerous cafes, restaurants and shops. The boys hired bikes from the hotel at $12 per half hour and had a great time riding around the promade and adjoining park. It was only a 15 min walk to the Horton Plaza. Overall a great stay and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful San Diego Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scd_cosprgs
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We had a corner room with windows across two walls that looked towards the city. Service was wonderful and everyone was very nice. Pool and outdoor areas were very nice. Would highly recommend this hotel for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Head to the North Tower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent a delightful week at this prime waterfront location, I love Marriots - they get it right: top notch service, quality linens, etc... Of course the food's pricey - It's on the waterfront in a highly desirable location! But whatever you do: Stay in the North Tower... They've all got balconies. Only the suites in the South Tower has 'em... Oh and bring binoculars... the view will have you gawking at sailboats all day. They have 6 local beers from local breweries on tap (might I suggest the "Hop Juice") You're never more that a $10 cab ride from anywhere... Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Convention Center Meetings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent five nights at this modern hotel while attending a convention at the San Diego Convention Center. The rooms are a bit larger than the usual downtown hotel and on the harbor side of the hotel they each have a balcony with a nice view of Coronado across the bay and the yacht harbor below. The desk was convenient for working with cable access available. My room had a safe large enough for my laptop computer. The North Tower contains the breakfast restaurant (Las Cascadas) which has an excellent breakfast buffet, and the lunch/dinner restaurant (the Yacht Harbor) with outdoor and indoor eating. By my third breakfast, the restaurant staff knew me and vice versa. I felt the hotel staff was friendly and proud of this beautiful hotel. One waiter was very rude on one occasion, and I reported this incident to the restaurant manager, who sincerely apologized and went out of her way to be extra nice to me throughout the rest of the stay. Apology accepted! I ordered room service one night and it arrived in just 20 minutes. The hotel is just a five minute walk to the Convention Center. Here is a tip to save a minute or two getting there. When wallking to the Convention Center, instead of walking out the front door of the hotel and turning right, instead, go almost to the end of the lobby on the South Tower side (near Starbuck's), and then take the escalator down to the parking lot and from there the Convention Center is a few feet away. This might not sound like a shortcut, but it is. The Gaslight District is walking distance away from the hotel - about eight blocks. This hotel is the closest hotel to the SD Convention Center and there are many places in the hotel lobby to meet informally with other conventioneers. The price was a bit steep at $255 per night plus taxes, but this is a clean, professional, spacious, and architecturally attractive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amateurish,unprofessional treatment”
Reviews.Author: Grundoon
Reviews.Content: A really nice facility, great location, everything in good repair; but... Made the reservation eight months earlier (Sep 2004) as part of a conference/convention package; was promised a non-smoking room. Received an e-mail from Marriott two weeks before arrival stating they would not be able to assign me a non-smoking room as previously promised. Phoned Marriott's central 800 number to ask what had happened between September 2004 and May 2005 that would cause them to dis-honor the reservation. Reservations lady announced she did have a non-smoking room for me after all, and that they could keep their promise. Absolutely not the way a supposed four-star property should do business. On the local level, management needs to be reminded that front-line employees such as bellhops give guests the first, and possibly only, impression of how the property is run. In this case, the head bellhop needs to be taken behind closed doors and sternly taught/re-taught how to treat guests. His surly, not-my-job attitude when asked for simple things such as directions to nearby businesses guarantees it'll be a hot day in Tierra del Fuego before I trouble this Marriott property with my presence and dollars again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location!”
Reviews.Author: FriesGCA
Reviews.Content: The San Diego Marriott Marina is a great hotel! From the minute you step out of the shuttle you are greeted by friendly bell men eager to please. Check in was a breeze. Definitely stay in the North Tower - the view of the bay is awesome and the balconies are a big plus. I was there for a convention and some pleasure time. This hotel is ideally situated between Seaport Village and the Gaslamp Quarter. You are in easy walking distance to Petco Park to see the Padres play baseball. I would also suggest taking the Marriott ferry across the bay over to the Coronado Marriott. We had a great time walking around Coronado too. Hop on the Trolley Tours that pick you up directly in front of the Mariott and take the city tour for $25. You can stop off at San Ziego Zoo or at Balaboa Park not to mention the other spots. The Marriott is clearly the most convenient spot to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: LAGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a business trip and the Marriott is a nice hotel but not worth the amount of money that it costs to stay there. On the positive side, it is walking distance from the Gaslamp Quarter and Seaport Village and has a Starbucks inside the lobby. The pool is nice also. On the negative side, valet parking is $24 a day, self-parking is $18 a day and the rooms are the size of any other hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: EarlyGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marina Marriott the week of 4/4 for a business meeting. Everything was fine - room was clean and comfortable, nice view of the harbor. Luckily I was traveling for business, because I felt like everything (beyond the room rate of $189) was very expensive. For example, Marriott charges $9.95/PER DAY for a high-speed internet connection in the room. Apparently a wireless connection is the same. The restaurant and room service food was expensive (room service breakfast cost about $25 for a simple Eggs Benedict, and a pot of tea was $8, before adding the requisite 20% service fee.) I used an ATM in the lobby, and the cash advance fee was $3.00. Note to self: Don't stay here for personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Service, View, rooms”
Reviews.Author: mettadreams
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay in San Diego. Walk out the back door of the hotel and you're walking bayside through the harbor, where you can ogle the sailboats, take a ferry to Coronado, eat at one of the numerous outdoor cafes, shop at the Seaside Village, or walk down to see the Midway aircraft carrier. Walk out the front door and a few short blocks away is the gaslight district. The San Diego Trolley stops just across the street from the hotel and can get you to the Zoo, Balboa Park, or Tijauna. On top of all that the rooms are beautiful, recently redecorated, and every one with a balcony overlooking either the city or the bay. The staff are very accomodating, let us check in very early and upgraded us to a bay view room with a king bed. They also have an excellent concierge service and extremely friendly and helpful staff, as well as a starbucks and several nice restaurants in the hotel. It just doesnt get any better. We'd never stay anywhere else in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent three night at the hotel in December 2004 prior to picking up a cruise. The whole experience was excellent; the room we had in the south tower had been refurbished to a good standard, the bay view from the room was very attractive. The bell boys and concierge staff were all very helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel is very well situated for shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenyonsf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 5 nights at the Marriott Marina. As others have said, the bayside view is great. The pool is attractive and well landscaped. Almost all the rooms in the North Tower have balconies, but only a few in the South Tower do. The North tower is finishing being renovated, most rooms have been redone. Staff is professional. This is a high volume hotel that does a lot of conferences, so the lobby and adjoining hallways are often quite busy. It lacks much personal touch or attention to detail. Unless you have a suite the rooms are on the smaller side. The fitness center is nice but it is on top of the conference center on the next block, so it requires two elevator rides, stairs and walkways to get there - a challenge for anyone in a wheelchair. Food is decent corporate-hotel quality generally and the YatchClub restaurant overlooks the Marina. This is billed as a resort but it doesn't quite live up to that for the average traveller. If I had a boat and was staying in the suites I might like it better. If I were staying for business or booking a conference I would consider it, but for personal travel I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jaewriter
Reviews.Content: I travel quite regularly on business, which is often in top-notch hotels like the Ritz, Westin and Fairmont. On personal travel, with my family, my choices are quite different...often Embassy Suites, Marriotts, condos, or other suite hotels. I offer this information so that others can assess the range of hotels with which I am familiar. This Marriott has some strong assets: location and view. The noise from the nearby train is not horrendous, at least if you are on the bayside and used to urban sounds. The pool area is quite beautiful, but there is no view of the bay. And seagulls and ducks are the most frequent swimmers in the pool. It is not quite disgusting, but knowing the germs such birds carry, I would personally not allow my children to swim in such a pool. Food is average, as is room size. The North Tower bay room, with a terrace, is pleasant though and appears relatively updated. Bathrooms are very average. View from the terrace is great. Service is fast and solid. Value for the dollar is below average to average.

HotelInfo.Name: San Diego Marriott Marquis & Marina
HotelInfo.Address: 333 West Harbor Drive, San Diego, CA 92101
